Implement mandatory PPE usage during all mold change operations. Monthly inspections will verify PPE integrity. While this is a PPE-level control, it provides essential secondary protection given the hazardous nature of the equipment.

name: Implement Mandatory Part Deburring Quality Checkpoint
description: Establish a dedicated deburring station with trained operators as part of the post-molding quality control process. All parts must pass through automated deburring equipment followed by manual inspection before being released for packaging. This engineering and administrative control directly addresses the root cause of sharp edges on finished parts. Expected outcome: elimination of sharp edge injuries from finished parts within 60 days. Cost includes equipment retrofit and training materials.

name: Enhanced PPE Requirements for Molding Line Operators
description: Implement mandatory cut-resistant gloves (ANSI A4 rated) for all operators handling molded parts during Line B operations. Provide daily glove inspection log and replacement protocols. Conduct training session on proper glove usage and limitations. While this is a PPE-level control, it serves as interim protection until deburring processes are fully implemented.

name: Install Secondary Containment Systems in Chemical Storage
description: Install engineered secondary containment shelving units with integrated drain collection trays rated for 110% container volume capacity in the Chemical Storage and Mixing area. All chemical containers larger than 5 liters must be stored on these containment systems. This engineering control eliminates the possibility of spills reaching the floor or drain systems. Implementation includes installation of spill containment racks, drain valve systems, and collection tank with weekly inspection requirements.

name: Enhance Chemical Handling Training and Inventory Management
description: Conduct mandatory retraining for all Material Handlers and Chemical Storage staff on proper chemical handling, storage protocols, and spill response procedures. Implement a digital inventory management system that restricts access to high shelves and requires supervisor authorization for chemical movements. Create color-coded storage zones by chemical family. This administrative control includes new written procedures, daily safety briefings, and monthly competency assessments.

name: Upgrade Spill Response Equipment and Emergency Drainage
description: Install emergency spill containment kits at 4 strategic locations throughout chemical handling areas, upgrade stormwater drain systems with check valves to prevent backflow into facility, and establish a dedicated hazardous waste collection sump with secondary containment. Train 6 designated emergency responders on spill containment procedures with quarterly drills. This combination of engineering and administrative controls ensures rapid response capability.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a comprehensive predictive maintenance program for all hydraulic equipment using ultrasonic monitoring and oil analysis testing. Schedule quarterly inspections of hydraulic line integrity using thermographic imaging to detect early degradation. Replace hydraulic systems older than 15 years with modern, sealed systems. Maintain spare hydraulic line kits on-site for emergency replacement. This engineering control prevents future leaks through early detection and system modernization.

name: Upgrade Stormwater Containment and Drainage Infrastructure
description: Install secondary containment barriers around all hydraulic equipment with dedicated sump collection systems connected to oil-water separators before connection to stormwater infrastructure. Install check valves in all stormwater drain lines to prevent backflow. Create designated hydraulic fluid collection areas with absorbent containment trays. Conduct facility drainage system audit and map all connections to municipal systems.

name: Environmental Compliance Documentation and Reporting Procedures
description: Document all environmental incidents with detailed reporting to CNESST and Quebec Ministry of Environment as required. Establish written procedures for environmental incident response, including notification timelines, documentation requirements, and remediation protocols. Create monthly environmental compliance audits and maintain a registry of all hazardous material spills with follow-up verification. Implement staff training on environmental reporting obligations.

name: Upgrade Ventilation System in Chemical Storage Area
description: Install a dedicated high-capacity fume extraction system with local exhaust ventilation hoods above all chemical transfer and mixing stations. System will be equipped with activated carbon filters and real-time air quality monitoring sensors. Installation will include automated alerts when vapor levels exceed OSHA PEL thresholds. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of inadequate ventilation during chemical handling operations and reduces solvent vapor exposure by an estimated 85-90%.

name: Implement Secondary Containment for Hazardous Chemicals
description: Install secondary containment trays beneath all chemical storage racks and transfer points in the mixing area. Trays will have capacity to hold 110% of the largest container volume. Establish new procedures requiring all chemical transfers to occur within designated containment zones. Train all personnel on proper drum positioning, handling techniques, and spill response protocols. This eliminates the consequence of large uncontained spills and provides time for emergency response before environmental or health impact.

name: Mandatory Respiratory Protection Training and Equipment Provision
description: Provide all personnel working in chemical storage and mixing areas with fitted N95 or powered air-purifying respirator (PAPR) masks. Conduct comprehensive fit-testing for all affected employees and require annual refit validation. Establish a respiratory protection program compliant with OSHA 1910.134, including proper donning/doffing procedures and maintenance schedules. While PPE is a lower-level control, it serves as interim protection during the 45-day ventilation system upgrade implementation period.

name: Install Mechanical Mold-Locking Devices with Stored Energy Release
description: Install redundant mechanical latching systems on all injection molding equipment that physically locks the mold in the open position regardless of electrical or hydraulic system status. Each latch will incorporate a pressure relief valve that must be manually actuated by a keyed lockout device. This eliminates the hazard of unexpected mold closure during maintenance or troubleshooting, preventing the root cause of this incident. The system will be interlocked with LOTO procedures so no one can operate equipment without first securing the mechanical lock.

name: Mandatory LOTO Certification and Competency Verification
description: Require all production and maintenance personnel to complete OSHA-compliant lockout/tagout certification within 30 days. Implement quarterly competency assessments and mock lockout drills on all equipment types. Establish zero-tolerance policy: any employee found operating equipment without proper LOTO will receive immediate disciplinary action and mandatory retraining. Create a lockout equipment inventory system with logs tracking all LOTO device usage. This administrative control ensures all personnel understand and comply with LOTO requirements before equipment servicing.

name: Retrofit Injection Molds with Mechanical Guard Shields
description: Install removable mesh or polycarbonate guard shields around all mold cavities on injection molding lines, making the pinch points physically inaccessible during equipment operation. Guards will only be removable using specialized tools and must be reinstalled before equipment can be energized. Modify training procedures to emphasize that equipment shutdown is insufficient—LOTO and guard inspection must occur before any hand entry near molds. This engineering control prevents inadvertent contact with hazardous mold surfaces.

name: Replace Wooden Pallets with Molded Plastic Pallets in Laboratory
description: Eliminate all wooden pallets from the Quality Control Laboratory and replace with injection-molded polypropylene pallets that are non-splintering, durable, and compatible with medical device manufacturing cleanliness requirements. Plastic pallets can be easily sanitized, eliminating contamination risks to test specimens. This substitution control directly removes the hazard of splinter injuries and prevents material contamination that could affect product sterility compliance for ISO 13485 certification.

name: Implement Mandatory Mold Cool-Down Protocol
description: Establish and enforce a documented procedure requiring all injection molds to be cooled to safe handling temperature (below 50°C) before any maintenance or cleaning operations commence. Install temperature indicators on all molds showing safe/unsafe zones. Require operators to verify and document cool-down completion on a checklist before beginning work. This eliminates direct contact with high-temperature surfaces by ensuring thermal energy is dissipated. The procedure will be incorporated into the daily pre-shift checklist and monitored during JHSC monthly inspections. Expected outcome: 100% compliance with cool-down procedures within 60 days.

name: Upgrade to Heat-Resistant Work Gloves
description: Replace all standard cotton work gloves in production areas with rated heat-resistant gloves (minimum 250°C rating) certified to ASTM F2675 standards. Distribute new gloves to all 120 day-shift workers and create a replacement schedule with monthly audits. Conduct 30-minute training session for all operators on proper glove selection and use. Store gloves in designated bins at each machine workstation for immediate access. This engineering/PPE control provides a secondary protective barrier against thermal contact burns. Expected outcome: 90% reduction in thermal burn incidents in molding operations.

name: Establish Equipment Inspection and Replacement Program
description: Create a comprehensive preventive maintenance schedule for all material handling equipment, including hopper securing straps, with 90-day inspection intervals. Implement a digital tracking system in the maintenance department to flag equipment approaching replacement thresholds. All straps rated for heavy-duty material hoppers will be replaced with corrosion-resistant stainless steel variants rated for 300+ pound loads. Maintenance personnel will photograph and document all inspections. Non-compliance will trigger automatic work order generation. This engineering control eliminates the risk of strap failure by proactive replacement. Expected outcome: Zero hopper-related crush incidents through preventive equipment replacement.

name: Implement Hopper Movement Safety Procedure with Two-Person Verification
description: Establish a mandatory two-person verification protocol for all hopper repositioning tasks. Before moving any hopper, both operators must visually inspect and sign off on strap condition using a standardized checklist. All hoppers must be secured to a fixed point using redundant backup straps during repositioning. Operators will attend a 45-minute training session on proper hopper handling, load assessment, and emergency procedures. Workplace posters will be installed in UNIT-016 showing proper technique. This administrative control adds a human checkpoint layer. Expected outcome: Enhanced operator awareness and redundant safety verification on all hopper operations.

name: Install Emergency Communication System in Material Handling Zones
description: Install three emergency call buttons in UNIT-016 at strategic locations near material handling equipment. Buttons will directly connect to on-site first aid station and plant management. Test buttons monthly during safety audits. Ensure all employees receive orientation on button locations and usage during onboarding. This ensures rapid emergency response capability. While this is a preventive measure, it also ensures faster response to incidents like this one. Expected outcome: Response time to medical emergencies reduced from 4 minutes to under 2 minutes.

name: Replace Hydraulic System with High-Pressure Rated Components
description: Replace all original hydraulic hoses on the dock lift gate with premium-grade SAE 100R13 spiral-wrapped hoses rated for 350+ bar pressure with integrated burst-relief fittings. Install new reinforced mounting brackets that provide 6-inch clearance from potential contact points with equipment like pallet jacks. Upgrade the main pump filter to a 10-micron rated unit to improve system cleanliness and extend hose life. All components will carry 5-year manufacturer warranties with documented maintenance logs. This engineering control eliminates low-quality hose failure through superior component specification. Expected outcome: Elimination of hose rupture failures; 5+ year service life without hydraulic incidents.

name: Establish Hydraulic System Preventive Maintenance Schedule
description: Create a quarterly preventive maintenance program for all dock hydraulic equipment including pressure testing, hose visual inspection for wear/cracks, fluid analysis for contamination, and seal integrity verification. Maintenance records will be logged in a digital system accessible to plant management. Hydraulic fluid will be replaced annually or when analysis indicates degradation. A designated maintenance technician will lead this program. Dock operations personnel will be trained to recognize early warning signs (unusual noises, fluid leaks, reduced lift speed) and halt operations immediately. This administrative control prevents component degradation through systematic monitoring.

name: Install Secondary Hydraulic Backup System for Critical Operations
description: Install a redundant manual hydraulic hand pump system that can lower the dock lift gate in case of primary system failure, ensuring safe manual descent of any suspended loads. This backup system will be maintained in a locked cabinet adjacent to the lift gate with clear labeling and emergency procedure instructions posted nearby. All dock personnel (current and future) will receive 20-minute training on backup system operation during their induction. The manual system will be tested quarterly during maintenance audits. This engineering control ensures operational continuity and safety during primary system failures. Expected outcome: Elimination of stranded cargo and ability to safely manage equipment failure situations.

name: Mandatory LOTO Certification and Retraining Program
description: Implement a comprehensive lockout/tagout retraining program for all maintenance personnel and operators working with injection molding equipment. The training will include hands-on LOTO procedures specific to each machine type, emphasis on verifying energy isolation before beginning work, and consequences of bypassing safety systems. All affected personnel must pass a competency assessment before returning to work on production equipment. Monthly refresher sessions will be conducted, and compliance will be tracked via a centralized database.

name: Install Dual-Channel Safety Interlock System with Independent Verification
description: Replace the existing single-channel safety interlock on all injection molding machines with a redundant, dual-channel safety-rated interlock system (ISO 13849-1 PLd minimum). The new system will include two independent monitoring circuits that must both confirm mold closure before injection can occur. Install audible and visual confirmation indicators at operator stations. Conduct preventive maintenance on all interlocks every 90 days with documented certification from qualified technicians.

name: Establish Pre-Maintenance Equipment Verification Checklist
description: Create a standardized, laminated pre-maintenance checklist posted at each molding machine requiring operators to verify: (1) Energy isolation confirmed via lockout/tagout, (2) Residual pressure released from hydraulic/pneumatic systems, (3) Temperature reduced to safe levels, (4) Safety interlock functionality tested. This checklist must be completed and signed off by both the operator and maintenance technician before any work begins. Non-compliance will be tracked and addressed through safety performance reviews.

name: Implement Cut-Resistant Glove Program for Assembly Operations
description: Distribute ANSI A4 cut-resistant gloves (nitrile-coated, high-visibility) to all assembly personnel handling post-molded components with burrs or sharp edges. Establish a mandatory glove-wearing policy at the Packaging and Labeling Station. Train all operators on proper glove selection, fit verification, and care procedures. Place glove dispensers at each assembly workstation and conduct weekly inspections to ensure availability and proper usage. Include glove wear requirements in job safety analysis and daily toolbox talks.

name: Establish Segregated Storage Zones for Flammable Materials and Ignition Sources
description: Redesignate the Hazardous Waste Management Area with clearly marked zones: a 50-foot minimum separation between uncured resin waste storage and the forklift charging station. Install secondary containment for all epoxy waste containers. Move the propane charging station outside the chemical storage building or establish a dedicated enclosed charging chamber with ventilation meeting NFPA 30B standards. Install permanent signage indicating flammable material storage and prohibited ignition sources. Conduct weekly inspections of zone boundaries.

name: Clear and Document Fire Suppression System Accessibility
description: Immediately remove all materials obstructing fire suppression nozzles and sprinkler head coverage in the Hazardous Waste Management Area. Establish a 3-foot clearance radius around all fire suppression equipment as per NFPA standards. Implement a monthly inspection protocol documented on a facility checklist verifying all sprinkler heads and nozzles are unobstructed. Train all warehouse and maintenance personnel on fire suppression system protection requirements during quarterly safety meetings.

name: Implement Automatic Flash Deflashing System
description: Install an inline deflashing unit on Injection Molding Line D to automatically remove flash from parts immediately after molding. This engineering control will eliminate the primary hazard of sharp edges by removing them at the source before manual handling. The system will integrate with the existing molding cycle, adding approximately 8 seconds per part. Expected outcome: Complete elimination of flash-related hand injuries on Line D and improved part quality consistency.

name: Enhanced PPE and Work Procedure Update
description: Provide all Line D operators with cut-resistant gloves rated for handling sharp plastic edges and update the standard operating procedure to require glove usage during all part removal and handling operations. Conduct a 30-minute training session with all shift operators on proper glove selection, donning/doffing, and inspection procedures. This administrative control combined with PPE will provide interim protection while engineering improvements are being implemented.

name: Replace Temperature Control and Pressure Relief Systems
description: Install a new dual-redundant temperature control system with independent sensors and a backup thermostat cutoff at 110°C. Replace all pressure relief valves on resin dryers with high-sensitivity models rated for rapid depressurization. This engineering control eliminates the root cause by preventing both temperature excursions and pressure buildup. All three dryers in UNIT-016 will be retrofitted within 30 days.

name: Comprehensive Preventive Maintenance Program Overhaul
description: Implement a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that tracks all preventive maintenance tasks for drying equipment with automated alerts when maintenance is overdue. Establish monthly inspections of temperature sensors and pressure valves instead of the previous 6-month schedule. Train all maintenance technicians on proper inspection procedures and the critical importance of adhering to maintenance windows. This administrative control ensures equipment reliability and operator safety.

name: Install Emergency Steam Venting and Enclosure Guards
description: Install protective polycarbonate guards around the access panels of all resin dryers to contain any steam or desiccant releases. Add a remotely operated emergency venting system that can be activated from 6 feet away to safely release pressure before opening access panels. This engineering control provides secondary protection by containing hazardous releases and allowing safe depressurization.

name: Implement Automated Load Monitoring System
description: Install load cell sensors on all pallet racks in UNIT-007 that provide real-time weight distribution feedback to a centralized monitoring dashboard. The system will alert warehouse personnel when weight imbalances exceed safe thresholds (>15% variance between rack columns) and will provide visual indicators directly on racks. This engineering control eliminates improper load stacking by providing immediate feedback to operators.

name: Comprehensive Warehouse Stacking Procedure and Training Program
description: Develop detailed illustrated stacking procedures specific to each material type (polycarbonate, polyethylene, ABS, nylon variants) with maximum stack heights and load distributions. Conduct mandatory 2-hour training for all warehouse personnel with competency certification required before independent stacking operations. Implement quarterly refresher training and monthly supervised observations by warehouse supervisors. Establish a peer-review system where experienced staff audit new stacking arrangements.

name: Replace Hydraulic Pressure Release Valve
description: Order and install a new hydraulic pressure release valve assembly for Injection Molding Line A with improved corrosion-resistant materials. The replacement valve will include updated sealing surfaces rated for the operating pressure specifications. Installation will be completed by the Maintenance and Engineering department with full LOTO procedures. The old valve will be sent for analysis to determine root cause of premature corrosion. This directly addresses the failure mode identified during preventive inspection.

name: Establish Quarterly Valve Inspection Protocol
description: Implement a formalized quarterly inspection schedule for all pressure release valves across injection molding lines. Production operators will be trained to identify visual signs of corrosion, leakage, and heat damage. Inspections will be documented in the maintenance management system with photographic records. Any valve showing corrosion or leakage will trigger immediate replacement rather than repair. This administrative control will detect similar issues before they become critical failures.

name: Redesign Assembly Workstation Layout
description: Reconfigure the automotive assembly line workstation by repositioning the curing station and conveyor orientation to eliminate the need for operators to reach across moving equipment. Install physical barriers (guardrails) around conveyor sections where reaching is prohibited. Add a transfer table positioned perpendicular to the conveyor to allow safe placement and removal of parts without crossing over machinery. This engineering control eliminates the root cause by redesigning the workspace to remove the hazardous task.

name: Install Conveyor Safety Interlocks
description: Install proximity sensors and automatic conveyor shutdown interlocks on all transfer conveyors in the Assembly and Finishing Department. These sensors will detect body parts or objects approaching the danger zone and automatically halt conveyor motion. Sensors will be mounted at waist height to detect reaching motions. All operators will be trained on the new safety system and emergency stop procedures. This engineering control provides redundant protection against entanglement incidents.

name: Install Electrical Enclosure Ventilation System
description: Install a dedicated ventilation system with HEPA filtration and humidity control around all electrical junction boxes and control panels in the Chemical Storage and Mixing building. This will maintain enclosure temperatures below 40°C and humidity below 50% to prevent moisture accumulation and dust buildup. The system will include automated monitoring with alerts to maintenance staff if parameters drift outside acceptable ranges. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of moisture and dust accumulation in electrical enclosures.

name: Upgrade Electrical Panel Protection and Inspection Protocol
description: Replace existing standard junction boxes with sealed, weatherproof enclosures rated for moisture-prone environments. Install infrared thermography monitoring to detect hot spots indicating electrical stress. Implement monthly inspection protocol for all electrical enclosures including visual inspection, thermal imaging, and dust removal using approved methods. All findings documented in facility maintenance system. This combination of engineering upgrade and administrative control provides multiple layers of protection against electrical fire hazards.

name: Conduct Fire Safety and Evacuation Drill
description: Schedule a comprehensive fire safety training and evacuation drill for all facility personnel within 30 days of the incident. Training will cover fire prevention, proper use of fire suppression systems, evacuation procedures, and assembly point protocols. Special focus on roles of emergency response team members. Conduct drill with simulated fire alarm activation and timed evacuation to verify all personnel safely reach assembly points. Document results and address any gaps in response procedures. This administrative control reinforces preparedness for future fire incidents.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Protocol
description: Establish a dual-verification lockout/tagout system where two authorized personnel must independently verify that all energy sources are isolated before maintenance begins. Create laminated LOTO checklists posted directly on each injection molding machine. Require photographic documentation of completed lockout procedures sent to the shift supervisor before work commences. All production supervisors and maintenance technicians will receive refresher training on LOTO procedures within 7 days, with competency assessments required. Monthly LOTO audits by the HSE department will be conducted with results reported to the JHSC.

name: Install Machine Restart Prevention Interlock
description: Install electronic interlocks on all injection molding machines that prevent restart for 30 seconds after emergency stop activation, and require manual reset of the safety circuit by a designated operator. Add proximity sensors to machine mold areas that trigger automatic machine shutdown if any foreign object (hand, tool) enters the danger zone during operation. Configure alarm systems to alert all personnel within the production area when a machine is being restarted.

name: Enhance Emergency Stop Accessibility and Visibility
description: Relocate and enlarge emergency stop buttons on all production machines to ensure they are immediately visible and accessible without obstruction. Paint bright yellow and red safety zones around all danger points on injection molding equipment. Install audible warning systems that sound 5 seconds before any machine restart cycle begins. Conduct tool box talks every Monday at shift change focusing on hazard recognition in high-risk areas.

name: Establish Predictive Maintenance Program for Resin Dryers
description: Implement a digital maintenance tracking system that automatically schedules preventive maintenance for all resin dryers every 6 months. Install temperature monitoring sensors with data logging capability to track thermal performance trends and alert maintenance staff to anomalies. Replace faulty thermostats and temperature control modules on all units immediately. Create a preventive maintenance checklist including inspection of heating elements, calibration of temperature sensors, and cleaning of internal ducts. Designate Marco Rossi (EMP-00016) as primary technician responsible for monthly inspections and quarterly reports to HSE department.

name: Install Thermal Cutoff and Emergency Cooling Systems
description: Install redundant thermal cutoff switches set at 170°C on all resin dryers as secondary protection against overheating events. Implement automated emergency shutdown procedures that activate if primary temperature controls fail. Add emergency cooling fan systems that activate automatically if temperatures exceed threshold. All systems will have manual override capabilities and will trigger audible and visual alarms. The maintenance team will conduct quarterly testing of all emergency systems to ensure functionality.

name: Implement Comprehensive Facility Marking and Lighting Upgrade
description: Paint all structural columns with high-visibility reflective materials using a 12-inch striping pattern that remains visible under all lighting conditions. Install motion-activated LED lighting in all warehouse and assembly areas to enhance visibility during evening and night shifts. Mark all fixed obstacles, low-clearance areas, and pinch points with retro-reflective tape and signage. Create a quarterly facility inspection schedule to refresh all markings and ensure compliance with visibility standards. Train all equipment operators on the new marking system during shift briefings.

name: Upgrade Forklift Warning and Load Management Systems
description: Install high-decibel backup alarms (minimum 97 dB) on all forklifts that operate in high-noise production areas, ensuring operators and nearby personnel receive clear auditory warning. Implement load sensing technology with visual display screens showing real-time load weight and center of gravity. Mount wide-angle convex mirrors on assembly areas where blind spots exist. Establish a mandatory forklift pre-operation inspection protocol that includes verification of all warning systems and lighting. Conduct refresher training for all forklift operators on load handling and hazard awareness.

name: Establish Material Storage Integrity Audits
description: Create a weekly inspection protocol for all pallet stacking and storage arrangements to ensure materials are properly secured and load limits are respected. Implement stack height limitations based on pallet type and material weight. Require all materials to be secured with shrink wrap or banding, with particular attention to composite materials that can shift during transport. Document all inspections in a log reviewed by warehouse supervisors. Provide staff training on proper pallet loading techniques following hierarchy of load placement.

name: Implement Equipment Maintenance Communication Protocol
description: Establish a formal daily communication system where maintenance activities are logged on a prominent board at each production station. When deburring or other critical equipment is taken offline, supervisors must notify all relevant operators and document the bypass with expected return-to-service time. This administrative control ensures operators are aware of temporary bypasses and can implement manual inspection procedures. Training will be provided to all supervisors during the next safety meeting.

name: Install Protective Guards on Deburring Station Bypass
description: Design and install a temporary protective guard or container system that prevents unfinished components from reaching the assembly station when the deburring equipment is offline. This engineering control will physically block the hazard at the source. A removable guard will be fabricated from polycarbonate to allow visibility while preventing component flow during maintenance periods.

name: Conduct Preventive Maintenance on Hydraulic Pressure Sensors
description: Implement a quarterly preventive maintenance schedule for all hydraulic pressure sensors on injection molding machines (32 units facility-wide). This includes sensor calibration, visual inspection for wear, and replacement of sensors approaching end-of-life. Maintenance records will be tracked digitally. This administrative/preventive control targets the root cause of the malfunction and reduces recurrence risk by ensuring sensor accuracy within manufacturer specifications.

name: Upgrade Emergency Stop Response Testing
description: Establish a monthly emergency stop system test protocol for all injection molding machines. Each machine will undergo a controlled activation test to verify response time and proper mold disengagement. Results will be documented and shared with operators during toolbox talks. This ensures the safety system that prevented injury remains reliable and builds operator confidence in automatic protective systems.

name: Install Aisle Safety Barriers and Load Retention Systems
description: Install permanent protective barriers at the end of each high-storage aisle to prevent forklift overshoot into shelving units. Additionally, retrofit all storage racks with mesh or bar-type load retention systems designed to prevent items from sliding or falling when adjacent equipment comes into contact with the structure. These engineering controls eliminate the hazard of falling loads from unstable interaction with powered equipment.

name: Mandatory Forklift Operation Recertification and Aisle Navigation Training
description: Require all forklift operators (8 personnel) to complete recertification training emphasizing load stability, aisle navigation at height, and communication protocols. Training will include video simulation of near-miss scenarios and discussion of the incident. Operators will be tested on knowledge of maximum turning angles in confined spaces and required speeds. This administrative control addresses operator knowledge gaps and establishes clear operational boundaries.

name: Implement Daily Warehouse Safety Audits and Aisle Inspections
description: Assign a rotating daily safety audit responsibility to warehouse associates to inspect aisles for obstructions, check load stability, and document observations. A simple checklist will be used and results posted. This administrative control increases awareness of storage integrity and enables early identification of precariously-stacked or damaged loads before they create hazards.

name: Reinstall and Secure Regrind Equipment Guards
description: Immediately inspect and reinstall all rotating equipment guards in the Regrind and Recycling Department, particularly around auger blades and hopper mechanisms. Implement locking mechanisms to prevent accidental dislodging during maintenance. All guards will be fastened with tamper-evident fasteners and checked during daily equipment startup. Maintenance technicians will be required to document guard reinstallation and integrity checks. This engineering control eliminates direct contact with rotating machinery.

name: Establish Equipment Guard Verification Checklist
description: Develop and implement a daily pre-shift equipment guard inspection checklist for all regrind machinery. Supervisors will verify that all guards are in place and secure before operating equipment. Any guards found loose or missing will result in equipment shutdown until repairs are completed. Training will be provided to all operators and maintenance staff on proper guard installation and reporting procedures.

name: Replace and Upgrade Ventilation System Filters
description: Procure and install high-capacity composite dust filters rated for fine particulate in the Post-Processing and Heat Treatment facility. Replace existing filters with MERV-15 rated filters designed specifically for composite fiber dust. Schedule filter replacement every 30 days instead of the previous 60-day cycle. Establish a monitoring system using differential pressure gauges to alert operators when filters approach saturation, preventing future blockages.

name: Implement Weekly Ventilation System Inspections
description: Establish a mandatory weekly inspection protocol for all ventilation systems in composite processing areas. Facilities Manager and maintenance team will document filter condition, duct cleanliness, and airflow measurements. Results will be logged in the maintenance tracking system. Any reduction in airflow below 95% of baseline will trigger immediate corrective action. Monthly air quality testing will verify particulate levels remain below 2.0 mg/m³.

name: Provide Respiratory Protection Training
description: All employees working in composite processing areas will receive training on respiratory hazards, proper N95 mask selection and fitting, and when respirators must be worn. Supervisors will conduct monthly refresher sessions. A fit-testing program will be established for employees who may require respirators during high-production periods. Training documentation will be maintained for compliance verification.

name: Overhaul Hydraulic System and Replace Pressure Relief Valve
description: Complete inspection and overhaul of the hydraulic system serving the robotic arm on Injection Molding Line A. Replace the faulty pressure relief valve with a new unit rated for the specified pressure range. Conduct full system pressure testing and calibration to factory specifications. Install a secondary pressure relief valve as a backup safety measure. Drain and replace all hydraulic fluid to ensure system cleanliness and proper operation.

name: Establish Predictive Maintenance Program for Hydraulic Systems
description: Implement vibration and pressure monitoring sensors on all critical hydraulic systems to predict component failures before they occur. Establish baseline pressure and vibration signatures for each system. Monthly trend analysis will identify degrading components, triggering replacement before failure. Maintenance staff will receive training on interpreting sensor data and responding to anomalies. This engineering control prevents future hydraulic-related equipment failures.

name: Enhance Robotic Equipment Guard Systems
description: Install additional protective barriers and emergency stop buttons around the robotic arm work envelope on Injection Molding Line A. Add proximity sensors that will trigger controlled deceleration if the arm approaches the conveyor system. Update safeguarding to comply with ISO 10218 standards for industrial robots. Conduct risk assessment and hazard analysis with equipment manufacturer to identify any additional protection measures needed.

name: Replace Faulty Mold Temperature Sensors
description: Conduct immediate inspection of all 32 injection molding machines to identify and replace any malfunctioning temperature sensors. Establish a preventive maintenance schedule requiring sensor calibration and replacement every 6 months. This addresses the root cause by ensuring accurate temperature monitoring prevents operator contact with excessively hot mold surfaces. All machines will be equipped with backup sensor systems where critical for operator safety.

name: Implement Thermal Burn Prevention Training
description: Develop and deliver mandatory training for all production operators on thermal hazards specific to injection molding operations, including recognition of temperature warning signs, proper use of heat-resistant gloves, safe removal techniques, and first aid response for thermal injuries. Training will be conducted quarterly and documented in employee records.

name: Upgrade Heat-Resistant PPE at All Production Lines
description: Supply all production operators with advanced heat-resistant gloves rated for 85°C and higher, featuring improved grip and dexterity for precision component handling. Gloves will be stored at each workstation and inspected monthly for degradation. This engineering and PPE control reduces direct contact injury risk during component removal operations.

name: Restore and Upgrade Lift-Assist Equipment
description: Immediately return all lift-assist devices to the composite materials staging area and conduct preventive maintenance on all units. Upgrade to pneumatic lift tables capable of handling loads up to 30 kg with one-handed operation. Establish strict maintenance protocols ensuring equipment is never removed without replacement units being installed simultaneously. This engineering control eliminates the manual lifting hazard for heavy material containers.

name: Implement Mandatory Ergonomics Training Program
description: Conduct comprehensive ergonomics training for all production staff focused on proper lifting techniques, load assessment, and use of mechanical aids. Include instruction on recognizing early signs of repetitive strain injury and reporting mechanisms. Training will be delivered by certified ergonomist and repeated annually for all employees in manual material handling roles.

name: Establish Equipment Maintenance Tracking System
description: Implement digital maintenance tracking system for all lifting and material handling equipment with automated alerts when equipment is scheduled for maintenance. System will require that replacement equipment is verified as operational before original equipment is removed from service. Weekly audits will ensure all critical safety equipment remains accessible at all production stations.

name: Resurface Warehouse Floor and Install Anti-Slip Coatings
description: Conduct comprehensive inspection of all warehouse flooring, particularly near the loading dock area. Repair all uneven surfaces and install high-friction anti-slip coatings in high-traffic material handling zones. Implement monthly floor maintenance inspections to ensure coating integrity and immediate repair of any hazardous surfaces. This engineering control eliminates the uneven floor surface that caused loss of forklift control.

name: Upgrade Pallet Securing and Load Stabilization Systems
description: Install load containment systems on all warehouse storage shelving with safety rails and containment bars designed to prevent container shifting or falling. Upgrade to load cells and weight monitoring systems on all forklifts to alert operators when loads exceed safe parameters. Provide additional training on load balancing and securing techniques for all warehouse personnel.

name: Implement Forklift Maintenance and Operator Certification Program
description: Establish quarterly forklift maintenance schedule with documented inspections of steering, braking, and load stability systems. Require all forklift operators to complete annual certification training including hazard recognition and load control in challenging conditions. Implement speed limiters on equipment operating in the warehouse, with reduced speeds near the loading dock area.

name: Install Secondary Containment Tray System
description: Install stainless steel secondary containment trays under all chemical and resin storage racks in the Raw Materials Warehouse. Trays will have a minimum capacity of 110% of the largest individual drum volume. This engineering control will prevent future spills from reaching floor drains and contaminating the facility's environmental systems. Installation will include integration with the existing inventory management system to track drum locations and weights.

name: Implement Rack Securing Procedure and Monthly Inspections
description: Develop and implement a comprehensive procedure requiring all storage racks to be secured using additional bracing and load-limiting devices. All racks will be inspected monthly by maintenance staff to verify integrity and proper weight distribution. Training will be provided to all warehouse personnel on proper loading techniques and rack safety. Documentation of inspections will be maintained in the facility's safety management system.

name: Enhance Warehouse Ventilation Monitoring
description: Install real-time air quality monitoring sensors in the Raw Materials Warehouse with automatic alerts when chemical vapor concentrations exceed safe thresholds. Integrate monitoring with the building management system to trigger automatic ventilation escalation. Conduct quarterly testing of the ventilation system's effectiveness. Train warehouse staff on responding to air quality alerts and evacuation procedures.

name: Implement Quarterly Ventilation Duct Cleaning Schedule
description: Establish a mandatory quarterly (every 3 months) professional cleaning and inspection program for all ventilation ducts in chemical storage and mixing areas. A certified industrial cleaning contractor will be engaged to remove all plastic dust and debris accumulation. Documentation of each cleaning event will be maintained and cross-referenced with facility maintenance records. Budget allocation will ensure this becomes a permanent operational requirement rather than optional maintenance.

name: Establish Hot Work Permit and Separation System
description: Implement a mandatory Hot Work Permit system for any welding, grinding, cutting, or spark-producing activities within or adjacent to chemical storage areas. All hot work must be scheduled in advance and require documented fire watch personnel during and for 30 minutes after completion. Designate specific zones for hot work that are separated from chemical storage by physical barriers or temporal segregation (no concurrent operations). Training will be provided to all affected personnel on permit procedures.

name: Install Automated Fire Detection and Suppression System
description: Install a Class D dry powder automatic fire suppression system specifically designed for combustible dust fires in the chemical storage and mixing room. Include early warning smoke and heat detectors connected to the facility fire alarm system. Install aspirating smoke detection at duct entry/exit points to provide early warning of dust ignition in ventilation systems. Conduct annual system testing and certification per NFPA standards.

name: Implement 100% Edge Deburring Verification Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory post-molding deburring and edge inspection process where all parts are physically inspected and felt-tested for sharp edges using standardized touch-testing methods. Implement a secondary verification step where a trained quality technician performs a rapid edge audit on at least 5% of all parts from each production batch. Any parts with burrs will be returned to post-processing for remediation before final release. Documentation of inspection results will be tracked in the quality management system with real-time dashboards visible to production supervisors.

name: Install Automated Spill Detection and Containment System
description: Design and install an automated spill detection system with floor-level sensors in the Chemical Storage and Mixing Room that triggers containment barriers and ventilation activation. Upgrade secondary containment to capture 110% of the largest container volume. Implement absorbent spill kits at strategic locations with clear signage and monthly inspection protocols. Train all personnel on proper activation and response procedures.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance for Transfer Equipment
description: Establish a comprehensive preventive maintenance schedule for all chemical transfer pumps and equipment in the mixing room. Schedule quarterly inspections with documented testing of pump seals, pressure relief valves, and hose integrity. Create a maintenance log and require certification of equipment before use. Train designated personnel on proper equipment operation and emergency shutdown procedures.

name: Enhanced Chemical Handling Training Program
description: Develop and deliver mandatory refresher training for all personnel handling hazardous chemicals, covering spill prevention, response procedures, proper use of containment equipment, and environmental protection measures. Include competency assessments and recertification every 12 months. Document training attendance and competency verification in personnel files.

name: Implement Mandatory Lockout/Tagout Protocol for All Mold Changes
description: Establish and enforce a comprehensive lockout/tagout (LOTO) procedure requiring complete equipment isolation before any mold changeover operations. Install lockout points at all hydraulic and electrical sources on Injection Molding Line A. Require dual-lock system where both the equipment operator and maintenance technician must place locks. Implement daily LOTO audits with documented verification. Conduct mandatory certification training for all personnel involved in equipment changeovers.

name: Establish Communication Protocol Between Crane Operators and Ground Personnel
description: Create and implement a standardized communication system requiring verbal confirmation and radio/hand signal protocols before any crane movement occurs. Install warning lights and audible alarms that activate when cranes are in motion. Require crane operators to maintain visual contact with ground personnel or use spotters. Implement weekly safety briefings and monthly competency assessments for all crane operators. Post clear signage at mold changeover stations.

name: Install Physical Protective Barriers at Pinch Points
description: Design and fabricate protective guards to prevent hand access to pinch points between molds and machine frames on Injection Molding Line A. Guards must allow necessary material handling while preventing unintended contact. Ensure guards can be easily removed for maintenance without compromising safety. Conduct engineering review and employee feedback validation before full installation. Include guards in preventive maintenance schedule.

name: Implement Equipment Safety Guard Verification Checklist
description: Develop and deploy a standardized pre-operation safety checklist for all laboratory equipment, specifically addressing the integrity and secure fastening of safety guards. Require trained personnel to complete the checklist before equipment use each shift, with documented sign-off. Include verification steps for guard attachment points, fastening hardware, and operational testing. Store checklists at each equipment station and conduct monthly audits of compliance.

name: Establish Equipment Maintenance Documentation Protocol
description: Create a comprehensive maintenance log system requiring documentation of all maintenance activities on laboratory equipment, including date, technician name, specific work performed, and post-maintenance safety verification. Implement a requirement that all maintenance must include re-verification of safety guards and protective features before equipment release to operational staff. Conduct quarterly audits of maintenance logs to ensure completeness and compliance.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Protocol
description: Establish a shift-start verification checklist requiring operators to confirm all equipment LOTO procedures are in place before operating injection molding machines. This checklist will be posted at each machine station and signed off by operators daily. Add bi-weekly audits by supervisors to ensure compliance. Training will be delivered to all production staff within 7 days, with refresher training quarterly. This administrative control directly addresses the root cause of premature mold access without proper lockout.

name: Prioritize Equipment Maintenance Backlog
description: Establish a priority repair schedule for all deferred maintenance on injection molding equipment, with timing sensors classified as critical safety components requiring completion within 48 hours of identification. Assign dedicated maintenance technician during day shift to address backlog. Implement a system where equipment with pending safety-critical repairs is tagged and removed from production rotation. This engineering control removes the hazard of sensor malfunction.

name: Install Automated Mold Safety Interlocks
description: Retrofit all 32 injection molding machines with redundant mold-closed position sensors that prevent mold closure when the cavity detection system indicates human presence. This engineering control will eliminate the possibility of crush injuries from unexpected mold closure. Installation will be completed over 60 days, prioritizing Line A and Line B first. Cost includes parts, labor, and system integration testing.

name: Install Secondary Containment System
description: Install 10-liter capacity chemical containment trays beneath all chemical transfer stations in the Material Drying and Preparation Room. The trays will be equipped with absorbent pads and drain plugs to capture spills immediately and prevent contact with storm drains. Place spill kits containing neutralizers, absorbent materials, and disposal containers within arm's reach of each transfer point. This engineering control eliminates the pathway for chemicals to reach the storm drain system.

name: Implement Chemical Container Inspection and Replacement Program
description: Conduct monthly inspections of all chemical containers for grip degradation, cracks, and structural integrity. Replace any containers showing wear within 30 days. Establish a maximum container age of 18 months and schedule systematic replacement. Provide technicians with anti-slip grip gloves and require their use during all chemical handling activities. This combination of engineering and administrative controls prevents container failure and improves operator grip.

name: Establish Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Ventilation Systems
description: Implement a monthly oil analysis and filter inspection program for all ventilation system motors in chemical storage areas. Schedule motor bearing lubrication every 30 days and bearing replacement every 24 months regardless of apparent condition. Create a tracking log that maintenance technicians must sign off on weekly. Install vibration sensors on critical ventilation motors that alert facility management when abnormal vibration is detected. This administrative and engineering control prevents recurring ventilation failures.

name: Install Redundant Ventilation System with Automatic Switchover
description: Design and install a backup ventilation unit for the Chemical Storage and Mixing Room that automatically activates if primary system airflow drops below 50% of design specifications. Both units will be sized to maintain minimum 6 air changes per hour independently. Install continuous air quality monitoring with real-time alerts to the facility control system and HSE team. This engineering control eliminates the hazard of inadequate ventilation during equipment failure.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a mandatory preventive maintenance program for all hydraulic pressure relief valves across all injection molding lines. Maintenance will occur every 12 months and include pressure testing, seal inspection, and valve calibration. Create a digital tracking system to monitor compliance and send automated reminders to the Maintenance and Engineering department. Document all maintenance activities in a central database. This addresses the root cause of the equipment failure and ensures relief valves maintain proper functioning within manufacturer specifications.

name: Install Secondary Pressure Relief Valve with Safety Alert System
description: Install a redundant secondary pressure relief valve on Injection Molding Line D and all other high-pressure lines as a backup safety control. Additionally, integrate a pressure monitoring sensor that triggers an audible and visual alarm if pressure exceeds 2200 PSI, providing operators with early warning before critical failure. This engineering control implements the hierarchy of controls by providing a fail-safe mechanism and preventing hazardous situations from developing.

name: Enhanced Operator Training on Hydraulic System Safety
description: Develop and deliver comprehensive training module for all injection molding operators covering hydraulic system fundamentals, pressure safety limits, warning signs of equipment malfunction, and emergency shutdown procedures. Training will include hands-on demonstration of the pressure monitoring system and practice scenarios. Conduct quarterly refresher training and maintain training records. This administrative control ensures operators can recognize early warning signs and respond appropriately to prevent injuries.

name: Establish Immediate Floor Spill Response Protocol
description: Create a standardized spill response procedure requiring immediate notification to Facilities Management when any fluid spill is discovered. Establish that spills must be completely cleaned and dried to standards, with specific attention to residual film removal on concrete surfaces. Place 'Wet Floor' warning signs in affected areas until complete remediation is confirmed. Implement daily floor inspection rounds in high-traffic material handling areas to identify and address any spills before they create slip hazards. Assign responsibility to warehouse supervisors for enforcement.

name: Conduct Powered Equipment Operator Refresher Training
description: Provide refresher training to all personnel who operate powered pallet jacks and forklifts, emphasizing safe operation on various floor conditions, emergency response techniques, and situational awareness. Include specific scenarios involving unexpected traction loss and proper response procedures. Training will cover pre-operation equipment checks and floor condition assessment before each use. Require participants to demonstrate competency through practical skills evaluation.

name: Install Physical Deflection Barrier on Mixing Chamber
description: Engineer and install a polycarbonate deflection shield around the mixing chamber opening that redirects and dissipates high-pressure air and particles away from operator face level. The shield will be designed to allow visual inspection while protecting the operator. This engineering control implements the hierarchy of controls by removing the direct line-of-fire exposure that created the hazard.

name: Mandatory Safety Glasses and Face Protection for Compressed Air Operations
description: Establish administrative policy requiring operators to wear ANSI Z87.1 certified safety glasses with polycarbonate side shields, and to wear full face shields when performing compressed air cleaning operations. Ensure face shields are certified for high-pressure air use. Provide equipment at the cleaning station and conduct enforcement checks. This PPE control provides secondary protection while engineering controls are being implemented.

name: Replace Hopper Mounting Hardware with Corrosion-Resistant Fasteners
description: Replace all corroded aluminum bolts on material hoppers with stainless steel 316-grade fasteners that are resistant to moisture and humidity. Install protective caps over bolt heads to prevent water accumulation. Implement a quarterly inspection schedule for all hopper fastening systems. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of hardware degradation in the humid Material Drying and Preparation Room environment.

name: Install Secondary Containment Barriers Around Hoppers
description: Install rigid polycarbonate safety barriers around all elevated material hoppers to catch and redirect any falling components away from personnel and equipment below. Barriers will be 6 feet tall with adequate clearance for material flow. This engineering control provides secondary protection should fastening systems fail in the future.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Checklist System
description: Develop and deploy a mandatory pre-maintenance LOTO verification checklist that must be completed and signed by both the maintenance technician and a supervisor before any equipment work begins. The checklist will confirm that all energy sources (electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic) are properly isolated, locked, and verified de-energized. Display laminated checklist cards at each injection molding line. Conduct monthly audits of LOTO compliance by the LOTO Coordinator.

name: Install Audible and Visual Machine Startup Warning System
description: Install horn-and-light warning systems on all injection molding lines that activate 5 seconds before any automatic cycle or manual startup command. The system will include a 95dB audible alarm and rotating amber beacon visible from all work positions around the machine. Integrate the warning into the machine control logic so it cannot be bypassed. This engineering control provides an additional layer of protection against unexpected machine activation.

name: Mandatory LOTO Retraining for All Production and Maintenance Staff
description: Conduct comprehensive LOTO refresher training for all 120 day-shift and 60 evening-shift employees involved in machine operation and maintenance. Training will include hands-on demonstrations, scenario-based exercises, and competency assessments. Emphasize the consequences of bypassing procedures and the requirement for independent verification. Schedule training in rotating groups to maintain production. Repeat annually and after any LOTO-related incident.

name: Implement Chemical Segregation and Storage System with Color-Coded Zones
description: Redesign the Chemical Storage and Mixing area with physically separated storage zones for incompatible chemical classes: flammables, oxidizers, corrosives, and reactives. Install color-coded shelving and floor markings per NFPA 704 guidelines. Create detailed chemical compatibility matrix posters at each storage zone. Implement RFID-tagged container tracking system to ensure chemicals are placed in correct zones. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of the fire by preventing incompatible material contact.

name: Replace Wire Shelving with Heavy-Duty Secured Storage Cabinets
description: Replace all open wire shelving in the chemical storage area with NFPA 30-compliant heavy-duty steel storage cabinets with secure latching mechanisms and vibration-resistant leveling feet. Install secondary containment trays beneath all shelves to capture spills. All cabinets will be bolted to the floor and wall structure. This eliminates the possibility of containers tipping due to vibration or movement.

name: Enhance Night Shift Chemical Storage Training and Inspections
description: Develop specialized chemical storage and fire prevention training specifically for night-shift employees who have limited supervision. Training will cover chemical compatibility, proper container placement, spill response, and fire suppression system operation. Implement mandatory daily 15-minute checklist inspections by night-shift personnel of the chemical storage area, documented in a log book reviewed by HSE staff each morning. Conduct quarterly surprise audits by the Safety Officer.

name: Install Automated Fire Detection and Suppression Upgrades
description: Install advanced fire detection sensors (flame and heat detection combined) in the chemical storage area with direct alarm connection to local fire department and 24/7 facility monitoring service. Upgrade existing dry chemical suppression system to include pre-action valve with manual override. Install additional portable ABC-type fire extinguishers rated for solvent fires at 15-foot maximum spacing. Post clear operational instructions on all equipment.

name: Implement Equipment Dust Control Program
description: Install vacuum extraction systems at all resin dryer and post-processing equipment to eliminate dust accumulation. Conduct weekly preventive maintenance cleaning using HEPA-filtered vacuums to remove all combustible resin dust from equipment frames, work surfaces, and electrical enclosures. Establish written procedures requiring daily visual inspection of work areas for dust buildup. Train all maintenance staff on proper dust removal protocols and hazards of accumulated resin dust around heated equipment. This engineering and administrative control directly addresses the root cause of fire ignition.

name: Upgrade Electrical Panel Safety Systems
description: Replace existing electrical control panels on resin dryers with sealed, pressurized enclosures that prevent dust ingress and arc propagation. Install redundant temperature monitoring sensors with automatic shutdown at 95°C to prevent overheating conditions. Implement quarterly thermographic inspections of all electrical connections to detect hotspots before failure. These engineering controls will significantly reduce electrical arc risk and equipment overheating incidents.

name: Establish Warehouse Rack Stability Protocol
description: Install anti-tip bracing cables and base reinforcement anchors on all tall storage racks in UNIT-008 to prevent toppling from minor forklift impacts. Implement a weekly visual inspection checklist to verify structural integrity, cable tension, and base stability. Mark all racks with maximum load capacity labels and weight distribution guidelines. Designate specific forklift lanes away from high-value storage racks to eliminate contact risk. This eliminates the primary hazard causing the material cascade.

name: Improve Chemical Storage Segregation
description: Relocate all acetone-based mold release agent containers to a dedicated, ventilated chemical storage cabinet located at least 5 meters away from plastic material storage racks. Install secondary containment trays beneath all chemical containers with 150% volume capacity. Implement color-coded labeling system (red for flammable, yellow for oxidizers) on all chemical containers and storage locations. Conduct quarterly inventory audits to ensure proper chemical segregation and prevent incompatible material storage.

name: Install Mold Press Safety Interlock System
description: Replace existing manual mold opening mechanisms with dual-channel safety interlocks that prevent mold closure whenever a hand sensor detects human presence in the mold cavity area. Install pressure relief valves with redundant backup systems to ensure immediate depressurization if primary valve fails. Implement mechanical pin stops that physically prevent mold closure beyond a safe distance. All new systems must meet ISO 13850 emergency stop requirements and be tested quarterly. This engineering control eliminates the possibility of crush injuries during normal operation.

name: Mandate Personal Protective Equipment for Mold Operations
description: Issue Level 3 cut-resistant gloves (EN 388 rating 4544) and impact-absorbing palm protection to all personnel handling mold operations. Require steel-toed boots and reinforced aprons for the mold shop environment. Implement mandatory inspection of PPE before each shift and quarterly replacement cycles. Establish documented training for proper donning and fit verification. Although PPE is a secondary control, it provides critical protection during the transition period before engineering controls are fully implemented.

name: Establish Mold Operating Procedure and Training Protocol
description: Develop comprehensive written operating procedures for all two-plate injection presses specifying never removing components while mold is under pressure. Implement mandatory lockout/tagout (LOTO) procedures requiring mold isolation and pressure relief before any hand insertion into mold cavity. Conduct monthly competency-based training for all personnel operating or working near injection presses, with documented sign-off. Establish buddy system requiring two personnel present during mold separation operations. Create position-specific job safety analysis (JSA) for each mold-handling task.

name: Install Predictive Temperature Monitoring System
description: Implement real-time temperature monitoring with IoT sensors on all resin dryer systems. The system will provide early warning alerts (±5°C variance threshold) to the maintenance team before critical failures occur. Predictive analytics will trigger scheduled maintenance based on equipment performance patterns rather than calendar intervals. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause—equipment malfunction from inadequate temperature control. Expected outcome: 95% reduction in thermal runaway incidents and prevention of hazardous vapor releases.

name: Upgrade Secondary Containment System
description: Install permanent secondary containment barriers around the resin dryer system capable of holding 200% of system fluid capacity. Add quick-draining sump collection system with automated discharge to hazardous waste containers. Containment area will have improved drainage slopes (minimum 2% grade) and be sealed with chemical-resistant epoxy coating. This engineering control prevents environmental contamination and reduces spill cleanup time from 45 minutes to under 15 minutes. Expected outcome: Full environmental compliance and reduced waste disposal costs by 60%.

name: Enhanced Ventilation and Vapor Recovery System
description: Upgrade exhaust ventilation in Material Drying and Preparation Room to include activated carbon filters and vapor recovery unit. Install local capture hoods directly above dryer system with minimum 300 CFM airflow. Add real-time air quality monitoring with continuous readout of VOC concentrations in ppm. Ventilation system will automatically increase capacity when VOC levels exceed 100 ppm. This administrative and engineering control reduces worker exposure to hazardous fumes during normal operations and emergency situations.

name: Install Thermal Insulation Guards on Heat Treatment Equipment
description: Apply food-grade silicone thermal insulation sleeves and guards to all exposed hot surfaces on cooling conveyor equipment that exceed 50°C. Guards will be color-coded with yellow and black hazard striping and clearly labeled with temperature warnings. Insulation materials will be removable for maintenance purposes and inspected monthly for degradation. This engineering control directly eliminates the burn hazard by preventing skin contact with hot surfaces. Expected outcome: 90% reduction in thermal contact burns in the post-processing area.

name: Install Interlocked Safety Guards and Proximity Detection System
description: Install mechanical interlocked guards on all hopper access points that physically prevent access to rotating auger components when equipment is powered on. Add redundant proximity sensors (dual-channel safety-rated sensors per ISO 13849-1) that immediately de-energize the auger system when any obstruction is detected in the danger zone. Guards must require tool-assisted removal for maintenance, and proximity sensors must be tested weekly. This is a critical engineering control that eliminates the primary hazard of machine entanglement.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO and Lockout/Tagout Enforcement Program
description: Establish and enforce strict Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) procedures requiring any equipment service, maintenance, or troubleshooting to be performed only after complete de-energization and physical lockout of all power sources. Create a mandatory pre-shift safety briefing specific to hopper maintenance emphasizing prohibition of manual intervention while equipment is energized. Develop role-specific training certification for personnel authorized to perform equipment maintenance. Include consequences for non-compliance in performance management. This administrative control ensures workers follow proven safety procedures.

name: Establish Restricted Area Access and Signage Protocol
description: Install high-visibility warning signage (ISO 3864 compliant) at all hopper access points indicating 'DANGER - ENERGIZED EQUIPMENT - NO HAND ENTRY'. Paint yellow caution stripes on floor marking 1-meter exclusion zone around hopper areas during equipment operation. Require badge-activated access control for maintenance personnel only, logged with timestamped records. Conduct monthly toolbox talks on hopper hazards and near-miss reporting. This layered administrative control emphasizes the hazard and restricts unaware personnel from accessing dangerous areas.

name: Implement Quarterly Hydraulic System Inspections
description: Establish a comprehensive preventive maintenance program for all hydraulic systems on injection molding lines, including quarterly inspections of pressure relief valves, hose integrity, and system pressurization. All inspections will be documented and tracked through the maintenance management system. Training will be provided to maintenance technicians on proper hydraulic system diagnostics. This measure eliminates the root cause of equipment malfunction by ensuring early detection of failing components before they cause incidents.

name: Install Thermal Protective Guards on Mold Ejection Points
description: Design and fabricate heat-resistant polycarbonate guards around all hot plastic ejection points on Lines A and B injection molding equipment. Guards will be positioned to prevent direct contact with pressurized hot material while maintaining visibility for process monitoring. Engineering will specify materials rated for continuous exposure to 300°C temperatures. Installation will be completed on all production lines within 45 days. This engineering control physically separates workers from the burn hazard.

name: Enhanced Thermal Burn Awareness Training
description: Develop and deliver mandatory training module on thermal burn hazards specific to injection molding operations, including recognition of equipment malfunction signs, emergency response protocols, and proper use of cooling stations. Training will be conducted for all production operators and technicians within 30 days, with annual refresher training thereafter. Module will include case study of this incident to reinforce learning.

name: Install Secondary Containment System in Chemical Preparation Room
description: Design and install a secondary containment system consisting of a 25-liter capacity catch basin with integrated absorbent material beneath all chemical transfer stations in the Material Drying and Preparation Room. The containment system will be positioned to capture 110% of the largest container volume being transferred. Drains will be equipped with shutoff valves to prevent accidental discharge into the wastewater system. Installation will be completed within 21 days to eliminate environmental discharge pathways.

name: Upgrade Ventilation System in Material Handling Zone
description: Conduct ventilation assessment of the Material Drying and Preparation Room and upgrade the HVAC system to achieve minimum air changes of 12 per hour with dedicated exhaust ducting away from occupied areas. Install vapor detection sensors that trigger automated alerts when volatile organic compound concentrations exceed 50% of the OSHA permissible exposure limit. This engineering control reduces inhalation hazards during future spill events.

name: Implement Chemical Container Inspection and Maintenance Protocol
description: Establish a monthly inspection schedule for all chemical storage containers, with particular attention to spout connectors, valve seals, and structural integrity. All containers will be tested for proper seal function before use. Defective components will be replaced immediately. Inspection records will be maintained in the chemical inventory database. Additionally, train all material handlers on proper container handling and connection procedures during monthly safety briefings.

name: Compressed Air System Overhaul and Replacement
description: Conduct a comprehensive inspection and replacement of the Assembly and Finishing Department compressed air distribution system. Replace corroded tubing sections with new stainless steel piping rated for 150 PSI continuous operation. Install new pressure relief valves with manual override capability and integrate redundant pressure sensors with automated shutoff mechanisms. All work will comply with CSA B51 Pressure Equipment Code. Project to be completed within 90 days to eliminate deteriorated equipment hazards.

name: Establish Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Compressed Air Systems
description: Develop and implement a quarterly inspection protocol for all compressed air distribution systems facility-wide, including visual inspection for corrosion, pressure testing, connection integrity checks, and valve function verification. Inspection results will be documented in the maintenance management system with risk ratings. Any components showing corrosion or deterioration will be replaced within 30 days. This administrative control ensures early detection of future system degradation.

name: Upgrade to Chemical-Resistant Glove Program
description: Implement a mandatory upgrade to industrial-grade, double-layer nitrile gloves with enhanced puncture resistance (minimum 8-mil thickness) for all operators handling mold release agents. Establish a new glove inspection protocol requiring operators to visually check gloves every 2 hours and immediately replace any with visible tears or degradation. Conduct a supplier audit to ensure gloves meet ISO 374-1 chemical protection standards. Train all production staff on proper glove donning, doffing, and inspection procedures within 5 days of implementation.

name: Enhanced Chemical Safety Signage and Training
description: Install high-visibility warning signs at all mold release agent application stations with pictograms showing skin contact hazards and first aid procedures. Create a quick-reference laminated card for each workstation detailing mold release agent properties, PPE requirements, and emergency contact information. Conduct mandatory monthly toolbox talks focused on chemical hazard awareness and skin contact prevention. Update the new employee orientation program to include a hands-on demonstration of proper glove selection and chemical exposure response procedures.

name: Implement Mechanical Lift Assist Equipment
description: Install pneumatic lifting tables at the Packaging and Labeling Station to reduce manual handling of parts weighing over 5 pounds. These tables will be adjusted to optimal working height (approximately 40 inches) to minimize bending and twisting motions. Operators will use foot pedals to raise and lower loads, eliminating cumulative back strain. Provide comprehensive training on proper equipment use and ergonomic best practices. Expected outcome: Reduce manual lifting incidents by 70% in the packaging department within 90 days.

name: Establish Mandatory Ergonomic Training and Job Rotation Program
description: Develop and implement a quarterly ergonomic training program covering proper lifting techniques, workstation setup, micro-break scheduling, and early symptom recognition for all warehouse and packaging staff. Implement a structured job rotation system where packaging operators rotate between different tasks every 2 hours to distribute physical demands across different muscle groups and minimize repetitive strain.
