Designate two night shift personnel as primary and backup system shutdown coordinators with annual certification. Conduct tabletop emergency drills monthly to ensure readiness. Coordinate with facility management and fire safety officers.

name: Upgrade Electrical Panel Protection and Equipment Isolation
description: Engineering control to relocate electrical control panels to elevated, waterproof enclosures with automatic emergency isolation valves that shut off water supply to specific zones upon pressure surge detection. Install water-resistant conduit and surge protection on all critical circuits. Implement quick-dry heat chambers to protect spare electrical components. Establish preventive maintenance inspections quarterly to verify system functionality and identify potential water intrusion points.

name: Install Automated Safety Interlock on Label Applicator
description: Retrofit the label applicator equipment with a photelectric safety sensor that detects hand presence and immediately stops roller movement within 100 milliseconds. Add emergency stop buttons positioned within easy reach of the operator's hands. This engineering control eliminates the hazard of pinching by preventing equipment operation when hands are in dangerous zones.

name: Mandate Specialized Cut-Resistant Gloves and Operator Training
description: Require all assembly operators to wear Level 5 cut-resistant gloves (ANSI A5 rated) during labeling operations. Conduct hands-on training on proper glove selection, fit verification, and limitations. Establish a policy requiring glove replacement every 4 hours or when visible damage appears. While PPE is the last resort in hierarchy of controls, the combination with machine interlocks provides comprehensive protection.

name: Establish Daily Equipment Safety Audit and Maintenance Schedule
description: Create a preventive maintenance schedule requiring daily inspection of all label applicator equipment for proper sensor function, emergency stop activation, and guard integrity. Maintenance technicians will document findings in a digital log. Any equipment showing sensor malfunction will be taken out of service immediately. This administrative control ensures equipment safeguards remain functional and operational.

name: Implement Enhanced Solvent Container Sealing and Secondary Containment
description: Replace all existing solvent storage containers with new sealed units featuring double-gasket lids and tamper-evident caps. Install secondary containment trays beneath all chemical storage that can contain 110% of the largest container volume. Establish a quarterly inspection protocol to verify container integrity and detect any signs of degradation or leakage. Implement color-coded labeling system with expiration dates. This engineering control eliminates the source of volatile fumes and prevents spills.

name: Establish Rigorous Dust Accumulation Monitoring and Removal Protocol
description: Hire professional industrial cleaning service to conduct deep cleaning of all chemical storage areas, shelving, and surrounding zones every two weeks, with special attention to dust accumulation around equipment and storage zones. Install fixed extraction ventilation ducts with HEPA filtration to maintain air quality below 0.1 mg/m³ dust concentration. Conduct weekly visual inspections by staff with photographic documentation. Implement a cleaning checklist system with supervisor sign-off requirements.

name: Install Additional Fire Detection and Suppression Equipment
description: Install supplemental smoke detectors with rapid-response capabilities (under 30 seconds) in the chemical storage zone. Add a dedicated pre-action fire suppression system directly above high-risk storage areas to activate before main sprinkler system. Conduct full system testing monthly with documented results. Train all night shift personnel on manual activation procedures and emergency response protocols. This engineering control provides redundancy and faster response capability.

name: Conduct Comprehensive Fire Safety Training and Drill Program
description: Implement quarterly mandatory fire safety training for all personnel, with special emphasis on chemical fire properties and proper response procedures. Conduct full-facility fire evacuation drills every three months with timed documentation. Update emergency response plans and distribute to all employees. Establish a fire safety committee to review incident reports and identify preventive opportunities. This administrative control ensures personnel can respond effectively to future fire events.

name: Install Secondary Containment for Flammable Liquids
description: Implement steel secondary containment trays beneath all shelving units storing acetone, isopropanol, and other flammable solvents in UNIT-025. Each tray will have a minimum capacity of 110% of the largest container stored above it. This engineering control will prevent spills from spreading across the mezzanine floor and reaching electrical equipment or drainage areas. Secondary containment will reduce environmental contamination and allow for easier cleanup and material recovery.

name: Establish Chemical Storage Inspection Protocol
description: Develop and implement a monthly chemical storage audit checklist for UNIT-025 that verifies: proper cap/seal integrity on all containers, correct shelf placement (heavier containers on lower shelves), compatibility of stored chemicals, and condition of secondary containment systems. Inventory Control Specialists and HSE staff will jointly conduct these inspections. Documentation will be maintained in the safety management system. This administrative control ensures preventive identification of storage deficiencies before incidents occur.

name: Implement Mandatory Mold Guard Replacement Before Resuming Production
description: Engineering control requiring that whenever mold edge guards or safety devices are removed for maintenance, cleaning, or inspection on any injection molding line, they must be reinspected for damage and reinstalled before the machine returns to operation. A checklist will be developed listing all guards on each mold, and maintenance technicians must sign off confirming reinstallation. Production cannot resume until the supervisor verifies guard reinstatement. This eliminates the gap that allowed continued operation with exposed sharp edges.

name: Establish Mold Inspection and Maintenance Schedule
description: Develop a preventive maintenance program for all injection molds that includes quarterly inspection of mold edges, surfaces, and safety devices for corrosion, wear, and damage. When corrosion or deterioration is detected, affected molds will be removed from service and either refurbished or replaced. A maintenance log will track all molds with their last inspection date. This administrative control prevents the accumulation of hazardous conditions that develop over time and reduces risk of sharp edge injuries.

name: Enhance Cut-Resistant PPE for Component Removal Tasks
description: Require all operators performing manual mold component removal on injection molding lines to wear cut-resistant gloves rated Level 5 (EN 388) in addition to standard work gloves. Cut-resistant gloves will be provided at each workstation. Training will emphasize proper hand positioning and awareness of sharp mold edges and components. While PPE is a lower-level control, it provides critical protection during the interim period before mold conditions can be fully assessed and managed through engineering controls.

name: Install Secondary Containment Stations at Laboratory Benches
description: Engineering control: Install polypropylene secondary containment trays (minimum 5-liter capacity) at all five laboratory bench stations where solvent handling occurs. Trays will be permanently mounted at work surface level with proper drainage and acid-resistant design. All acetone, isopropanol, and other flammable solvent transfers will be performed within designated containment stations. This physical control eliminates the risk of spills affecting sensitive analytical equipment and confines chemical vapors to specific locations.

name: Implement Solvent Handling Procedures and Training Program
description: Develop comprehensive Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for all solvent handling in the Quality Control Laboratory, including: use of secondary containment, maximum container transfer volumes (250 mL per transfer to reduce spill consequences), requirement for two-handed carrying techniques, and mandatory use of anti-slip gloves. Conduct mandatory training for all laboratory staff with documentation. SOP will be posted at each bench station. This administrative control establishes clear work practices and ensures operator understanding of hazards and proper handling techniques.

name: Implement Quarterly Cooling Hose Inspection Program
description: Establish a mandatory quarterly inspection schedule for all cooling water hoses on injection molding machines. All hoses will be visually inspected for signs of degradation, corrosion, or wear, and replaced if any defects are identified. A tracking log will be maintained for each machine. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of the pressure hose failure. Expected outcome: elimination of pressure release incidents from deteriorated hoses.

name: Mandatory Heat-Resistant PPE Requirement and Training
description: Update facility safety protocols to mandate that all injection molding operators wear ASTM-rated heat-resistant gloves (minimum 300°C rating) when working within 1.5 meters of molding machines. Conduct refresher training for all 40 production operators on proper PPE selection and use. Provide new gloves to all affected employees and establish a replacement schedule. This administrative control ensures employees have appropriate protection against thermal hazards.

name: Install Pressure Relief Valves on Cooling Lines
description: Engineer and install automatic pressure relief valves on all 32 injection molding machines to limit cooling water pressure to safe levels (maximum 3.5 bar). This engineering control prevents catastrophic pressure releases that exceed safe exposure thresholds. Relief valves will be tested quarterly. This represents a higher-order control that reduces the severity potential of future incidents.

name: Emergency Dust Removal and Facility Deep Clean
description: Immediately schedule emergency dust removal of all accumulated resin dust from ventilation ductwork, horizontal surfaces, and overhead installations. Utilize industrial vacuum systems with HEPA filtration to prevent re-suspension of dust. Complete facility deep cleaning performed by contracted cleaning service within 48 hours. This eliminates the immediate fire hazard and represents an urgent response to the preventive declaration.

name: Enhance Dust Collection Maintenance Schedule
description: Revise dust collection system maintenance from 2-week to 1-week intervals and implement electronic tracking system with automatic work order generation. Assign Normand Ouellette (Warehouse Lead) as primary responsible party with weekly sign-off required. Install dust collection monitoring sensors that alert facility manager when collection efficiency drops below 85%. This administrative control ensures preventive maintenance protocols are actually followed.

name: Install Automated Dust Suppression System
description: Engineer and install automated dry powder suppression system (Type D powder, ABC classification) in ventilation header area above raw materials warehouse. System includes automatic triggers when dust particle density exceeds safe levels and manual activation capability. Pair with revised ventilation protocols that include continuous monitoring of airflow adequacy. This engineering control provides automated response to dust accumulation hazards.

name: Install Secondary Containment for All Chemical Storage
description: Implement secondary containment systems (minimum 110% volume capacity) for all hazardous chemical storage areas. All acetone, isopropanol, and other Class B flammable liquids stored in containers larger than 5 liters must be placed in designated containment cabinets or spill trays. Containment systems will be installed in UNIT-014, UNIT-002, and UNIT-004. This engineering control prevents future spills from contaminating equipment and floor areas.

name: Establish Chemical Storage and Handling Standard Operating Procedures
description: Develop comprehensive SOPs for chemical storage, handling, and movement that specify: approved storage locations with secondary containment, prohibition on unstable carts for chemical transport, proper labeling requirements (WHMIS 2015 compliant), and spill response procedures. Training will be mandatory for all personnel handling chemicals (estimated 45 employees). Document will be posted at all chemical storage locations and reviewed quarterly.

name: Upgrade Emergency Ventilation and Respiratory Protection
description: Install portable emergency ventilation units with HEPA and activated charcoal filtration in UNIT-014 to be deployed within 30 seconds of chemical vapor detection. Establish respiratory protection equipment stations with powered air-purifying respirators (PAPR) rated for organic vapors. Train all staff in UNIT-014 on emergency respiratory protection use. Conduct quarterly emergency response drills simulating chemical spills.

name: Implement Quarterly Chemical Equipment Inspections
description: Establish a mandatory quarterly inspection protocol for all chemical transfer equipment including hand pumps, drum connections, and hose assemblies. Each equipment inspection will be documented and tracked in the maintenance system. Equipment showing signs of wear or corrosion will be immediately replaced. This addresses the root cause of pump failure and prevents future spills. All maintenance technicians will be trained on inspection criteria and documentation requirements within 14 days.

name: Upgrade Chemical Spill Response Kit and Training
description: Install enhanced spill response stations at three critical locations in the chemical storage area, each containing absorbent materials, containment barriers, and personal protective equipment. Conduct mandatory annual training for all personnel who work with or near hazardous chemicals, covering spill containment, evacuation procedures, and emergency communication. Training will be coordinated by the HSE department and documented in personnel files. Spill kits will be inspected monthly to ensure materials remain effective.

name: Complete Electrical System Audit and Upgrade
description: Conduct a comprehensive audit of all electrical systems in the Main Production Building by a certified electrical engineer within 30 days. Priority will be given to identifying overloaded circuits, aging wiring, and inadequate circuit protection devices. All identified deficiencies will be remediated according to Quebec electrical code requirements. Estimated repairs include replacement of 8 aging junction boxes, installation of modern circuit breakers with improved protection, and rewiring of 12 production lines. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of electrical fires at the source.

name: Establish Monthly Electrical Equipment Maintenance Protocol
description: Implement a preventive maintenance schedule requiring monthly visual inspections of all electrical panels, junction boxes, and distribution equipment throughout the facility. Maintenance technicians will use thermal imaging cameras to detect hot spots indicating potential failures. All findings will be documented and communicated to the HSE committee monthly. Additionally, all production supervisors will receive training on recognizing signs of electrical distress such as unusual odors, sparking, or discoloration.

name: Enhance Fire Alarm and Emergency Evacuation Training
description: Conduct quarterly emergency response drills simulating fire scenarios in all production areas. All employees will participate in evacuation training with designated assembly points and accountability procedures. Production line supervisors will receive specialized training on emergency shutdown procedures to safely stop machinery during evacuations. First aid and fire extinguisher training will be mandatory for all supervisory personnel. These administrative controls improve response time and reduce confusion during actual emergencies.

name: Repair and Upgrade Automated Part Ejection Systems
description: Immediately prioritize repair of the malfunctioning automated part ejection system on Injection Molding Line A that was identified as the root cause of excessive manual handling. The system will be serviced by the equipment manufacturer's certified technician within 5 days. Following repair, implement a preventive maintenance schedule requiring monthly inspections of all ejection systems across all production lines. This engineering control eliminates the hazardous repetitive motions at the source by restoring automated functionality.

name: Implement Mandatory Job Rotation and Rest Break Policy
description: Establish a mandatory job rotation system requiring all assembly and production operators to rotate to different work stations every 90 minutes to vary muscle group usage and reduce cumulative repetitive strain. Implement mandatory 15-minute rest breaks every 2 hours with light stretching exercises supervised by the Ergonomics Specialist. All supervisors will be trained on recognizing early signs of repetitive strain injuries and will complete monthly audits of their work areas for compliance with rotation schedules. This administrative control reduces individual exposure to high-risk repetitive motions.

name: Conduct Ergonomic Assessment and Implement Tool Modifications
description: Perform a comprehensive ergonomic assessment of all part removal workstations, focusing on tool design, work surface height, and operator positioning. Evaluate current hand tools for grip ergonomics and consider implementing ergonomic part removal tools that reduce gripping force and twisting motions. Based on assessment findings, modify workstations to align with ergonomic best practices. Provide all affected operators with ergonomic training and wrist/forearm supports if needed. Document all modifications and share results with the JHSC.

name: Implement Mandatory Interlock Verification Protocol
description: Establish a standardized pre-operation checklist requiring operators to visually and tactilely confirm all safety interlocks are fully engaged before resuming work after each molding cycle. Integrate visual status indicators into the HMI system to display real-time interlock states. This administrative control will reduce pinch point incidents by ensuring operators explicitly verify machine state. Training will be provided to all molding line operators with quarterly refresher sessions.

name: Install Pressure-Sensitive Safety Mats
description: Install pressure-sensitive safety mats around the operator work zones on all 32 injection molding machines to detect hand intrusion into pinch points during mold closing cycles. The mats will be configured to trigger automatic machine halt within 50 milliseconds. This engineering control will provide passive protection independent of operator vigilance. Installation will occur over two weeks across all production lines.

name: Upgrade Equipment Maintenance Scheduling System
description: Implement a computerized predictive maintenance system that tracks grinding wheel usage in real-time and automatically generates replacement alerts 20% before manufacturers' service limits are reached. The system will integrate with staffing schedules to prevent maintenance deferrals. All CNC equipment will be integrated into this platform. Training will be provided to maintenance personnel on system operation and alert response protocols. This administrative control will ensure critical maintenance is never deferred.

name: Install Grinding Wheel Fragment Containment Guards
description: Replace existing guards on all CNC milling machines with heavy-duty polycarbonate fragment containment shields rated for high-speed wheel separation events. The new guards will completely enclose the grinding wheel area while maintaining operator visibility and machine accessibility. Installation will be performed by equipment vendors over a 3-week period. This engineering control will prevent fragment ejection hazards from reaching operators regardless of wheel failure mode.

name: Implement Enhanced PPE Requirements for CNC Operations
description: Mandate that all CNC machining operators wear cut-resistant sleeves rated for high-speed fragment impact, in addition to existing protective eyewear. Provide operators with new ANSI A4 level sleeves rated for at least 1000+ abrasion cycles. Conduct fitting sessions to ensure proper sizing and comfort. While this is a PPE measure (lower priority), it serves as interim protection pending engineering control installation.

name: Install Mechanical Lift-Assist Equipment
description: Install four powered pallet jacks and two ergonomic lift tables in the Regrind and Recycling Department to eliminate manual lifting of boxes exceeding 30 pounds. All materials handlers will be trained on proper equipment operation. This engineering control eliminates the root cause (heavy manual lifting) by removing the need for the dangerous activity. Equipment will be positioned strategically to minimize worker travel distance. Expected outcome: elimination of lifting-related injuries in this department.

name: Implement Mandatory Ergonomics Training Program
description: Develop and deliver comprehensive ergonomics training to all warehouse and materials handling staff covering proper lifting mechanics, load assessment, use of mechanical aids, and recognition of cumulative strain hazards. Training will include video demonstrations, hands-on practice with weighted objects, and personalized feedback. Quarterly refresher training will be required. This administrative control ensures workers understand proper body mechanics and develop awareness of injury prevention. Training will be conducted over 4 weeks with maximum 6 workers per session.

name: Establish Maximum Manual Lifting Weight Limit
description: Create and post a facility-wide policy establishing 30 pounds as the maximum weight for manual lifting without mechanical assistance. Any box or container exceeding this weight must be moved using powered equipment. Supervisors will monitor compliance during daily operations. This administrative control provides clear guidance and enforces use of engineering controls. Signage will be placed throughout the warehouse and included in standard work instructions.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Schedule for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a comprehensive preventive maintenance program that includes monthly hydraulic system inspections using ultrasonic monitoring to detect early signs of pump degradation and micro-leaks. All production line operators will receive training on recognizing hydraulic warning signs (vibration, noise, fluid leakage patterns). Maintenance logs will be digitized and shared with production supervisors to enable proactive equipment servicing before failures occur.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Drip Trays
description: Install secondary containment trays beneath all hydraulic connection points on Injection Molding Lines A, B, and C to capture any leaking hydraulic fluid before it reaches the floor. This engineering control will prevent slip hazards and environmental contamination. Trays will be equipped with drain plugs for safe fluid disposal and will be inspected weekly during routine maintenance rounds.

name: Establish Pallet Stacking Height Limits and Load Capacity Training
description: Conduct mandatory training for all forklift operators and material handlers on proper pallet stacking heights, weight distribution, and load capacity verification. Visual signage with maximum stack height markers (in feet) will be installed at each storage location. A refresher training session will occur quarterly. All operators must pass a competency assessment before operating equipment in high-storage zones.

name: Install Automated Load Monitoring System and Racking Inspections
description: Implement monthly racking inspections by certified safety personnel with documented load capacity verification. Install load cells under high-traffic storage areas to provide real-time weight monitoring. Environmental controls will be improved to maintain consistent humidity levels (target 40-60% RH) to minimize pallet material degradation and shifting. Non-compliant loading situations will trigger automatic alerts to supervisors.

name: Replace Temperature Control Thermostat with Smart Control System
description: Install a new precision digital temperature controller with real-time monitoring capability, automated alerts, and remote shutdown functionality. The new system will include dual thermostat redundancy so that if the primary sensor fails, the secondary automatically activates protective shutdown procedures. This will prevent temperature excursions above 175°C. The controller will log all temperature cycles and anomalies for predictive maintenance analysis.

name: Implement Protective Coating and Humidity Control for Electrical Enclosures
description: Apply conformal coating to all terminal connections and printed circuit boards in dryer control panels to prevent corrosion from moisture exposure. Install desiccant breathers and humidity sensors in all electrical enclosures. Establish environmental controls in the Post-Processing area to maintain humidity below 50% RH. Monthly enclosure inspections will be scheduled, with any corroded components replaced immediately.

name: Establish Continuous Monitoring and Automated Shutdown Protocol
description: Install temperature and amperage monitoring sensors on all resin dryers that communicate with the central SCADA system. Automatic equipment shutdown will trigger if temperatures exceed 175°C or if the equipment operates continuously beyond 16 hours without a minimum 2-hour cooling interval. Night shift operators will receive alerts on mobile devices if any parameter enters the warning zone, enabling rapid response before equipment damage occurs.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a quarterly pressure relief valve inspection and testing protocol for all 32 injection molding machines. Install pressure monitoring sensors on critical hydraulic lines to provide early warning of system degradation. Train all machine operators to recognize abnormal vibration and pressure fluctuations. This engineering control, combined with administrative procedures, will prevent equipment failure before it creates hazardous conditions. Expected outcome: 100% detection of hydraulic failures before they pose safety risks.

name: Enhance Operator Emergency Stop Training
description: Conduct refresher training for all production operators on emergency shutdown procedures, with emphasis on recognizing early warning signs of equipment malfunction. Create visual reference cards showing abnormal machine behaviors that require immediate shutdown. Implement a reward system for near-miss reporting to encourage proactive hazard identification. This administrative control will ensure operators consistently recognize and respond appropriately to equipment anomalies.

name: Replace Defective Chemical Dispensers
description: Inspect and replace all malfunctioning pump dispensers on mold release agent containers throughout the facility. Implement a quarterly maintenance schedule for all chemical dispensing equipment to prevent leaks and spills. Source only dispensers with redundant safety valve systems. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of chemical exposure incidents. Expected outcome: Zero chemical spill incidents from equipment failure.

name: Mandatory Chemical Handling and PPE Refresher Training
description: Conduct immediate refresher training for all warehouse and material handling staff on proper PPE selection for mold release agents, including nitrile glove selection and proper donning procedures. Emphasize the importance of always wearing appropriate PPE when transferring chemical containers, and provide hands-on demonstration of emergency eyewash station procedures. Update all chemical handling procedures in the WHMIS documentation. This administrative control ensures consistent safe practices.

name: Install Non-Slip Flooring in Maintenance Work Areas
description: Replace smooth epoxy flooring in the Electrical and Instrumentation Shop and Maintenance Workshop with high-grip non-slip epoxy coating designed for wet/slippery environments. Ensure all ladder placement areas have proper textured surfaces to prevent foot slippage. This engineering control directly eliminates the ladder instability hazard by addressing the root cause. Expected outcome: Elimination of ladder slip incidents in maintenance areas.

name: Establish Mobile Elevated Work Platform (MEWP) Protocol
description: Acquire and deploy mobile elevated work platforms (portable scissor lifts or vertical lifts) in maintenance workshops as substitutes for ladder use when accessing heights above 6 feet. Implement training certification program for all maintenance technicians on safe operation of MEWPs. This substitution control removes reliance on ladders for routine maintenance tasks, providing safer and more stable elevated work platforms.

name: Implement Daily Mold Release System Inspection Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory daily pre-shift inspection of all mold release agent distribution lines, connectors, and spray nozzles. This inspection will be documented on a checklist and performed by the machine operator at the start of each shift. The protocol includes visual inspection for leaks, drips, or pooling, and immediate isolation of affected equipment. Maintenance technicians will repair any identified issues within 2 hours or the equipment will be taken offline. This administrative control directly addresses the root cause of the pooled release agent.

name: Upgrade to Sealed Mold Release Cartridge System
description: Replace the current open mold release distribution system with a sealed cartridge-based system that minimizes exposure during refilling and reduces environmental contact. The new system will feature automated dispensing controls, integrated drip containment, and color-coded cartridges for quick identification. This engineering control eliminates the primary source of accidental skin contact by containing the release agent within a closed system until the point of application on the mold.

name: Establish Post-Maintenance Fluid Leak Containment Protocol
description: Create a mandatory procedure requiring all maintenance personnel to place absorbent containment pads and secondary containment trays under equipment known to store or use hydraulic fluids before beginning work. After maintenance completion, the area must be inspected for spills and cleaned with appropriate absorbent materials. A yellow 'Wet Floor' sign must remain in place for a minimum of 30 minutes after cleaning to allow residual moisture to evaporate. This administrative control ensures hazardous fluids are immediately contained and removed, preventing slip hazards from developing.

name: Conduct Comprehensive LOTO Procedure Audit and Update
description: Perform a full audit of all 32 injection molding machines and associated equipment to identify any engineering changes, modifications, or relocations that may not be reflected in current LOTO procedures. Updates will be completed by qualified maintenance personnel and the revised procedures will be cross-referenced with the most recent equipment modification logs. All LOTO procedures will be re-validated with a trial lockout-tagout on each machine to ensure all energy sources are properly identified and isolatable. This corrective measure directly addresses the root cause by ensuring procedures match current equipment configuration.

name: Implement Monthly LOTO Compliance Verification Program
description: Establish a monthly audit schedule where the LOTO Coordinator randomly selects 3-4 machines per month and conducts full verification audits comparing current procedures against actual equipment. During each audit, a trial lockout will be performed to verify all energy isolation points are correctly identified and accessible. Non-compliance findings will be documented and corrective actions tracked to completion. Monthly reports will be presented to the JHSC and department supervisors. This administrative control creates ongoing verification that procedures remain accurate and complete.

name: Require Equipment Modification Impact Assessment Before Implementation
description: Create a mandatory protocol requiring all equipment modifications, repairs, or relocations to include an 'Impact Assessment on Safety Procedures' form that must be completed and approved by the LOTO Coordinator before work begins. The form requires identification of all energy sources affected by the modification and specifies required updates to LOTO, emergency stop, or other safety-critical procedures. Modified equipment cannot return to service until all procedure documentation has been updated and validated. This engineering/administrative control ensures future modifications are captured in safety procedures.

name: Implement Predictive Cooling System Maintenance Program
description: Establish a comprehensive predictive maintenance schedule for all cooling water systems across production lines, including quarterly thermal imaging inspections, monthly pressure tests, and semi-annual fitting replacements on high-risk connections. Install inline water quality sensors to monitor coolant chemistry and detect contamination early. Technicians will receive training on early warning signs of system degradation. This engineering and administrative control addresses the root cause of aging infrastructure and inadequate maintenance intervals, reducing future leak incidents and associated electrical hazards by an estimated 85%.

name: Install Electrical Protection Barriers Around Junction Boxes
description: Install waterproof polycarbonate protective enclosures around all electrical junction boxes serving injection molding equipment in the Main Production Building. These barriers will shield sensitive electrical components from coolant spray while maintaining visibility for safety inspections. Include integrated drain channels to direct any leaked coolant away from electrical components. This engineering control provides a secondary level of protection independent of cooling system integrity, preventing water-related electrical faults.

name: Upgrade to Heat-Resistant PPE and Implement Mandatory Usage
description: Replace all nitrile gloves in the composite materials and post-processing areas with certified heat-resistant gloves rated for temperatures up to 200°C (Kevlar or aramid blend). Provide heat-resistant sleeves and aprons for all personnel handling temperatures above 100°C. Implement mandatory daily PPE inspections at shift start, with a sign-off log maintained by the shift supervisor. Conduct tool-box talks on proper donning and inspection of protective equipment before high-temperature operations. This administrative and PPE control ensures that all workers have appropriate protection matched to actual temperature hazards.

name: Install Automated Resin Transfer System
description: Evaluate and implement a semi-automated resin transfer system that minimizes direct human handling of materials above 120°C. This engineering control eliminates the primary exposure point by replacing manual pouring with mechanized dispensing using temperature-controlled nozzles and drip containment. The system will include adjustable flow rates and automated shut-off valves. Expected outcome is a 95% reduction in thermal contact incidents in the post-processing area.

name: Establish Mandatory Crane Inspection Schedule with Automated Tracking
description: Implement a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that automatically schedules and tracks all overhead crane inspections on a monthly basis, with escalation alerts when inspections are due or overdue. Require detailed documentation of wire rope condition, including photographic evidence and metrics (wire breaks per foot, rust patterns, etc.). Assign responsibility to the Maintenance Technician with backup coverage to prevent scheduling lapses. This administrative control ensures systematic compliance with load handling safety standards and prevents inspection delays that could result in catastrophic equipment failure.

name: Install Load Monitoring and Automated Stop System
description: Retrofit all overhead bridge cranes with load cells and automated monitoring systems that continuously assess wire rope tension and structural integrity during operation. If the system detects abnormal stress patterns, excessive load sway, or wire degradation indicators, the system automatically reduces speed or halts operation, alerting the operator via visual and auditory signals. This engineering control provides a redundant safety layer that prevents load drops even if inspection schedules slip, directly addressing the root cause of this near-miss incident.

name: Conduct Comprehensive Crane Safety Training for All Operators
description: Organize mandatory recertification training for all crane operators and signal persons, covering advanced load handling, load path analysis, emergency stop procedures, and visual inspection protocols for wire rope degradation. Include a practical component where operators perform mock inspections and make decisions on whether equipment is safe to operate. This administrative control ensures that all personnel involved in overhead lifting operations have current knowledge and can recognize hazardous conditions before they escalate.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a mandatory quarterly preventive maintenance program specifically for all hydraulic systems across the three injection molding lines. Schedule maintenance during planned production downtime using a tracking system integrated with the maintenance software. Each system will include pressure relief valve inspection, fluid analysis, connection integrity testing, and temperature monitoring. Maintenance technicians will be cross-trained to handle overflow situations. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of equipment degradation and ensures early detection of potential failures before catastrophic rupture.

name: Upgrade PPE and Install Thermal Shields on Line C
description: Deploy enhanced thermal-resistant PPE including Kevlar sleeves and heat-resistant gloves rated for 250°C+ exposure to all operators on Injection Molding Line C. Additionally, install removable polycarbonate thermal shields around the heating manifold and pressure relief valve area to contain potential spray direction. Install pressure relief system monitors with audible alarms that alert operators to abnormal pressure conditions. Conduct mandatory training on recognizing pressure anomalies and proper emergency procedures.

name: Establish Maintenance Staffing and Accountability Protocol
description: Hire additional maintenance technician or redistribute existing workload to ensure no scheduled maintenance is deferred. Create a digital maintenance tracking dashboard visible to both Maintenance and Production management showing completion status and any delays. Implement a monthly JHSC review of maintenance completion rates. Establish accountability measures where production line supervisors must sign off on completed maintenance before resuming full production. This administrative control ensures systematic adherence to maintenance schedules.

name: Install Warehouse Aisle Safety Rails and Storage Standardization
description: Install protective steel safety rails along both sides of high-traffic aisles in the Raw Materials Warehouse to prevent forklift contact with protruding pallet edges. Standardize all shelf stacking procedures requiring that pallets be fully seated and flush with shelf edges, with no overhang. Create a daily visual inspection checklist for warehouse staff to identify and correct improperly positioned pallets before equipment operation begins. Mark safe traffic lanes with painted floor lines and install convex mirrors at aisle intersections. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of the forklift pitch.

name: Mandatory Forklift Operator Refresher Training and Load Verification Protocol
description: Conduct mandatory 4-hour refresher training for all forklift operators covering load stability assessment, speed management in confined spaces, and hazard recognition. Implement a load verification checklist that operators must complete before moving any pallet stack, including verification of secure stacking, center of gravity assessment, and aisle clearance confirmation. Require operators to reduce speed by 50% when navigating aisles narrower than 4 meters or when transporting loads higher than 1.5 meters. This administrative control reduces operator error and improves situational awareness.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Certification and Hard-Stop Shutdown Procedure
description: Make LOTO certification mandatory for all CNC operators and maintenance staff, with annual recertification. Modify all CNC equipment to include a hard-stop shutdown button that fully de-energizes motor systems rather than entering idle state. Install a prominent sign on every CNC machine stating 'LOTO Required Before Any Manual Inspection' with a visual lock-out hasp on the main power disconnect. Require operators to wait 60 seconds after pressing the hard-stop button before any manual inspection, allowing residual motor momentum to fully dissipate. Implement disciplinary policy for LOTO violations. This engineering and administrative control prevents unexpected spindle rotation.

name: Establish Maintenance Task Authorization System
description: Create a formal maintenance task authorization protocol requiring all unscheduled CNC inspections or adjustments to be documented on a work order system approved by the Maintenance Supervisor before work begins. Operators are prohibited from performing any unscheduled maintenance—all tasks must be performed by certified maintenance technicians. Post this policy at all CNC stations. Implement a daily safety briefing for night shift personnel emphasizing the hazards specific to unsupervised maintenance activities. This administrative control ensures trained personnel perform all maintenance activities.

name: Install Spindle Safety Interlock System with Sensor Verification
description: Install sensor-based spindle interlock systems on all CNC machines that physically prevent spindle rotation if the main enclosure door is open or if manual control pendant is activated without full power-down confirmation. Add a green 'Safe to Inspect' indicator light that only activates after complete motor de-energization and 60-second timer expiration. Include emergency stop buttons positioned for immediate hand access from typical inspection positions. Train all operators on the new interlock system and conduct monthly verification tests.

name: Implement Quarterly Cooling System Pressure Testing
description: Establish a formal preventive maintenance schedule requiring quarterly pressure testing and visual inspection of all cooling water system connections, hoses, and fittings. Maintenance technicians will document all findings in a centralized maintenance log. Any connections showing signs of corrosion, seepage, or degradation will be replaced immediately rather than monitored. This engineering control removes the risk of unexpected system failures by identifying weaknesses before catastrophic rupture. Expected outcome: 100% reduction in unplanned cooling system incidents.

name: Install Secondary Containment Trays Under High-Pressure Systems
description: Install stainless steel secondary containment trays beneath all injection molding line cooling system connection points. These trays will capture any leaking coolant before it reaches the production floor, preventing slip hazards and chemical exposure. Trays will be sized to accommodate the full volume of coolant in the system above them. This engineering control provides a passive safety barrier that operates independent of human intervention. Technicians will inspect and drain trays weekly.

name: Implement Monthly Storage Rack Safety Audits
description: Establish a mandatory monthly inspection program for all warehouse storage racks, conducted by certified maintenance personnel and documented on a standardized checklist. Inspections will specifically examine cradle pins, locking mechanisms, welds, and structural integrity. Any defective components will be flagged for immediate replacement with documented tracking. This administrative control ensures systematic identification and elimination of equipment failures before incidents occur. A backup inspection will be conducted by HSE staff to verify compliance.

name: Replace All Corroded Cradle Pins with Stainless Steel Hardware
description: Conduct immediate replacement of all carbon steel cradle pins across all warehouse storage racks with corrosion-resistant stainless steel pins rated for at least 1.5x the maximum expected load. This engineering control eliminates the failure mode that caused the incident by removing susceptibility to corrosion. All pins will be torqued to specification and verified with a calibrated wrench. Documentation of all replaced components will be maintained for audit purposes.

name: Install Height-Appropriate Personal Protective Equipment Requirements
description: Mandate that any employee retrieving materials from storage heights above 2 meters must wear a hard hat and heavy-duty shoulder/back protection vest rated for impact absorption. Provide training on proper donning and fit verification. While PPE is a lower-hierarchy control, it provides essential interim protection pending full rack replacement or redesign. Update the warehouse safety manual and conduct toolbox talks with all warehouse staff on the new requirement.

name: Mandate Annual LOTO Recertification with Competency Testing
description: Establish a mandatory annual LOTO recertification program for all maintenance and production personnel with direct access to machinery. Include hands-on competency testing covering proper lock placement, tag verification, and energy isolation procedures. Personnel failing the test must complete remedial training before being authorized to operate equipment. This administrative control ensures that all staff maintain current knowledge and demonstrate practical understanding. Night shift supervisors will conduct spot audits monthly to verify LOTO compliance.

name: Install Mechanical Hopper Blockage Prevention System
description: Install automated moisture sensors and desiccant cartridge holders in all regrind hopper systems. When moisture levels exceed thresholds, the system will automatically alert operators and disable the auger until material moisture is remediated. This engineering control eliminates the blockage condition that necessitated manual intervention. Integrate sensor data into the production management system for real-time monitoring and historical analysis.

name: Implement Night Shift LOTO Compliance Auditing Program
description: Establish a night shift supervisor role responsible for conducting hourly LOTO compliance spot checks on all active machinery. Create a digital checklist verifying that locks are properly placed, danger tags are visible, and energy isolation is complete. Any non-compliance findings will trigger immediate shutdown and incident documentation. This administrative control addresses the gap in supervisory oversight during low-staffing night shift periods. Results will be reviewed during monthly safety committee meetings.

name: Implement Mandatory Machine Shutdown Protocol for Maintenance
description: Establish and enforce a written procedure requiring all machine operators to immediately shut down equipment upon detecting any unusual vibration, noise, or leaks. No repairs or adjustments shall be attempted while equipment is running. All operators will receive refresher training within 7 days. Laminated procedure cards will be posted at each injection molding line. Compliance will be monitored through daily supervisor checklist audits.

name: Upgrade Hydraulic System Maintenance Schedule
description: Conduct comprehensive inspection of all cooling system hoses and connections on all injection molding lines. Replace all fittings showing wear or improper installation. Implement pre-shift checklist requiring visual inspection of hose connections. Establish quarterly professional maintenance cycle with documented certification. Technician training on proper fitting installation techniques will be conducted by equipment manufacturer representative.

name: Establish Emergency Exit Protection Zone Program
description: Create designated material staging areas that are minimum 10 feet away from all emergency exits, fire extinguishers, and eye wash stations. Install yellow floor tape and signage marking these protected zones. Update standard operating procedures to prohibit material storage in these areas. Conduct monthly audits with photographic documentation. Train all material handling staff on the new protocol with mandatory sign-off. Non-compliance will result in disciplinary action.

name: Implement Real-Time Emergency Exit Monitoring System
description: Install motion-sensor alarm devices on each emergency exit door that alert when exits are blocked for more than 30 seconds. These devices will send notifications to the facility manager and shift supervisor. Conduct quarterly drills to ensure all exits remain accessible and functional. Create a permanent accountability log for exit checks conducted at the start of each shift by designated supervisors.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Cooling Systems
description: Establish quarterly bearing inspections on all injection molding line cooling pumps using vibration analysis and thermal imaging. Replace bearings every 12 months regardless of condition. Install pressure gauges and temperature monitors that log data for trend analysis. Designate a maintenance technician to review data weekly and flag anomalies. Contract with equipment manufacturer for preventive maintenance training. Budget allocation of $45,000 annually for replacement parts inventory.

name: Enhance Mold Release Agent Cleaning Procedures
description: Implement a mandatory post-production cleaning protocol requiring all operators to completely wipe down mold release agent residue from equipment surfaces using designated cleaning cloths and WHMIS-compliant degreaser within 10 minutes of production shutdown. Establish visual inspection checkpoints and create a cleaning log that must be initialed by operators and verified by shift supervisors. Include photographic standards showing acceptable cleanliness levels posted at each workstation.

name: Upgrade PPE Requirements for Medical Component Production
description: Mandate nitrile gloves (minimum 8-mil thickness) and protective forearm sleeves for all personnel handling mold release agents on medical device production lines. Provide employees with hypoallergenic barrier cream to apply before donning gloves. Establish a glove inspection station where operators must change gloves every 2 hours during mold release work. Update training materials to emphasize the specific hazards of mold release agents used in ISO 13485-certified production.

name: Redesign Material Handling Work Zones with Floor Markings
description: Implement high-visibility yellow and black floor markings in the Regrind and Recycling Department to delineate material staging zones, crane swing paths, and pedestrian walkways. Install permanent floor bumpers at pallet storage edges to prevent toe-catching incidents. Establish a no-foot-traffic zone directly beneath all overhead crane operations. Provide training on the new zone layout to all personnel with mandatory refresher training every 6 months.

name: Implement Mandatory Foot Protection Equipment Policy
description: Require all employees in the Regrind and Recycling Department to wear ASTM-rated composite-toe work boots with puncture-resistant soles and metatarsal guards during all material handling operations. Provide a company-subsidized boot allowance of $150 per employee annually. Conduct quarterly foot protection audits during shift walkthroughs and document compliance. Establish consequences for non-compliance including mandatory retraining.

name: Establish Crane Operation Spotting Certification Program
description: Develop a formal certification program requiring all material handlers working near overhead crane operations to complete a 4-hour spotting course covering load control, hand signal communication, hazard awareness, and emergency procedures. Require annual recertification and maintain records of all certified spotters. Implement a policy requiring at least one certified spotter for every crane operation in the warehouse, with dedicated radio communication channels for coordination.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Ventilation Systems
description: Establish a comprehensive predictive maintenance schedule for the Hazardous Waste Management Area ventilation system with quarterly professional inspections instead of annual. Install vibration sensors on the blower motor to provide early warning of bearing degradation. Implement thermographic imaging every 6 months to detect temperature anomalies. Create a maintenance log accessible to all shift supervisors showing historical service records and upcoming service dates. Partner with the equipment manufacturer for priority replacement parts availability.

name: Install Backup Ventilation System with Automatic Switchover
description: Purchase and install a secondary ventilation unit with identical capacity as the primary system, equipped with an automated switchover mechanism that activates within 30 seconds of primary system failure. Install continuous air quality monitoring equipment (VOC sensors) with automatic alarm notification to the HSE office, production supervisors, and security when concentrations exceed 50% of the lower explosive limit. Conduct monthly functional tests of the backup system and document results.

name: Establish Chemical Storage Area Access Controls
description: Implement access-controlled door locks on the Hazardous Waste Management Area requiring authorized personnel only. Install a placard system indicating operational status of ventilation systems (green light = operating, red light = not operating). Require all personnel to check the status indicator before entering. Create an emergency communication protocol requiring dispatch notification to all available personnel if ventilation failure is detected. Update emergency response procedures to include immediate area evacuation procedures.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Injection Molding Equipment
description: Establish a comprehensive predictive maintenance schedule for all injection molding machines with monthly temperature sensor calibration and quarterly replacement of corroded fittings. Install temperature monitoring alerts that trigger automatic shutdowns if barrel temperatures exceed safe operating ranges by more than 10°C. Assign François-Xavier Mailhot as maintenance supervisor responsible for weekly temperature log reviews and sensor diagnostics. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of temperature spikes and reduces exposure to hot plastic material hazards.

name: Mandatory Heat-Resistant PPE and Machine Guarding Training
description: Conduct mandatory training for all injection molding operators on proper use of heat-resistant gloves, sleeves, and face shields rated for 300°C+ exposure. Require operators to inspect equipment connections before each shift and report corroded fittings immediately. Create laminated quick-reference guides posted at each molding station detailing temperature alarm response procedures and emergency shutdown locations. Training to be delivered by Jamal Thompson (Respiratory Protection Program Coordinator) within 14 days, with quarterly refresher sessions.

name: Install Machine Safety Guards and Temperature Cutoff Devices
description: Install physical protective guards around all material injection points and connection fittings to prevent direct contact with hot plastic. Add redundant temperature cutoff devices that automatically halt operations if sensor readings exceed 250°C. Retrofit existing machines within 30 days and incorporate guards into all new equipment specifications. This engineering control directly prevents contact with the hazardous material and eliminates equipment malfunction incidents.

name: Implement Warehouse Storage Rack Safety Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory storage protocol requiring all pallets to be stored on designated racks with maximum stacking height of 1.5 meters (below eye level of standing workers). Install safety netting or chain barriers on all elevated pallet storage to prevent dislodgement. Conduct weekly visual inspections of all stored materials for proper placement and stability. Create a checklist for warehouse staff to verify proper stacking at shift changes. This engineering control eliminates falling object hazards by preventing pallet dislodgement.

name: Implement Daily PPE Inventory and Restocking Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory daily checklist at each injection molding line to verify availability of thermal insulating gloves, face shields, and other required PPE before shift start. Assign a rotating team member responsibility to verify inventory and restock items from central supply. Integrate this check into the shift handover procedure with sign-off documentation. This directly addresses the root cause of missing protective equipment and ensures consistent availability of critical safety gear.

name: Install Automated Cooling Stations and Part Ejection Guards
description: Engineer and install mechanical part ejection systems with integrated cooling fans at injection molding lines to reduce manual handling of hot parts. Install insulated holding trays with temperature indicators to allow parts to cool before manual removal. This engineering control eliminates the hazard of direct contact with hot materials by substituting manual removal with semi-automated processes, significantly reducing burn risk.

name: Mandatory Thermal Safety Training Refresher
description: Conduct immediate retraining for all injection molding operators on proper use of thermal protective equipment, part handling procedures, and recognition of hot material hazards. Include hands-on demonstration of correct glove fitting and inspection techniques. Require annual refresher training and document all attendance. This administrative control reinforces safe work practices and ensures operators understand the critical importance of PPE compliance.

name: Upgrade Ventilation System and Install Real-Time Air Quality Monitoring
description: Replace ventilation filters with high-efficiency HEPA filters and install continuous air quality monitoring sensors in the Regrind and Recycling Department. The system will automatically alert operators when particulate concentrations approach exposure limits and trigger automated intake adjustments. This engineering control directly eliminates the hazard of excess fiber dust by improving air filtration and providing real-time feedback to prevent future exposure events.

name: Implement Mandatory Preventive Maintenance Schedule with Digital Tracking
description: Establish a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that automatically schedules and tracks ventilation filter replacement every 40 operating hours. Require daily visual inspections before shift start with documented sign-off. Integrate system alerts into supervisor dashboards and establish accountability for missed maintenance windows. This administrative control ensures consistent equipment upkeep and prevents future ventilation failures.

name: Install Comprehensive Mezzanine Edge Protection and Safety Barriers
description: Install industrial-grade steel guardrails (42 inches minimum height) with intermediate rails and toe boards along the entire perimeter of the mezzanine level. Add safety netting to prevent small objects from falling through gaps. Install clear warning signage indicating the mezzanine overhead hazard and establish a restricted work zone below. This engineering control directly eliminates the falling object hazard through physical barriers and clearly delineates the danger area.

name: Implement Mezzanine Storage Organization and Load Securement System
description: Reorganize stored items on the mezzanine to ensure all materials are stored at least 6 inches from edges and secured with straps or containment systems to prevent accidental displacement. Establish weight limits per shelf and implement a labeling system. Conduct a comprehensive inventory audit and remove unused materials. Train all staff on proper stacking and securement procedures. This administrative control minimizes the quantity and type of objects at risk of falling.

name: Establish Formal Fall Protection Compliance Program with Annual Audits
description: Develop a formal mezzanine and elevated work area compliance program that includes annual structural integrity assessments, quarterly safety inspections, and documentation of all modifications. Create a fall hazard inventory for all elevated work surfaces facility-wide. Require JHSC review of findings and establish corrective action timelines. This administrative control ensures systematic ongoing compliance and prevents recurrence of this hazard across other elevated areas.

name: Implement Cut-Resistant Glove Program for Finishing Operations
description: Distribute nitrile-coated cut-resistant gloves (ANSI level A3) to all assembly and packaging staff working with newly molded parts. Establish a mandatory glove-use policy for all finishing tasks involving unpolished plastic edges. Conduct hands-on training sessions demonstrating proper glove selection, fitting, and use. Include glove inspection procedures in daily pre-shift meetings. Monitor compliance through supervisor observations and include glove usage in the monthly safety committee agenda.

name: Add Edge-Deburring Station at Quality Control
description: Establish a dedicated station in the Quality Control Laboratory where all newly molded parts undergo automated edge-deburring or manual smoothing before being transferred to the Packaging and Labeling Station. This eliminates sharp edges at the source rather than exposing assembly workers to the hazard. Train quality control personnel on deburring techniques and implement daily equipment maintenance checks. This engineering control removes the hazard entirely from the downstream assembly process.

name: Install Thermal Insulation Blankets on All Barrel Tubing
description: Wrap all heated barrel tubing sections on injection molding equipment with high-temperature silicone foam insulation blankets rated for continuous exposure up to 315°C. This engineering control directly eliminates the burn hazard by preventing direct skin contact with high-temperature surfaces. All maintenance activities will be conducted with the insulation in place except during actual barrel replacement. Include quarterly inspections for insulation integrity in the preventive maintenance schedule. This eliminates the hazard at the source rather than relying on PPE alone.

name: Mandatory Thermal Burn Prevention Training and Temperature-Rated PPE Upgrade
description: Conduct mandatory training for all maintenance personnel on thermal hazards specific to injection molding equipment, recognizing high-temperature zones, and emergency response procedures. Upgrade all maintenance gloves from standard cotton to aluminized proximity gloves with 500°C heat resistance and provide long-sleeved thermal-protective work shirts. Establish a requirement that maintenance personnel must visually identify and mark all active heating elements before beginning any work. Maintain a temperature gun at each molding line for hazard verification. Schedule recertification training annually.

name: Implement Temperature Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Protocol
description: Establish a formal procedure requiring that all heated barrel tubes be cooled to safe temperatures (below 60°C) and electrically de-energized before any maintenance work begins. Install energy isolation points with standardized lockout devices. Assign one employee per shift as the LOTO coordinator responsible for verifying energy isolation. Conduct hands-on LOTO training for all maintenance staff and include audit inspections in the monthly safety committee reviews. This administrative control ensures machines reach a safe state before human contact.

name: Install Powered Pallet Jack and Low-Lift Table System
description: Purchase and install two electric powered pallet jacks with load capacity of 1000 kg and one pneumatic-hydraulic low-lift table in the Raw Materials Warehouse. This eliminates the need for manual sliding of heavy pallets. Train all warehouse staff on proper operation, maintenance, and safety protocols for the equipment. Establish a daily equipment inspection checklist and schedule monthly preventive maintenance. Position equipment near the loading dock for convenient access during unloading operations. This engineering control removes the hazard at the source by eliminating heavy manual lifting.

name: Comprehensive Ergonomics and Proper Lifting Technique Training
description: Conduct mandatory hands-on ergonomics training for all warehouse and materials handling personnel covering proper lifting mechanics, load assessment techniques, and recognition of ergonomic hazards. Use video demonstrations and have employees practice correct lifting on various bag weights. Emphasize the 'lift with legs, not back' principle and teach proper load positioning. Include information on when to request assistance or use mechanical aids. Conduct refresher training quarterly and document all training attendance. This administrative control establishes proper work practices to prevent injury.

name: Implement Maximum Bag Weight Limit and Pair-Lift Requirements
description: Establish and post warehouse procedures limiting individual bag handling to maximum 20 kg, with bags exceeding this weight requiring mechanical assistance or two-person team lifting. Mark all bags over 20 kg with a red 'HEAVY LOAD - TEAM LIFT REQUIRED' label. Conduct supervisor spot-checks to ensure compliance and include weight-limit adherence in weekly safety briefings. Establish a system for reporting bags of uncertain weight to materials management for verification. Post signage at the loading dock and throughout the warehouse showing the weight-limit policy.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Certification for All Staff
description: Establish a comprehensive lockout/tagout training program that is mandatory for all production workers, including temporary and contract staff, before they operate or work near machinery. Create a verification system where LOTO procedures are documented on equipment control boards with clear visual indicators. All workers must sign off on LOTO verification before equipment operation. Training will include practical demonstrations on Injection Molding Line B with monthly refresher sessions.

name: Upgrade Auger Safety Interlock System
description: Install a redundant dual-channel safety interlock system on the hopper auger that cannot be bypassed by a single point failure. Implement magnetic safety switches that verify lockout compliance before equipment can operate. Add an audible alarm system that activates whenever the interlock is triggered or reset. This engineering control will prevent accidental machine startup during maintenance and material handling activities.

name: Prioritize Edge-Finishing Machine Maintenance
description: Clear the maintenance backlog on the edge-finishing equipment in Post-Processing within 5 business days. Implement preventive maintenance scheduling to ensure the deburring function operates at full capacity. Establish a daily pre-shift inspection checklist for the finishing machine. Create a queue management system where components cannot proceed to quality inspection until deburring is complete and verified by the operator.

name: Issue Cut-Resistant Inspection Gloves
description: Distribute ANSI A4 cut-resistant nitrile gloves to all quality inspectors and post-processing personnel. Implement a policy requiring glove use during all component handling operations, particularly during visual inspection of freshly finished parts. Conduct training on proper glove selection and fit to ensure optimal protection while maintaining dexterity for inspection tasks.

name: Install Secondary Pallet Securing System
description: Install heavy-duty pallet restraint straps and brackets on all overhead storage racks in the warehouse. Each pallet must be secured with redundant tie-down systems capable of holding 150% of the pallet's maximum load weight. Install visual inspection markers on each secured pallet. Conduct weekly inspections of all overhead storage securing mechanisms and document compliance. Train all warehouse and forklift personnel on proper pallet securing procedures.

name: Replace Damaged Backup Power Supply
description: Replace the damaged backup power supply unit with a new redundant UPS system rated for 150% of the cleanroom's power requirements. Install the unit in a protective cage to shield it from falling objects. Verify that the new system integrates properly with existing cleanroom environmental control systems. Conduct full system testing to confirm medical device production area can maintain ISO 13485 compliance during main power loss.

name: Conduct Storage Rack Weight Capacity Audit
description: Engage a certified structural engineer to perform a comprehensive audit of all overhead storage racks throughout the warehouse and production facilities. Verify weight ratings, inspect for structural integrity, and identify any racks that do not meet current load requirements. Establish maximum weight limits for each rack and post clear signage. Create a database of rack specifications and implement quarterly inspection protocols.

name: Install Redundant HVAC System with Automatic Switchover
description: Design and install a secondary exhaust fan system for the Mold Manufacturing and Repair Shop with automatic changeover capability. When primary fan airflow drops below 80% of design specifications, the secondary system activates automatically within 30 seconds. Both systems will be independently monitored with audible and visible alarms at the production supervisor station. Include quarterly preventive maintenance scheduling with bearing inspections and lubrication.

name: Real-Time Air Quality Monitoring System
description: Install continuous air quality monitoring equipment in the Mold Manufacturing Shop with real-time readout of solvent vapor concentrations (ppm). Set alarm thresholds at 50% of OSHA PEL (50 ppm for isopropanol). Integrate monitors with building management system to alert HSE personnel via email and text when thresholds are exceeded. Require weekly calibration checks and monthly sensor replacement.

name: Implement Secondary Containment System for All Hazardous Waste Drums
description: Replace all wooden pallets in UNIT-011 with polyethylene secondary containment trays rated for 110% drum volume. Each tray must have drain plugs for sampling and documented inspection intervals of every 30 days. Install clear labeling indicating drum contents, hazard classification, storage date, and inspection schedule. Train all materials handlers on proper drum placement and containment verification procedures.

name: Establish Monthly Hazardous Waste Storage Audit Protocol
description: Create a standardized monthly inspection checklist for all hazardous waste storage areas covering drum integrity, proper labeling, expiration dates, secondary containment condition, and drainage systems. Assign responsibility to the Materials Handler with sign-off required by the HSE Officer. Document all findings in a central register accessible to management. Non-compliance issues must be corrected within 72 hours.

name: Environmental Remediation and Soil Remediation Plan
description: Excavate contaminated soil from the 8x10 foot area to a depth of 18 inches. Transport and dispose of contaminated soil through a certified environmental remediation facility in compliance with Quebec environmental standards. Install impermeable liner and replace with clean topsoil. Conduct post-remediation soil testing to verify contamination removal. Implement monthly groundwater monitoring for 12 months to ensure no subsurface contamination migration.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Dryer Systems
description: Establish a comprehensive predictive maintenance protocol for all resin dryer units including weekly temperature sensor calibration checks, monthly pressure relief valve inspections, and quarterly thermal imaging inspections of heating elements. Install real-time monitoring sensors with automated alerts when temperatures exceed safe thresholds. This addresses the root cause of delayed maintenance and failed temperature sensing. Implementation will include staff training on new monitoring systems and integration with the existing maintenance tracking database to ensure no critical repairs are missed.

name: Upgrade Temperature Control System with Redundant Sensors
description: Replace the single-point temperature sensor on all dryer units with dual redundant sensor systems that cross-validate readings. Install a secondary pressure relief valve on each unit with independent actuation mechanism. These engineering controls eliminate single-point failure modes that contributed to the incident. The redundant system will automatically shut down heating if either sensor detects anomalies, preventing pressure buildup. Expected outcome is zero future dryer thermal events.

name: Revise Preventive Maintenance Prioritization Process
description: Update the maintenance scheduling system to classify temperature sensor replacements and pressure relief valve inspections as critical path items that cannot be deprioritized. Implement a mandatory 72-hour review escalation for any deferred critical maintenance items. Assign responsibility to production supervisors to track sensor replacement status monthly. This administrative control ensures that identified equipment failures are remediated within required timeframes, preventing accumulation of maintenance backlog.

name: Install Integrated Equipment Lockout Confirmation System
description: Install mechanical interlocks on all regrind equipment that physically prevent operation unless all lockout pins are properly engaged and verified. Add electronic confirmation sensors that communicate with the control system, requiring visual acknowledgment on the operator display before equipment can be powered. This engineering control eliminates the possibility of equipment operation during maintenance or jam-clearing activities. Include redundant verification steps that require two-person confirmation for equipment restart after any maintenance intervention.

name: Mandatory Equipment State Communication Protocol
description: Implement a documented shift-to-shift communication protocol requiring operators to physically walk through the equipment area and verbally confirm all equipment status before shift changeover. Introduce a centralized whiteboard log where outgoing operators must document any equipment in maintenance, repair, or jam-clearing status. Include a requirement that all personnel must check this log before operating any equipment. This administrative control ensures situational awareness across shift transitions and prevents unauthorized equipment restart.

name: Comprehensive LOTO Procedure Retraining and Certification
description: Conduct mandatory retraining of all 28 equipment operators on LOTO procedures with emphasis on proper documentation, lockout tag placement, and verification steps. Require written certification exam and practical demonstration before operators resume independent equipment operation. Include specific scenarios for jam-clearing and partial maintenance tasks that don't require full shutdown. Implement quarterly refresher training for all personnel. This ensures consistent understanding and execution of safety protocols across all shifts.

name: Install Real-Time Ventilation Monitoring System
description: Install continuous air flow monitoring sensors on the composite processing area ventilation system with real-time display panels and automated alerts when airflow drops below 85% capacity. Integrate sensors with the maintenance management system to generate automatic work orders when filter capacity degrades. This engineering control ensures that ventilation system performance is continuously verified and maintenance is triggered proactively before air quality degrades to unsafe levels. Expected outcome is maintenance-free operation with consistent air quality above occupational exposure limits.

name: Implement Baseline Respiratory Health Screening Program
description: Establish baseline spirometry testing for all employees who work in composite material areas to identify pre-existing respiratory sensitivities or asthma conditions. Create a medical surveillance protocol that includes annual repeat testing and occupational health follow-ups for employees with declining lung function. Coordinate with occupational health physician to develop individualized accommodation plans for employees with respiratory sensitivity. This administrative control ensures early identification of at-risk individuals and enables targeted interventions or job modifications before acute incidents occur.

name: Implement Quarterly Cooling System Pressure Testing
description: Establish a scheduled quarterly inspection program for all injection molding machine cooling lines. This will include pressure testing at 150% of normal operating pressure using certified equipment. All connectors, hoses, and fittings will be examined for cracks, corrosion, and wear. A detailed log will be maintained for each machine. This proactive approach addresses the root cause of premature connector degradation and prevents similar incidents by identifying weakening components before failure occurs.

name: Install Secondary Containment Drip Trays Under Cooling Lines
description: Engineering control to contain any future cooling water leaks. Install stainless steel drip trays beneath all main cooling line connections on injection molding machines. These trays will capture leaked water and direct it to a drain system, preventing water from reaching electrical components or creating slip hazards.
