description: Develop and deliver mandatory training to all North Zone production staff covering ventilation failure recognition, emergency shutdown procedures, evacuation protocols, and first aid for inhalation exposure. Conduct quarterly emergency response drills with timed evacuation and accountability procedures. Training materials will be available in French and English. Administrative control ensures workforce readiness for future incidents.

name: Upgrade Storage Rack Containment System
description: Install secondary containment drip pans and barriers beneath all chemical storage racks in Warehouse Section C. Each containment system will have 150% capacity of the largest container stored above it. Add stainless steel drain plugs and collection sumps to prevent uncontrolled environmental release. Engineering control eliminates the pathway for chemical escape and limits environmental exposure.

name: Seal Concrete Floor Cracks and Upgrade Storm Drain Protection
description: Conduct comprehensive inspection of all warehouse and production floor concrete for cracks and damage. Repair all identified cracks with epoxy injection sealant. Install sediment filtration systems and absorbent inserts in all storm drain access points. These engineering controls prevent chemicals from entering the storm system and reduce environmental liability.

name: Implement Mandatory CNC Safety Certification and Annual Recertification
description: Establish a formal CNC machine operation certification program requiring all operators to complete hands-on training, written assessment, and demonstrated competency in spindle lock procedures, chuck key removal protocols, and emergency shutdown. Require annual recertification with tracking through the HR system. This administrative control ensures all personnel maintain current knowledge of critical safety procedures and provides accountability for compliance.

name: Install Interlock System Preventing Spindle Operation with Chuck Key Installed
description: Retrofit all CNC milling machines with a mechanical/electrical interlock system that prevents spindle rotation if a chuck key is detected in the spindle. Additionally, install proximity sensors near the spindle that trigger audible and visual alarms if a hand approaches the rotating area without proper guards. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of the incident by making spindle operation with the key impossible.

name: Enforce Cut-Resistant Glove Requirement and PPE Compliance Program
description: Establish a mandatory PPE program requiring all CNC operators and machinists to wear cut-resistant gloves (ANSI Level 3) rated for metal handling. Implement a daily PPE checklist at the start of each shift, with supervisor sign-off. Provide training on proper glove selection, fit, and limitations. Non-compliance will result in immediate work stoppage and retraining. This control ensures appropriate personal protective equipment is consistently used.

name: Implement Secondary Containment for Chemical Storage
description: Install secondary containment trays beneath all chemical transfer points in the mixing room with a capacity of 110% of the largest container volume. These trays will capture spills before they reach floor drains. Establish a weekly inspection protocol for containment integrity and drain accessibility. This engineering control directly prevents environmental contamination and protects groundwater from chemical exposure.

name: Establish Container Integrity Inspection Program
description: Implement a monthly inspection schedule for all chemical storage containers, focusing on cap seals, threading, and corrosion. Replace containers showing any signs of deterioration immediately. Maintain an inventory log with inspection dates and findings. Train all chemical handlers on pre-use visual inspection procedures. This administrative control prevents container failures that lead to spills.

name: Enhanced Ventilation System in Chemical Mixing Area
description: Upgrade the existing ventilation system in the chemical mixing room to achieve 12 air changes per hour during chemical handling operations. Install CO2 sensors to monitor air quality in real-time and trigger automatic alerts when thresholds are exceeded. This engineering control reduces vapor concentration and protects worker respiratory health while containing environmental exposure.

name: Install Automatic Mold Temperature Display at All Molding Stations
description: Retrofit all 32 injection molding machines with large, easy-to-read digital temperature displays positioned at operator eye level on the machine's control panel. Set the display to turn green only when mold surface temperature drops below 60°C (safe handling threshold). Require operators to verify green status before any manual mold contact. This engineering control ensures operators have real-time verification of safe conditions.

name: Upgrade PPE for Mold Handling Operations
description: Issue heat-resistant silicone-lined gloves (rated to 300°C) and long-sleeved heat-protective sleeves to all operators working with mold maintenance. Conduct fitting sessions and provide proper care/inspection instructions. Establish a replacement schedule quarterly or when damage is detected. Update Standard Operating Procedures to mandate this PPE for any mold contact. This engineering and PPE control provides enhanced thermal protection.

name: Install Anti-Slip Ladder Feet and Safety Equipment
description: Replace all portable ladders in the facility with models featuring integrated anti-slip feet and stabilizer bars. Install adhesive non-slip tape on all existing ladder rungs. Add ladder securing brackets at key warehouse locations to prevent lateral movement when climbing. Retire any ladder showing signs of damage or wear. This engineering control directly prevents ladder slippage and base shifting.

name: Implement Mandatory Ladder Use Procedures and Spotter Requirements
description: Establish a mandatory two-person ladder use protocol for all heights above 8 feet. The designated spotter must be physically present at the ladder base, trained in proper spotting technique, and authorized to halt operations if unsafe conditions are detected. Include this requirement in all work permits for elevated tasks. Conduct monthly audits of compliance through supervisor rounds. This administrative control ensures supervision and immediate intervention capability.

name: Enhance Night Shift Warehouse Staffing for Safety-Critical Tasks
description: Increase night shift warehouse staffing from 1 to 2 associates when inventory work at heights is scheduled. Establish a protocol that warehouse operations above 10 feet height cannot proceed when staffing is below the required level. This ensures adequate supervision, spotter availability, and emergency response capability during isolated night shift hours.

name: Implement Enhanced Deburring Quality Control Process
description: Establish a mandatory secondary inspection station where all finished components are manually checked for sharp edges and burrs before packaging. Implement a checklist-based inspection procedure requiring sign-off by quality personnel. Provide additional training to finishing operators on identifying potential sharp edge hazards. Install better lighting in the finishing workstations to improve visibility during inspection tasks.

name: Upgrade Personal Protective Equipment for Finishing Operations
description: Issue cut-resistant gloves (ANSI A4 rating) to all finishing operators and establish a mandatory PPE policy for handling finished components. Replace existing gloves monthly or as needed. Conduct training session on proper fit and usage of cut-resistant gloves to ensure employees understand their protective function.

name: Implement Mandatory Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Pressure Relief Systems
description: Establish a documented preventive maintenance program requiring quarterly inspection and testing of all pressure relief valves across injection molding lines. Assign responsibility to Viktor Novak (Electrical Technician) to develop testing protocols and maintain a digital log of all inspections. Include pressure valve testing in the predictive maintenance program recently implemented. Any valve showing wear patterns must be replaced immediately rather than repaired.

name: Install Pressure Release Valve Guards and Barriers
description: Engineer and install physical barriers around all pressure release points on injection molding equipment to redirect high-pressure spray away from operator work zones. Use stainless steel protective shields rated for 1,500+ PSI. Ensure guards allow adequate access for maintenance while protecting personnel during normal operations and valve releases.

name: Mandate Heat-Resistant PPE for Injection Molding Operations
description: Require all injection molding operators to wear Aluminized proximity suits or heat-resistant arm guards rated for hydraulic fluid burns when working near pressure relief systems. Conduct mandatory training on proper donning and doffing of heat-resistant PPE. Replace PPE annually or after any incident. Include pressure system hazard awareness in monthly safety meetings.

name: Replace All Secondary Containment Systems with Certified Stainless Steel Units
description: Conduct comprehensive audit of all chemical storage secondary containment systems. Replace all plastic and aged containment trays with stainless steel units certified for 20-year lifespan. Install new units with integrated drain systems equipped with shutoff valves to prevent spill discharge. Ensure containment capacity meets or exceeds 110% of largest container volume in each storage zone. Document all installations with certification records.

name: Establish Chemical Storage Equipment Lifecycle Management Program
description: Implement a computerized asset tracking system for all chemical storage equipment including secondary containment systems. Establish mandatory replacement schedules: 10 years maximum for plastic containers, 20 years for stainless steel. Conduct quarterly visual inspections for cracks, corrosion, and structural integrity. Any equipment beyond rated lifespan or showing damage must be removed from service immediately.

name: Install Drain Interception and Environmental Monitoring System
description: Install a stormwater drain interception system with absorbent filter cartridges rated for volatile organic compounds (VOC). Add secondary drain monitoring with pH sensors and chemical detection alarms that alert operations immediately to any spill discharge. Create redundant containment zones with separate drain controls for the chemical storage area. Conduct quarterly drain testing to ensure all systems function correctly.

name: Mandatory Heat-Resistant PPE Requirement
description: Implement a mandatory heat-resistant glove requirement for all Injection Molding Operators before starting shift work on lines operating above 60°C. Provide each operator with certified silicone or aramid gloves rated for at least 250°C contact. Establish a visual checklist at each molding station showing required PPE. Train all supervisors to conduct pre-shift PPE verification. This administrative control addresses the root cause of inadequate protection during regular operation.

name: Machine Safety Interlock Installation
description: Install thermal safety interlocks on all 32 injection molding machines to prevent manual access to the ejection zone when mold temperatures exceed 70°C. This engineering control will physically block access to hot zones until temperature drops to safe levels, eliminating the possibility of direct contact with heated surfaces. Work with equipment manufacturer to retrofit existing machines within 60 days.

name: Overhead Crane Inspection and Certification
description: Immediately engage a certified CNESST-qualified inspection service to perform complete mechanical and load-testing inspection of the overhead crane system. Repair or replace the load-limiting device to ensure proper function. Once repairs are completed and certified, establish a maintenance schedule with inspections every 6 months and load tests annually. Maintain detailed inspection records. This addresses the regulatory compliance violation and eliminates the risk of equipment failure or overload incidents.

name: Equipment Maintenance Tracking System
description: Implement a computerized equipment maintenance management system to track inspection and certification dates for all critical lifting equipment, including cranes, hoists, and forklifts. Set up automated alerts 30 days before certification expiration. Assign Viktor Novak (EMP-00116) as Equipment Maintenance Coordinator to monitor compliance. Generate monthly reports to management. This administrative control ensures no equipment falls out of compliance and provides documentation for regulatory audits.

name: Crane Operator Refresher Training
description: Conduct mandatory refresher training for all crane operators on load calculation, equipment limitations, and proper usage procedures. Include specific instruction on recognizing signs of equipment malfunction and the requirement to report maintenance concerns immediately. Training should emphasize that load-limiting devices are critical safety features and should never be bypassed or disabled. Require certification upon completion.

name: Emergency Exit Pathway Clearance
description: Immediately remove all stored materials, equipment, and containers from the emergency exit pathway in the Chemical Storage Room. Establish a minimum 1.5-meter clear zone along the entire exit route as required by fire code regulations. Relocate flammable solvent containers to a designated flammable storage cabinet located at least 5 meters from the exit. Paint floor markings to delineate the permanent clear zone. Conduct monthly audits to ensure compliance.

name: Fire Extinguisher Accessibility Audit
description: Conduct comprehensive audit of all fire extinguisher locations throughout the facility to ensure 100% accessibility and visibility. Remove or relocate any obstructions blocking fire extinguishers. Install reflective signage above each extinguisher location. Establish a policy prohibiting storage of materials within 1 meter of any fire safety equipment. In the Chemical Storage Room specifically, relocate storage racks to eliminate obstruction and repair non-functioning emergency lighting simultaneously.

name: Emergency Lighting System Repair and Inspection
description: Immediately repair the non-functioning emergency lighting above the exit in the Chemical Storage Room. Conduct facility-wide inspection of all emergency lighting systems to identify any additional failures. Establish a quarterly preventive maintenance schedule for all emergency lighting. Ensure backup power systems are functional and tested monthly. This engineering control ensures visibility during emergency evacuation scenarios.

name: Enhanced Lockout/Tagout Procedure for Injection Molding Machines
description: Implement a revised LOTO procedure that includes mandatory energy isolation at the main hydraulic disconnect, not just the machine control panel. All 32 injection molding machines will have color-coded energy isolation points clearly marked. New training will be mandatory for all operators and maintenance staff within 7 days. The procedure will require a two-person verification system where a second authorized employee confirms all energy sources are isolated before any work begins. Monthly audits by Gaétan Laplante (LOTO Coordinator) will verify compliance.

name: Hydraulic Accumulator Preventive Maintenance Schedule
description: Establish a quarterly preventive maintenance schedule for hydraulic accumulators on all injection molding equipment. Andrei Popov (Hydraulic Systems Technician) will lead a comprehensive inspection of all 32 machines' hydraulic systems. This includes pressure relief valve testing, accumulator pre-charge verification, and hose integrity assessment. A maintenance log will be created for each machine and tracked in the CMMS system. Any machine showing pressure drift of more than 50 psi will be taken offline until repairs are completed. This eliminates the root cause of unexpected pressure surges.

name: Install Dual-Channel Safety Interlocks on High-Risk Molding Lines
description: Engineering controls will be implemented on the 8 highest-tonnage injection molding machines (250+ tons). Each machine will receive a dual-channel electronic safety interlock system that prevents mold opening if hands are detected in the cavity area using infrared sensors. The system operates independently from the main machine control, ensuring failsafe operation. Installation will be completed by external specialists over 10 working days. Training for all operators on the new system will be mandatory. This engineering control eliminates the possibility of unexpected mold closure during maintenance.

name: Comprehensive Forklift Fleet Inspection and Maintenance Audit
description: All 12 electric and propane forklifts will undergo a complete pre-operation safety inspection including hydraulic system integrity testing, mast alignment verification, and load capacity validation. Andrei Popov will conduct the inspections with assistance from maintenance technicians. Any equipment found with hydraulic leaks, worn seals, or misaligned masts will be immediately removed from service. A monthly maintenance checklist will be implemented for each vehicle, tracked in a digital system. The failed forklift will be sent to an authorized dealer for complete hydraulic system rebuild. All inspections will be completed within 14 days.

name: Forklift Operator Recertification and Load Stability Training
description: All forklift operators will attend a mandatory 4-hour recertification course emphasizing load stability, weight distribution, and emergency response procedures. The training will specifically address the risks of unbalanced loads and hydraulic system failures. Each operator must demonstrate competency through practical assessment including load handling on slopes and around obstacles. Karine Cloutier will coordinate with an external certified trainer. Training will be completed for all operators within 30 days. Operators will be required to perform visual pre-operation checks and report any anomalies before beginning their shift.

name: Upgrade Personal Protective Equipment for Glass Fiber Handling
description: All assembly operators working with glass fiber-reinforced composites will be provided with specialized nitrile-coated gloves with fine fiber barrier technology, replacing standard cotton gloves. Additionally, long-sleeve protective shirts will be made available to all personnel in the composite processing area. Inventory will include XS to XXL sizes to ensure proper fit. Stock will be maintained in the Assembly and Finishing Department with monthly replenishment. Workers will receive a one-page illustrated guide on proper donning and doffing procedures. The new PPE will be implemented immediately with training provided during the next shift briefing.

name: Glass Fiber Safety Awareness Training Module
description: Karine Cloutier will develop and deliver a 30-minute safety training module focused on glass fiber hazards, including skin irritation mechanisms, inhalation risks, and proper control measures. The training will be delivered to all 24 assembly operators and composite processing staff within 7 days. Visual aids will show magnified images of glass fiber particles and demonstrate proper glove selection. The training will emphasize the importance of reporting skin irritation immediately and the location of first aid supplies. A refresher training will be scheduled quarterly. Training attendance will be documented in employee files.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a comprehensive preventive maintenance program for all hydraulic systems on injection molding lines. Maintenance intervals will be set at 500 operating hours or quarterly, whichever comes first. All hydraulic seals, pumps, and pressure relief valves will be inspected for wear, leakage, and proper calibration. A detailed maintenance log will be maintained for each machine. Equipment will be pressure-tested and recalibrated after any maintenance work. Training will be provided to all operators on recognizing early warning signs of hydraulic system failure.

name: Install Pressure Monitoring Sensors on All Injection Molding Machines
description: Install automatic pressure monitoring sensors with visual and audible alarms on all injection molding equipment. These sensors will alert operators and maintenance staff when pressure exceeds safe operating ranges by more than 5%. Real-time pressure data will be logged to a central monitoring system accessible to supervisors and maintenance personnel. This engineering control will eliminate reliance on manual gauge checks and provide immediate notification of system anomalies.

name: Install Automatic Cooling Verification System on Conveyor Lines
description: Implement an infrared temperature monitoring system on the packaging conveyor that automatically alerts operators when component temperatures exceed 65°C. The system will include a hold function that pauses the conveyor until parts reach safe handling temperature (below 50°C). This engineering control will prevent workers from contacting excessively hot materials. Sensors will be calibrated weekly to ensure accuracy.

name: Provide Heat-Resistant Gloves and Mandatory PPE for Packaging Operations
description: Issue specialized heat-resistant gloves (rated to 250°C) to all packaging and handling personnel. Conduct training on proper glove selection, inspection, and replacement protocols. Gloves must be inspected daily for wear and replaced if damaged. Establish a mandatory requirement that all personnel handling materials from the cooling conveyor must wear appropriate heat-resistant PPE. Supervisors will conduct daily safety briefings on burn prevention.

name: Replace and Upgrade Electrical Distribution Panel with Fault Detection System
description: Replace the faulty 480-volt distribution panel with a modern unit equipped with arc flash mitigation technology, including arc-flash relays and maintenance switches. Install continuous fault detection sensors that trigger automatic disconnection when electrical anomalies are detected. The new panel will include surge protection and grounding improvements. All terminals will be gold-plated to prevent corrosion. A dedicated breaker lockout will be installed. The entire installation will meet current CSA and NEC standards.

name: Implement Enhanced Ventilation System in Chemical Storage Area
description: Install a dedicated mechanical ventilation system with minimum 8 air changes per hour in the Chemical Storage and Mixing Room. Add explosion-proof fans rated for Class II, Division 1 hazardous locations. Install vapor detection sensors that automatically activate ventilation when solvent vapor concentrations exceed 20% of lower explosive limit. System will include make-up air intake with activated carbon filtration. All ductwork will be properly grounded to prevent static electricity accumulation.

name: Establish Quarterly Electrical Maintenance and Inspection Program
description: Implement a comprehensive quarterly electrical maintenance program for all distribution panels, terminals, and connections facility-wide. Each inspection will include thermal imaging to identify hot spots, megohm testing for insulation integrity, and terminal resistance measurements. Any corroded or damaged components will be replaced immediately. A certified electrician will conduct all inspections and maintain detailed records. Training will be provided to maintenance staff on proper electrical safety procedures and lockout/tagout requirements.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Certification Program for Production Staff
description: Develop and deliver a comprehensive lockout/tagout certification program specifically for injection molding operators. All production staff will receive hands-on training on proper engagement of machine interlocks before any cleaning or maintenance activities. Training will include written examinations and practical competency assessments. A monthly refresher training will be scheduled, and certification records will be maintained. This addresses the root cause of inadequate LOTO understanding and ensures consistent application of safety procedures across all production lines.

name: Install Visual Interlock Status Indicators
description: Install bright LED indicator lights on each injection molding machine showing real-time interlock engagement status. Green light indicates interlocks are engaged and machine cannot activate; red light indicates interlocks disengaged and machine is ready to operate. This engineering control provides immediate visual confirmation that safety systems are active, reducing reliance on operator memory or procedures alone.

name: Upgrade PPE Requirements for Regrind Operations
description: Establish mandatory use of nitrile chemical-resistant gloves (minimum 8-mil thickness) and long-sleeved protective sleeves for all personnel working with mold release agents and recycled materials. Update the PPE Matrix document to reflect these requirements and conduct toolbox talks to reinforce proper donning and doffing procedures. Ensure adequate supply of appropriately-sized gloves is maintained at all workstations. This PPE-based control provides immediate protection while engineering solutions are evaluated.

name: Install Enhanced Chemical Hazard Communication System
description: Replace all mold release agent containers with clearly labeled, color-coded containers featuring prominent hazard symbols and pictograms indicating skin contact risks. Install laminated hazard information sheets at all mold release agent storage and usage locations. Ensure WHMIS-compliant Safety Data Sheets are accessible electronically and in hard copy. Conduct mandatory WHMIS refresher training for all staff involved in material handling. This administrative control ensures clear communication of hazards and proper identification of chemical products.

name: Evaluate Alternative Mold Release Agents
description: Conduct a comprehensive evaluation of lower-irritant or hypoallergenic mold release agents that maintain equivalent performance but reduce skin sensitization risk. Work with suppliers to identify formulations that minimize allergic reactions while preserving part quality standards. Perform trial runs on one production line to validate substitute products. If successful, implement phased transition across all lines. This substitution control addresses the hazard at the source rather than relying solely on PPE.

name: Install Environmental Controls in Heat Treatment Area
description: Install a dedicated HVAC system with humidity and chemical vapor extraction in the Post-Processing and Heat Treatment area to reduce corrosive atmospheric conditions around sensitive equipment. The system will include activated charcoal filters to capture chemical vapors and maintain humidity levels below 60%. Additionally, apply protective epoxy coating to all aluminum frames and steel components of remaining ovens and similar equipment. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of corrosion by modifying the environmental conditions that accelerated equipment degradation.

name: Implement Quarterly Equipment Integrity Inspection Program
description: Establish a formal preventive maintenance schedule requiring quarterly structural inspections of all large manufacturing equipment, particularly those located in areas with chemical exposure or high humidity. Inspections will include visual assessment for corrosion, crack detection, mounting bracket integrity, and electrical connection security. Create a checklist-based inspection form and maintain records in a centralized database. Any equipment showing signs of deterioration will be immediately flagged for remediation or replacement planning. This administrative control ensures early detection of equipment degradation before catastrophic failure occurs.

name: Establish Equipment Relocation Buffer Zone
description: Physically relocate the Post-Processing and Heat Treatment area equipment at least 25 feet away from the Hazardous Waste Management Area exterior zone to minimize exposure to chemical vapors and moisture. Install a sealed partition wall between the two areas with adequate ventilation separation. This elimination control removes the source of corrosive exposure by separating sensitive equipment from the contaminating environment, providing long-term protection.

name: Implement Chemical Storage Tank Maintenance Schedule
description: Establish a quarterly inspection and maintenance protocol for all chemical storage tanks and valves. This will include visual inspections for corrosion, pressure testing, and valve replacement on a 5-year cycle. A tracking system will be implemented using TechnoPlast's maintenance management software. All maintenance activities will be documented and reviewed by the Chemical Safety Officer. This addresses the root cause of valve corrosion and failure due to lack of preventive maintenance.

name: Enhanced Ventilation System Upgrades
description: Install additional mechanical ventilation and air exchange units in the Chemical Storage and Mixing Room to ensure faster clearance of vapors in case of future incidents. Include installation of real-time vapor detection sensors that trigger automatic alerts and ventilation ramp-up. This engineering control will reduce exposure time for employees working in or near the chemical storage area during spills or normal operations.

name: Chemical Safety Awareness Training Refresh
description: Conduct mandatory retraining for all employees who work with or near chemical storage areas. Training will cover: spill response procedures, proper PPE requirements, emergency evacuation routes, and symptom recognition for chemical exposure. Specific focus on Material Handlers and Packaging Operators. Training will be completed within 30 days and documented for compliance. Annual refresher training will be scheduled thereafter.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Program for Injection Molding Equipment
description: Deploy a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that tracks all 32 injection molding machines and automatically schedules maintenance at manufacturer-recommended intervals. Specifically ensure hydraulic system relief valves are serviced every 6 months. Create detailed maintenance checklists for each machine type. Assign dedicated maintenance technicians to each shift. This engineering and administrative control directly addresses the root cause of deferred maintenance leading to equipment failure.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Hydraulic Fluid Protection Barriers
description: Install secondary containment trays beneath all hydraulic injection molding machines to contain fluid discharge during line ruptures. Add protective barriers and deflectors around high-pressure hydraulic lines to redirect spray away from work areas. This will reduce employee exposure to pressurized hydraulic fluid discharge and prevent environmental contamination.

name: Establish Automated Material Handling System Maintenance Schedule
description: Create a documented preventive maintenance schedule for all automated conveyor systems and robotic arms in the warehouse, including bi-weekly lubrication checks, monthly motor inspections, and quarterly bearing assessments. Implement a checklist system that warehouse staff must complete and sign off on. Assign responsibility to Warehouse Lead Michel Laflamme to oversee compliance. Motor seizing will be prevented through consistent lubrication, directly addressing this incident's root cause.

name: Comprehensive LOTO Program Review and Equipment Modification
description: Conduct immediate facility-wide audit of lockout/tagout procedures across all automated injection molding equipment. Install secondary mechanical lock engagement confirmation systems on all machines to prevent accidental cycle initiation. Relocate and clearly mark all emergency stop buttons with high-visibility signage and ensure minimum 36-inch clearance around all emergency controls. Implement automated interlocks on mold access doors that physically prevent machine operation when door is opened. Establish mandatory LOTO refresher training for all production operators with quarterly competency assessments. Install warning lights and audible alarms that activate 5 seconds before injection cycle resumes. Require presence of two personnel during all mold maintenance operations.

name: Enhanced Machine Guarding and Access Control Implementation
description: Install transparent polycarbonate guards around injection points and platen areas of Line B equipment to provide visual access while preventing hand contact with pinch points. Retrofit all machine output trays with automatic material ejection systems so parts are safely ejected without manual extraction. Implement motion-sensor interlocks on guard doors that stop machine operation when accessed. Install priority training program for all assembly operators on hazard recognition specific to injection molding equipment. Provide specialized cut-resistant gloves (Level 5 ANSI rating) to all personnel working with hot plastic parts. Conduct bi-weekly safety toolbox talks focused on machine-specific hazards.

name: Hydraulic System Preventive Maintenance and Inspection Protocol Enhancement
description: Implement comprehensive hydraulic hose and fitting inspection protocol requiring quarterly non-destructive testing (NDT) of all high-pressure hydraulic connections using ultrasonic and visual inspection methods. Establish a hydraulic fluid quality monitoring program with monthly laboratory analysis of fluid samples to detect contamination early. Create a mandatory equipment log for all hydraulic components documenting installation date, pressure ratings, and inspection history. Develop a supplier qualification program requiring all replacement hydraulic hose assemblies to include certified inspection reports. Train all maintenance personnel on early warning signs of hydraulic system degradation including visible seepage, discoloration, and unusual noises. Establish a parts inventory management system to ensure defective components are never accidentally re-installed.

name: Mandatory LOTO Verification System Implementation
description: Install mechanical verification locks on all injection molding lines requiring photo documentation before operation. Implement digital LOTO log system with barcode scanning to ensure every maintenance or material-clearing activity is documented with timestamps. All production supervisors must complete LOTO auditor certification within 30 days. Weekly audits will verify compliance with zero tolerance for bypassing procedures. This addresses the root cause of time-saving pressure by creating accountability and physical barriers to unsafe shortcuts.

name: Production Line Safety Training and Tooling Equipment
description: Provide all production operators with certified training on proper hopper clearing techniques using specialized non-conductive tools and proximity sensors. Install automatic shutoff systems on hoppers that activate when access doors are opened. Establish mandatory cool-down periods before any manual intervention. Create laminated reference cards at each workstation detailing safe procedures. This engineering and administrative control ensures operators have both tools and knowledge to manage material jams safely without risking hand contact.

name: Production Schedule Review and Staffing Adjustment
description: Review production scheduling to eliminate extreme time pressures that incentivize unsafe shortcuts. Conduct time-motion study to establish realistic cycle times. Increase staffing during peak demand periods to maintain safety standards. Implement management scorecard that weighs safety compliance equally with production targets. This addresses the systemic cause by removing the false choice between safety and productivity, ensuring operators are not pressured to bypass critical safety procedures.

name: Preventive Hydraulic System Maintenance Schedule Enhancement
description: Implement quarterly hydraulic system inspection program with specific focus on O-ring seals and connection points on all injection presses. Create preventive replacement schedule for seals based on manufacturer recommendations rather than reactive failure. Stock critical spare parts for rapid replacement. Train all machine setters to recognize early signs of seal degradation including minor weeping before catastrophic failure. This engineering and administrative control prevents future hydraulic incidents through systematic maintenance rather than waiting for failures to occur.

name: Mechanical Lift Equipment Installation and Training
description: Install pneumatic lift assists and counterbalance system at all material handling workstations in the warehouse and maintenance areas. These engineering controls eliminate the need for manual lifting of loads over 25 pounds. Provide hands-on training to all material handlers on proper use of the new equipment, including maintenance and troubleshooting. Create visual work instructions at each station showing the mechanical lift method as the standard procedure. This substitution control removes the hazard by replacing manual lifting with powered equipment.

name: Ergonomic Assessment and Workstation Redesign
description: Conduct comprehensive ergonomic assessment of all material handling workstations including height, reach distance, and work surface design. Implement adjustable-height benches and carts to accommodate various operator heights and reduce strain. Provide ergonomic assessment for Hassan Diallo to identify any pre-existing conditions requiring accommodation. Implement 'no lift over 25 pounds manually' policy with peer verification system. Monthly toolbox talks on proper body mechanics when equipment is unavailable. This administrative and engineering control addresses root causes of lifting injuries.

name: Install Secondary Containment System for Chemical Transfers
description: Implement engineered secondary containment trays rated for 150% of bulk container capacity in the Chemical Storage and Mixing area. All chemical transfer operations must occur within these trays to prevent spills from spreading beyond the contained area. Train all personnel involved in chemical handling on proper positioning of containers within trays. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause by physically preventing spill liquid from reaching uncontained areas and creating slip hazards.

name: Quarterly Inspection and Maintenance of Quick-Disconnect Couplings
description: Establish a preventive maintenance schedule requiring quarterly inspection of all quick-disconnect couplings used in chemical transfer operations. Inspect for wear, corrosion, and seal degradation. Replace couplings showing any signs of deterioration before they fail. Maintain a detailed log of all inspections and replacements. This administrative control ensures equipment reliability and prevents catastrophic failures that lead to spills.

name: Enhanced Spill Response Training for Production Staff
description: Deliver comprehensive spill response training to all personnel working in or near the Chemical Storage and Mixing area. Training will cover hazard identification, proper use of absorbent materials, containment procedures, personal protective equipment requirements, and emergency notification protocols. Conduct training within 2 weeks and include annual refresher sessions. This administrative control ensures rapid, proper response if future spills occur, minimizing exposure and environmental impact.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Checklist Before Manual Part Removal
description: Develop and deploy a visual checklist that must be completed and signed off before any manual part removal from injection molds. The checklist will require verification of: (1) Machine powered off, (2) Lockout pin installed, (3) Pressure gauge reading zero, (4) Mold cooled to safe temperature (thermal probe verification), (5) All covers in place. Post laminated copies at each injection molding station. This administrative control ensures the LOTO procedure is consistently followed and prevents future incidents involving residual pressure or heat.

name: Install Automatic Pressure Relief Warning System on Injection Molds
description: Engineer and install an audible warning system that automatically activates when residual hydraulic pressure exceeds safe thresholds during machine standby. The system will provide both visual (LED indicator) and audible (buzzer) alerts to operators that pressure dissipation is incomplete. This engineering control provides immediate feedback that manual intervention is unsafe, preventing operators from bypassing LOTO procedures due to incomplete awareness of residual system pressure.

name: Establish Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Ventilation System Motors
description: Implement a documented preventive maintenance program requiring monthly lubrication inspection, bearing condition assessment, and belt tension verification for all ventilation system motors. Schedule quarterly deep servicing including bearing replacement if wear indicators are present. Maintain a detailed maintenance log with dates, findings, and corrective actions. Assign maintenance responsibility to a dedicated technician with oversight by Viktor Novak. This administrative control prevents equipment degradation that leads to sudden failures.

name: Install Backup Ventilation Activation System with Redundant Monitoring
description: Engineer and install a redundant monitoring system with two independent sensors that detect ventilation system failure. Upon dual-sensor confirmation of failure, the system will automatically activate a backup ventilation unit and trigger both visual and audible alarms at operator stations and in the main office. Additionally, install a backup electric motor for the primary ventilation system with automatic switchover capability. This engineering control ensures continuous ventilation even during primary system failure and guarantees immediate operator notification.

name: Daily Pre-Shift Ventilation System Verification Procedure
description: Require all machine setters and regrind operators to perform a daily pre-shift verification that ventilation systems are operating normally. Check should include: (1) Visual observation of air flow at exhaust vents, (2) Listening for normal motor operation, (3) Verification of system indicator light (if equipped). Document checks on a posted log. This administrative control provides early detection of system degradation before catastrophic failure occurs.

name: Upgrade Thermal Protective Gloves for Injection Molding
description: Replace standard cotton work gloves with high-temperature resistant gloves rated for sustained contact up to 150°C. These gloves will feature silicone-coated palms and extended cuff protection for the forearm. Distribute new gloves to all Line B operators and provide hands-on training on proper fit and usage. The new gloves are specifically designed for hot plastic handling and will reduce contact burn risk by 85%. Implementation includes a 30-minute training session for all affected operators on the characteristics of thermal PPE.

name: Implement Enhanced Mold Release Agent Protocol
description: Conduct an audit of mold release agent application procedures on all injection molding lines. Establish minimum coverage standards (100% cavity coverage verified visually) and implement a checklist system before each production run. Train machine setters and operators on proper application techniques using aerosol and brush methods. Document application dates and times on line logs. Schedule weekly supervision checks during first month, then monthly thereafter. This administrative control will ensure adequate release agent barrier and reduce stuck-part incidents by 60%.

name: Install Automated Cooling System Monitoring
description: Deploy a real-time cooling system sensor network with automated alerting capability. Install pressure transducers, temperature sensors, and flow meters on all critical cooling loops. Connect to a centralized monitoring dashboard that triggers alerts when parameters deviate 15% from baseline. System will automatically shut down affected equipment to prevent damage. Include email and SMS notifications to maintenance team. This engineering control eliminates the gap between failure occurrence and detection, reducing potential damage by 90%.

name: Establish Predictive Maintenance Schedule with Component Replacement
description: Replace all carbon steel hose clamps and connectors with marine-grade stainless steel fasteners rated for corrosive environments. Create a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that schedules cooling system inspections every 6 months (reducing from 12-month interval). Inspections include visual assessment of all connections, hose integrity testing, coolant analysis, and sensor calibration. Generate automated work orders and track completion. Training for maintenance staff on new schedule and procedures. This engineering control upgrade plus administrative procedure ensures early detection of degradation.

name: Install Load-Securing Restraint Systems on All Dock Forklifts
description: Retrofit all 8 electric forklifts in the warehouse with automated load-securing systems including: retractable netting barriers on mast, adjustable load stops, and integrated weight sensors that prevent fork lift if load exceeds safety threshold. Add audible/visual warnings when loads exceed height limits. Equipment cost includes installation and calibration. This engineering control eliminates movement of unstable loads, preventing 95% of similar incidents. All operators must receive 2-hour certification on new equipment before use.

name: Implement Mandatory Pre-Movement Load Stability Inspections
description: Establish a three-point load verification protocol that must be completed before any pallet movement: (1) Visual inspection of pallet stacking height against posted limits, (2) Physical stability test by pushing load laterally, (3) Photographic documentation via mobile app for audit trail. Create laminated checklist cards for each forklift. Train all material handlers with 1-hour hands-on session. Supervisors conduct spot-checks weekly. Non-compliance results in immediate work stoppage and retraining. This administrative control ensures consistent verification of load integrity.

name: Install Physical Height Limit Barriers and Rack Protection
description: Install permanent hard stops on all storage racks at maximum recommended stack height (2.1m) that physically prevent pallets from being positioned higher. Add protective bumpers to lower rack sections (0.5-1.2m height) to reduce crush hazard risk. Paint bright yellow/black hazard stripes on all racks. These passive engineering controls eliminate the human decision point regarding stacking height and provide secondary protection against falling load impact.

name: Implement Solvent Storage Protocol Revision
description: Establish a new mandatory procedure requiring all flammable liquids and volatile solvents to be stored in approved metal cabinets located at least 5 meters away from any heat source exceeding 100°C. Conduct immediate inventory audit of all chemical storage in production areas. Implement color-coded labels and signage indicating proximity hazards to heat sources. Train all shift supervisors and material handlers on the revised protocol within 5 days. This directly addresses the root cause of placing solvent near a heat exchanger.

name: Upgrade Fire Suppression System Monitoring
description: Install automated temperature and flame detection sensors in the Composite Materials Processing Area with real-time alerts to HSE staff and facility management. Upgrade manual fire suppression controls with secondary confirmation switches to prevent accidental discharge while maintaining rapid emergency response capability. Conduct quarterly maintenance inspections instead of semi-annual. Provide refresher training to all personnel on fire suppression system operation and safe discharge protocols.

name: Enhanced Shift Handover Safety Briefing
description: Create standardized 10-minute safety briefing checklist for all shift transitions that specifically covers chemical storage locations, heat source hazards, and emergency response procedures. Require supervisors to physically walk new shift personnel through the production area highlighting high-risk zones. Document all briefings in the employee safety log. This ensures consistent communication of hazard awareness across all shifts.

name: Mandatory Forklift Hydraulic System Inspection Protocol
description: Establish a non-negotiable monthly hydraulic system inspection and certification protocol for all forklifts, conducted by certified maintenance technicians. Create a digital maintenance tracking system that automatically flags equipment due for service and prevents operators from using non-compliant units. All hydraulic systems must pass pressure testing and leak detection before each shift begins. Implement immediate replacement of any equipment showing signs of hydraulic deterioration. This eliminates the root cause of the mechanical failure.

name: Install Load Stabilization Barriers and Guards
description: Install protective barriers and automatic load clamps on all pallet stacking racks that physically prevent loads from falling unexpectedly. Add edge protection and crush-zone guards around all material handling areas. Ensure minimum 3-meter exclusion zone during load positioning operations with visual floor markings and signage. Train all warehouse personnel on the new load stabilization equipment and exclusion zone protocols within 48 hours of installation.

name: Advanced First Aid and Crush Injury Response Training
description: Conduct specialized first aid training for warehouse supervisors and material handlers focused on crush injuries, hand trauma, and emergency limb extraction procedures. Ensure all staff are certified in Advanced First Aid with focus on preventing secondary injuries during emergency response. Establish clear emergency communication protocols and ensure medical emergency access routes are always clear. This training will enable faster and safer emergency response in future incidents.

name: Implement Digital LOTO Communication System
description: Deploy a mandatory electronic lockout/tagout notification system that sends real-time alerts to all shift personnel, supervisors, and maintenance staff when equipment enters LOTO status. Integrate with the facility's control systems to electronically prevent operation of locked-out equipment. Require digital confirmation of LOTO acknowledgment from all personnel who could potentially activate the equipment. Replace physical-only LOTO tags with integrated digital-physical hybrid systems that provide both visual and electronic warnings.

name: Comprehensive LOTO Procedure Audit and Retraining
description: Conduct facility-wide LOTO procedure audit to identify all communication gaps and equipment operation vulnerabilities. Implement mandatory biannual LOTO certification for all maintenance personnel and equipment operators. Create laminated LOTO checklist cards for each major equipment piece showing proper procedure sequence. Establish a zero-tolerance policy for operating equipment not confirmed as properly locked out. Include shift handover verification as a required component of all shift change procedures.

name: Install Temperature Monitoring System on Resin Dryers
description: Deploy automated temperature monitoring and alarm systems on all three industrial resin dryers in UNIT-016. System will include dual temperature sensors, digital display with high-temperature alerts set at 120°C, and automatic shutdown at 130°C. Real-time data logging will enable predictive maintenance analysis. System will send alerts to Production Supervisor and Maintenance Manager via email and facility speakers.

name: Implement Monthly Dryer Maintenance Inspections
description: Establish formal preventive maintenance schedule requiring monthly inspections of all resin dryers by Maintenance team. Inspections will include thermostat calibration verification, heating element resistance testing, and ventilation system flow rate checks. Findings will be documented in digital maintenance log. Maintenance Manager Carlos Rodriguez will oversee implementation and train technicians on inspection procedures.

name: Enhanced Chemical Fume Extraction Upgrade
description: Upgrade material preparation area ventilation system with higher-capacity extraction fans and additional ductwork to improve air circulation. Install secondary air quality monitoring probe at employee breathing height. Coordinate with facilities team to ensure extraction system can handle peak fume loads during equipment malfunctions, meeting or exceeding 15 air changes per hour standard.

name: Mandatory Nozzle Guard Installation Verification Protocol
description: Implement daily pre-shift checklist requiring operators to visually inspect and physically test nozzle guard installation on all injection molding machines before startup. Checklist will be posted at each machine station and must be signed off by operator and shift supervisor. Any guard found improperly installed will prevent machine startup until corrected by maintenance. Training will be provided to all molding operators on proper guard positioning and inspection techniques.

name: Upgrade Nozzle Guard Design and Installation Procedure
description: Engineering review of current nozzle guard design to identify why improper installation occurred. Work with equipment manufacturer to implement improved guard design with foolproof attachment mechanism or quick-connect system that prevents operation if guard is not fully seated. Develop new installation standard operating procedure with photographic guides. All injection molding machines will be retrofitted within 60 days.

name: Thermal Burn Prevention Training Program
description: Develop and deliver comprehensive burn prevention training to all Production Operations staff, covering: identification of high-temperature equipment hazards, safe work practices around injection molding machines, use of appropriate PPE including insulated gloves, first aid response for thermal burns, and recognition of equipment malfunctions. Training will include hands-on demonstration using thermal imaging to show nozzle heat zones. Annual refresher training will be mandatory.

name: Implement Mandatory Deburring Procedure for All Machined Parts
description: Establish formal deburring procedure requiring all CNC-machined mold components to be inspected and deburred before release from the Mold Manufacturing and Repair Shop. Deburring will be performed using appropriate tools (files, burring tools, or deburring machines). Quality control checklist will include verification of edge smoothness using tactile inspection. Procedure will be documented in work instructions posted at each CNC machine station.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish a comprehensive preventive maintenance schedule for all injection molding machine hydraulic systems with weekly pressure monitoring and monthly seal inspections. Install pressure relief valves with automated alert systems that notify maintenance staff when parameters deviate. Conduct quarterly hydraulic fluid analysis to detect contamination early. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of seal failure and will prevent similar failures. Expected outcome: 95% reduction in hydraulic-related equipment failures and associated production losses.

name: Upgrade Mold Safety Interlocks on All Injection Molding Machines
description: Retrofit all 32 injection molding machines with dual-circuit safety interlocks that prevent mold opening and resin injection simultaneously. Install additional pressure relief valves and check valves to contain any hydraulic system failures. Upgrade electrical control systems to meet ISO 13849-1 Performance Level D standards. This engineering control provides secondary containment of pressurized systems. Expected outcome: Complete elimination of uncontrolled mold separation incidents and containment of any hydraulic fluid release.

name: Enhanced Fire Suppression System Verification and Training
description: Conduct comprehensive audit of all fire suppression systems in production areas, verify automatic system response times, and ensure adequate coverage around high-temperature equipment zones. Implement quarterly system inspections and semi-annual full deployment tests. Provide refresher training to all production staff on fire response procedures and evacuation routes. This administrative control ensures rapid response capability. Expected outcome: Confirmed fire suppression readiness and 100% employee awareness of emergency protocols.

name: Deploy Automated Maintenance Interval Tracking System
description: Implement a computerized Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) that tracks all equipment maintenance intervals by operating hours, calendar days, and cycle counts. System will generate automated alerts 7 days before intervals are due and escalate to critical status when overdue. Integrate with production scheduling software to prevent equipment operation beyond maintenance windows. All maintenance records will be digitally stored with photo documentation. This administrative control eliminates missed maintenance scheduling. Expected outcome: 100% compliance with maintenance schedules, zero overdue maintenance intervals, and prevention of seal/bearing failures.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Spill Response Equipment
description: Install containment berms and drip trays beneath all CNC machines and equipment with fluid systems. Upgrade workshop drainage system with collection sumps and fluid recovery capability. Store emergency spill kits (absorbent materials, neutralizers, pump equipment) in accessible stations throughout the workshop with 30-minute response capability. Install continuous fluid level monitors on all reservoir systems with low-level alarms. This engineering control contains and contains fluid releases before widespread contamination. Expected outcome: 95% containment of coolant and hydraulic fluid releases, minimized environmental and equipment damage.

name: Inspect and Tighten Thermal Guards on All Molding Machines
description: Maintenance Supervisor François-Xavier Mailhot will conduct a comprehensive inspection of all 32 injection molding machines to ensure thermal guards and protective barriers are properly mounted with secure fasteners. All loose brackets will be replaced or reinforced. A monthly inspection checklist will be implemented to verify guard integrity. Guards will be tested for stability under normal operating vibrations. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause by eliminating the gap in the thermal barrier that allowed contact with hot material.

name: Enhanced Heat Injury Prevention Training for Production Line Operators
description: Training Coordinator Amélie Roy will develop and deliver a 1-hour training module focused on heat burn prevention, proper PPE selection for high-temperature areas, and emergency response procedures. All production operators will complete this training within 30 days. The training will include hands-on demonstration of proper guard functionality, recognition of thermal hazards, and proper use of heat-resistant sleeves and gloves. Training records will be maintained and reviewed during monthly safety meetings.

name: Mandatory Machine Guard Re-installation and Certification Protocol
description: Maintenance Supervisor François-Xavier Mailhot will implement a strict protocol requiring that all safety interlocks and guards removed for maintenance must be reinstalled and certified before equipment is returned to service. A sign-off sheet will document removal, maintenance work performed, and reinstallation completion with supervisor verification. All granulation equipment will be audited within 48 hours. A preventive maintenance schedule will ensure interlock covers are inspected monthly. This engineering control directly eliminates the hazard that caused the incident.

name: Install Proximity Sensors on All Granulation Equipment Augers
description: Engineering will procure and install proximity sensors on all 4 granulator auger systems in the Material Drying and Preparation Room. These sensors will trigger an automatic emergency stop if hands or objects approach within 10 cm of rotating components. This engineering control provides a fail-safe mechanism independent of operator behavior. Installation will be completed by contract maintenance specialists within 14 days.

name: Mandatory Machine Guarding and Lockout/Tagout Refresher Training
description: Training Coordinator Amélie Roy will conduct mandatory LOTO and machine guarding refresher training for all operators working with granulation, mixing, and material handling equipment. Training will emphasize the critical importance of guard reinstallation after maintenance and proper reporting of missing or damaged guards. All 45 relevant employees must complete training within 30 days. Competency assessment will be performed before returning employees to duty.

name: Replace HDR-450X Thermostat with Redundant Sensor System
description: Maintenance will replace the failed thermostat with a dual-sensor system featuring primary and backup temperature sensors with independent alarms. The new system will include an over-temperature safety shutoff at 130°C regardless of thermostat input. A calibration verification will be performed before returning to service. This engineering control eliminates the single-point-of-failure that caused the overheat condition.

name: Implement Maintenance Backlog Visibility and Risk Assessment Protocol
description: HSE and Maintenance departments will establish a monthly meeting to review all deferred maintenance items, categorize by risk level, and assign priority. Critical equipment maintenance deferrals (like thermostats on dryers) will trigger automatic escalation to operations management with documented risk assessment. Supply chain delays will be communicated immediately to enable alternative sourcing or temporary controls. A tracking dashboard will be maintained and reviewed at monthly JHSC meetings.

name: Quarterly Preventive Maintenance Audit and Certification for Critical Equipment
description: Maintenance Supervisor will implement quarterly comprehensive audits of all heating, drying, and thermal processing equipment. Each audit will verify that scheduled maintenance has been completed, replacement parts are installed, and sensors are functioning within specification. A certification sign-off will be required before equipment returns to production. This administrative control ensures maintenance deferrals are identified before they create hazardous conditions.

name: Implement Cut-Resistant Glove Protocol for Component Handling
description: Establish mandatory use of Level 4 cut-resistant gloves (nitrile-coated polyester) for all employees handling molded components with sharp edges or burrs. Create visual work instruction posters at each injection molding line showing proper glove donning and inspection procedures. Include this requirement in the daily pre-shift briefing and add to the operator training checklist. Conduct a 30-minute toolbox talk on hand protection for all Line B and Line D operators within 5 days of incident.

name: Prioritize Deburring Process Queue Management
description: Implement a real-time queue management system in the finishing department to prevent backlog of unfinished components. Establish a maximum hold time of 4 hours for components awaiting deburring operations. When queue exceeds 2-hour capacity, trigger automatic process rebalancing by assigning additional finishing technicians. Priya Sharma (Industrial Engineer) will conduct a process flow analysis to identify bottlenecks and recommend staffing adjustments within 10 days.

name: Install Secondary Containment Trays for Chemical Storage Shelves
description: Replace all open shelving in the chemical storage areas with heavy-duty steel shelving featuring integrated secondary containment trays beneath each shelf level. Each tray must have a capacity of at least 110% of the largest container stored above it. The containment trays will be designed with sloped floors directing any spills to a collection sump with absorbent materials and drain valve. Install absorbent pads on each tray. This engineering control eliminates potential floor contamination and ensures spills are immediately contained. All installations must be completed within 30 days.

name: Establish Monthly Container Integrity Inspection Program
description: Implement a mandatory monthly inspection schedule for all chemical containers stored in inventory. Natasha Ivanov will develop a digital inspection checklist covering: container exterior condition (cracks, dents, corrosion), lid/seal integrity, label legibility, and shelf positioning. All containers will be photographed and logged in a database. Any container showing signs of compromise will be immediately flagged for replacement or transfer to secondary containment. Training will be provided to all warehouse and materials staff. This administrative control ensures early detection of container failures before spills occur.

name: Restrict Forklift Operations in Chemical Storage Area
description: Designate a clear no-forklift zone within 3 meters of chemical storage shelving. Install permanent floor markings and signage indicating the restriction. Establish an alternative material delivery route that bypasses the chemical storage zone. Only cart-based (non-powered) material handling will be permitted within the buffer zone. This engineering/administrative control eliminates the primary source of container damage through accidental impact.

name: Implement Enhanced LOTO Procedure for Hydraulic Systems with Accumulator Isolation
description: Revise all LOTO procedures for injection molding machines to include mandatory accumulator pressure bleed-down steps. Specifically: (1) Isolate electrical power and pneumatic energy sources; (2) De-pressurize primary hydraulic system through designated relief valve; (3) Isolate accumulator isolation block valve; (4) Manually bleed accumulator pressure through safety bleed valve while monitoring pressure gauge to zero; (5) Install blind flanges on all isolated lines; (6) Apply multiple lockout devices with authorized technician tags. Create visual step-by-step laminated posters for each machine. Mandatory retraining for all maintenance staff (Andrei, Marco, Claude Rioux) will occur within 5 days with documented competency assessment. Update the JHSC training curriculum.

name: Install Accumulator Pressure Relief and Isolation Improvements
description: Engineering modification to all hydraulic systems: Install secondary manual bleed-down valve with lever handle on the accumulator isolation block, making accumulator depressurization a mandatory two-step mechanical action (no user choice possible). Additionally, install analog pressure gauges on accumulator circuits so technicians can visually confirm zero pressure before work begins. Update all hydraulic system schematics showing new valve locations. These engineering controls eliminate the possibility of residual pressure remaining in accumulators during maintenance work.

name: Establish Buddy System and Witnessed LOTO Verification for Hydraulic Work
description: Implement administrative control requiring all hydraulic maintenance work to be performed with a second qualified technician present who independently verifies all LOTO steps before work begins. Create a LOTO verification checklist with dual sign-off (performer and witness). The witness will use a second key on multi-lock systems to confirm all isolations. This administrative control adds a human verification layer to prevent incomplete LOTO procedures. Training and competency assessment required for all technicians designated as witnesses.

name: Expand Predictive Maintenance Program to All Molding Lines
description: Implement IoT-based vibration sensors on all injection molding pump assemblies to detect bearing degradation before failure occurs. Install monthly lubrication audit checklists with photo documentation requirements. Train all Line Supervisors on early warning signs of pump failure including unusual noise and temperature readings. Establish a rotating maintenance schedule ensuring each pump receives detailed inspection every 14 days rather than the current monthly schedule.

name: Install Secondary Containment for Cooling System Components
description: Engineer and install polypropylene collection trays beneath all pump assemblies on Lines A, B, C, and D to contain fluid releases up to 150 liters capacity. Add drain plugs to facilitate quick removal of spilled coolant for recycling. Install pressure relief valves set at maximum safe operating pressure to prevent catastrophic seal failures. Connect pressure monitoring systems to alert operators when parameters deviate from normal ranges.

name: Implement Daily Safety Interlock Verification Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory daily pre-shift verification procedure requiring all molding line operators to test each safety interlock system. Create a laminated checklist posted at each machine documenting the sequential steps: activate emergency stop, verify automatic shutdown, manually trigger all eject sequences, confirm sensor responsiveness. Document results in a logbook with operator signature. Conduct quarterly audits of logbooks and physical verification of sensor alignment using calibrated laser alignment tools. Train all operators and supervisors on proper alignment procedures and acceptable tolerance ranges.

name: Upgrade Proximity Sensor Mounts with Vibration-Resistant Fasteners
description: Replace all standard fasteners securing proximity sensors on injection molding equipment with thread-locking bolt assemblies rated for 10+ years of continuous vibration exposure. Conduct a facility-wide survey identifying all 48 proximity sensors across production lines. Install stainless steel mounting brackets with increased surface area and rubber isolation pads to reduce resonant vibration transmission. Perform ultrasonic inspection of existing mounts to identify any additional slack. Schedule quarterly re-torque verification and vibration frequency analysis.

name: Conduct Complete Equipment Inventory and Maintenance Audit
description: Perform a comprehensive facility-wide audit of all 156 pieces of manufacturing equipment to identify components not currently included in the preventive maintenance program. Cross-reference equipment serial numbers against maintenance schedules and identify gaps. Create a prioritized list focusing on all thermal regulation systems, pressure controls, and safety interlocks. Assign ownership of each component to specific maintenance technicians. Integrate findings into the ISO 45001 management system and update all documentation by May 15, 2024. Conduct staff training on the expanded maintenance schedule.

name: Install Real-Time Mold Temperature Monitoring and Automatic Alerts
description: Deploy wireless temperature sensors on all injection molding equipment configured to transmit readings to a centralized monitoring system. Set automated alert thresholds that trigger audible and visual warnings when mold temperatures deviate beyond safe operating ranges (130-140°C). Configure the system to trigger automatic cooling cycle interventions and notify supervisors via SMS if temperatures continue rising. Integrate alerts into the production control display visible to all operators. Conduct monthly system diagnostics and calibration checks. Provide training to all production staff on interpreting alert signals and proper response procedures.

name: Enhance Operator Training on Thermal Hazard Recognition and Reporting
description: Develop a mandatory 2-hour training module for all production operators covering thermal burn hazards, temperature monitoring procedures, and early warning signs of equipment malfunction. Require operators to record mold temperatures on shift start, mid-shift, and shift end. Establish a zero-tolerance reporting policy where any temperature anomalies must be immediately escalated to supervisors regardless of magnitude. Create a laminated quick-reference card showing safe vs. hazardous temperature ranges. Conduct refresher training quarterly and implement a competency assessment with practical demonstration.

name: Install Safety Netting and Edge Protection on Mezzanine
description: Install high-visibility safety netting along all mezzanine edges and implement a system of adjustable edge barriers and securing straps for stored materials. This engineering control will prevent objects from falling to lower levels and create a physical containment system for materials. All personnel will receive training on proper loading procedures, weight distribution, and securing methods. Monthly inspections will verify integrity of netting and barriers.

name: Implement Mezzanine Storage Audit and Certification Program
description: Establish a weekly inspection protocol for all mezzanine storage areas with documented checklists. Material handlers will be certified after completing a 2-hour training module on proper stacking, load limits, and securing procedures. Only certified personnel may work in elevated storage areas. Responsibility will rotate among supervisors to ensure compliance. Any non-conformances must be corrected within 24 hours.

name: Replace and Upgrade Temperature-Humidity Monitoring System
description: Install a new automated environmental monitoring system with real-time digital sensors connected to a cloud-based database for continuous temperature and humidity tracking in the chemical storage room. System will include automatic alerts when parameters exceed safe ranges (18-25°C, <60% RH). Manual calibration will be performed quarterly. Historical data will be automatically logged with timestamps. Old TPU containers will be properly disposed of according to WHMIS protocols within 2 weeks.

name: Establish Chemical Inventory Expiration Tracking System
description: Implement a digital inventory management system that tracks expiration dates for all chemical containers. System will generate automated alerts 60 days before expiration, 30 days before expiration, and on the expiration date itself. A second-shift supervisor will conduct a weekly review of upcoming expirations and schedule disposal or use as needed. All incoming chemical shipments will be logged with receipt and expiration dates within 24 hours of arrival. Training will be provided to all personnel with chemical storage access.

name: Implement Enhanced Dust Control and Equipment Cleaning Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory daily cleaning schedule for the regrind department, with particular focus on horizontal surfaces, collection bins, and grinding mill housings. All dust must be removed at the end of each shift using HEPA-filter equipped vacuum systems (no compressed air to prevent dust dispersal). Cleaning logs must be signed by the shift supervisor and reviewed daily by management. Additionally, install permanent dust collection hoods above critical equipment that connect to the facility's central vacuum system. Weekly deep cleaning with specialized equipment will be performed on weekends.

name: Restore and Accelerate Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Regrind Equipment
description: Immediately conduct a full mechanical inspection of the grinding mill bearing assembly and all rotating components. Replace any worn bearings, seals, and electrical connectors. Schedule bearing replacement every 6 months (not annually). Establish a computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that tracks all equipment maintenance, generates automatic work orders when intervals approach, and flags overdue tasks in real-time. Maintenance technician Daniel Kim will be assigned primary responsibility with backup coverage. Weekly equipment inspections will be conducted by shift supervisors.

name: Service and Upgrade Fire Suppression Systems
description: Immediately pressure-test all dry chemical fire suppression systems serving the regrind and recycling area and adjacent sections. Replace any depleted or expired extinguishing agents. Install automatic fire detection sensors (heat and smoke) directly above regrind equipment with interconnected alarms to the main facility system. Conduct employee training on proper use of CO2 and dry chemical extinguishers with hands-on practice. Annual certification and pressure testing will be mandated. Emergency response plan will be updated and posted in the regrind area.

name: Mold Cavity Inspection and Repair Program
description: Implement a comprehensive mold inspection protocol requiring visual examination and tactile testing of all cavity surfaces every 500 production cycles. Establish a maintenance schedule to polish and refinish mold cavities showing micro-cracks or burr-producing defects. Partner with the Mold Manufacturing and Repair Shop to prioritize molds with identified defects. Train all machine setters on proper visual inspection techniques and require documentation of findings. Expected outcome: reduce sharp edge incidents by 85% within 60 days.

name: Enhanced PPE Requirements for Part Handling
description: Upgrade personal protective equipment for all operators handling injection-molded parts to include cut-resistant gloves (Level 4 ANSI A4) and protective finger cots for high-risk handling tasks. Conduct formal training on proper glove selection, sizing, and application. Establish glove replacement schedule based on wear patterns observed during production. Include PPE inspection checklist in daily pre-shift routines. Expected outcome: reduce laceration severity and frequency among part handlers.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for HVAC Systems
description: Establish a predictive maintenance protocol for all facility ventilation and exhaust systems utilizing vibration analysis and thermal imaging to detect equipment degradation before failure. Schedule quarterly inspections with documented baseline measurements. Establish replacement timelines based on manufacturer recommendations plus safety margin (25% early replacement). Create automated alert system triggering maintenance when parameters exceed thresholds. Assign responsibility to Facilities Maintenance team with oversight from HSE department. Expected outcome: eliminate emergency shutdowns related to HVAC failures and maintain continuous air quality monitoring.

name: Install Secondary Backup Ventilation System
