Conduct lighting audit using calibrated lux meter post-installation to verify compliance with CSA Z1007 standards. Expected outcome: eliminate vision-related hazards and improve forklift operator sightlines by minimum 40%.

name: Establish Warehouse Traffic Management Protocol
description: Administrative control: Implement formal warehouse traffic management plan designating one-way forklift traffic lanes marked with high-visibility yellow and black striping, pedestrian-only zones, and designated pedestrian crossing points equipped with stop signs and traffic mirrors. Prohibit personnel from positioning themselves in blind spots behind pallets during active material movement. Require forklift operators to use audible backup warnings and to reduce speed to 3 km/h when approaching pedestrian zones. Post traffic management signage in 4 strategic warehouse locations.

name: Forklift Operator Situational Awareness Training
description: Deliver refresher training to all 8 certified forklift operators covering blind spot awareness, pedestrian interaction protocols, and communication techniques. Training includes classroom instruction on sight line limitations of forklift equipment, practical assessment in the warehouse with obstacle courses, and competency evaluation. Operators must demonstrate proper mirror usage and communication methods. Training to be delivered within 14 days with annual refresher thereafter.

name: Install Automatic Mold Temperature Monitoring System
description: Implement thermal sensors on all injection molding machines to provide real-time mold surface temperature readings displayed on operator control panels. The system will prevent mold removal until surface temperature drops below 60°C (140°F), automatically triggering alerts if operators attempt manual removal prematurely. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of insufficient cooling verification and eliminates reliance on operator judgment alone.

name: Revise Mold Handling Work Instructions and Training
description: Update all mold handling procedures to include mandatory minimum cooling times based on mold mass and material type, with explicit prohibition on shortcuts due to production schedules. Implement quarterly refresher training for all injection molding operators on burn hazards and the updated procedures. Include case study review of this incident during training sessions to reinforce the importance of following protocols regardless of schedule pressure.

name: Issue Heat-Resistant Gloves to All Production Staff
description: Provide all production operators with Level 3 heat-resistant work gloves rated for temperatures up to 200°C, to be worn whenever working near molds or hot equipment. While this is a PPE control (lower priority), it serves as an interim protection layer while engineering controls are being installed. Ensure proper fit and training on correct usage and storage.

name: Implement Automated Dust Collection and Cleaning Schedule
description: Establish a comprehensive dust removal program with daily manual sweeping/vacuuming of chemical storage and mixing areas using HEPA-filtered equipment, combined with monthly professional deep cleaning. Upgrade the automated dust collection system by replacing clogged filters and scheduling preventive maintenance every 30 days. This eliminates the primary fuel source for potential dust-based fires and addresses the root cause of inadequate dust management.

name: Reorganize Chemical and Material Storage Separation
description: Reconfigure the chemical storage area to maintain minimum 3-meter separation between flammable solvent storage and any combustible materials including plastic scrap, cardboard, and wooden pallets. Install clearly marked 'No Storage' zones around chemical cabinets. Install secondary containment under all flammable liquid containers. This engineering control directly addresses the fire load proximity hazard.

name: Conduct Comprehensive Fire Safety Audit and System Certification
description: Engage third-party fire safety consultant to conduct complete facility fire suppression system inspection and certification. Replace all expired or non-functional fire extinguishers immediately and establish quarterly inspection and maintenance program. Conduct facility-wide fire safety walkthrough with all department supervisors and JHSC representatives. Implement quarterly preventive safety inspections (vs. current 18-month interval) with documented checklists.

name: Replace All Cooling Water System Piping and Implement Predictive Maintenance
description: Complete replacement of the entire cooling water distribution system with new corrosion-resistant piping materials (schedule 80 stainless steel or equivalent). Install real-time pressure and flow monitoring sensors at four strategic locations to detect anomalies indicative of leaks. Establish monthly water quality testing program to monitor pH, conductivity, and corrosion inhibitor levels. Implement quarterly ultrasonic thickness testing of piping to detect wall thinning before failure. This comprehensive engineering control eliminates the root cause (system corrosion) and prevents recurrence.

name: Install Water Detection and Automated Shutoff System
description: Install moisture sensors at all critical equipment locations (electrical cabinets, CNC control systems, data servers) with automated triggers to shut off water supply within 30 seconds of leak detection. Add secondary containment trays under all cooling system junctions and create sloped drainage channels to direct water away from electrical equipment. Position critical documents and finished goods inventory at least 0.5 meters above floor level in production areas.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Protocol
description: Establish a two-person verification system for all lockout/tagout procedures on injection molding machines. Before any maintenance work begins, a second trained employee must independently verify that all energy isolation points are properly locked and tagged. This will be documented on a verification checklist that must be signed by both parties and retained for auditing. Training will be mandatory for all production and maintenance staff within 5 working days.

name: Upgrade Thermal Protective Gloves
description: Replace current work gloves with enhanced heat-resistant gloves rated for 250°C+ contact. All production personnel will be issued new gloves and trained on proper fit and care. The gloves will be replaced quarterly or when showing signs of wear. A supply of replacement gloves will be maintained at each production station to ensure immediate availability.

name: Equipment-Specific Training for New Machine Revisions
description: Develop and deliver equipment-specific training modules for all revised or upgraded machinery within 48 hours of installation. Training must cover new safety features, operational changes, and hazard assessments. All operators must complete hands-on training with a certified trainer and pass a competency assessment before operating the equipment independently.

name: Establish Hopper Sensor Preventive Maintenance Schedule
description: Add all hopper level sensors to the preventive maintenance program with quarterly calibration checks and annual replacement. Create a digital maintenance log integrated with the facility management system. Sensors will be calibrated against a certified reference standard, and out-of-tolerance sensors will be replaced immediately. Maintenance technicians will be trained to recognize sensor drift indicators.

name: Install Secondary Overflow Containment System
description: Install a physical overflow catch tray beneath the hopper discharge point with a capacity of 1.2 cubic meters to capture material in the event of sensor failure. The tray will be equipped with a drain valve for controlled material recovery and cleaning. This engineering control provides a passive safety barrier independent of sensor functionality.

name: Implement Comprehensive Hydraulic System Audit and Maintenance Schedule
description: Conduct a complete audit of all hydraulic systems across the 32 injection molding machines to identify components at or near end-of-service-life. Establish a detailed preventive maintenance schedule that includes all relief valves, seals, hoses, and pressure regulators with specific replacement intervals based on manufacturer specifications. Integrate this schedule into the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) with automated alerts. Train maintenance technicians on hydraulic system diagnostics and failure mode recognition. Perform quarterly compliance audits.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Spill Response Equipment
description: Install secondary containment trays beneath all hydraulic systems on injection molding lines to capture fluid releases before they reach the production floor and electrical systems. Position absorbent spill kits and emergency shut-off procedures at strategic locations. Post clear signage indicating hydraulic fluid hazards and emergency response protocols. Conduct monthly inspections of containment systems and quarterly spill response drills.

name: Establish Equipment Failure Documentation and Trending System
description: Create a centralized database to track all equipment failures, near-misses, and maintenance anomalies across the facility. Require maintenance staff to document root causes, replacement parts, and corrective actions taken. Perform monthly trend analysis to identify systemic issues or components with higher failure rates. Share findings with the JHSC and production management quarterly. Use data to inform equipment upgrade decisions and training priorities.

name: Mandatory Pre-Shift Equipment Inspection Protocol with Digital Verification
description: Establish a standardized daily pre-shift equipment inspection checklist for all CNC machines and molding equipment. Operators must verify spindle function, emergency stops, hydraulic pressure, and audible alerts before commencing operations. Implement a QR code system where operators scan to log inspections in real-time, creating an auditable record. Any equipment showing stuttering, unusual sounds, or performance anomalies must be immediately tagged out and reported to maintenance. Non-compliance results in machine lockout until inspection is complete. Train all operators within 5 days.

name: Refresh Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Training and Enforce 100% Compliance
description: Conduct mandatory recertification training on LOTO procedures for all production and maintenance staff. Emphasize that machine motors must be fully de-energized and energy sources properly dissipated before any maintenance work. Implement supervisor spot-checks during every shift to verify LOTO compliance. Establish a zero-tolerance policy for LOTO violations. Document all training with competency assessments. Station laminated LOTO procedure guides at every machine.

name: Install Motor Shutdown Verification Circuit and Upgrades
description: Work with equipment suppliers to evaluate and install passive motor shutdown verification circuits that prevent spindle restart until the motor has been offline for a minimum of 30 seconds and capacitors fully discharged. Upgrade older machines with automatic discharge resistors. Install visible status lights indicating motor power state. Conduct electrical safety certification of all modifications.

name: Implement Rigorous Overhead Crane and Lifting Equipment Inspection Schedule
description: Establish a quarterly inspection and certification program for all overhead cranes, hoists, and lifting systems, exceeding the manufacturer's annual requirement. Hire a certified third-party crane inspection company to conduct comprehensive evaluations including cable condition, load capacity verification, brake function, and structural integrity. Maintain detailed inspection logs accessible to all operators. Tag all equipment with next inspection date. Any crane requiring maintenance must be taken out of service immediately. Establish a replacement reserve fund for aging equipment.

name: Mandatory Crane Operation Certification and Monthly Refresher Training
description: Require all employees operating overhead cranes to complete formal certification training including load calculation, rigging procedures, load limits, and emergency protocols. Issue laminated certification cards. Conduct monthly refresher sessions covering hazard recognition, cable inspection basics, and near-miss reporting. Document all training. Establish operator sign-off procedures where experienced operators validate newer operators on each equipment type before independent operation is permitted.

name: Implement Quarterly Safety Interlock Inspection Program
description: Establish a formal quarterly inspection and testing schedule for all machine safety interlocks across injection molding lines. This will include functional testing of proximity sensors, mechanical guards, and emergency stop buttons. Maintenance technicians will use a standardized checklist and document all tests in the equipment maintenance system. Results will be reviewed monthly by the HSE team. This proactive approach will detect failing components before they create hazardous situations and ensure compliance with ISO 45001 requirements.

name: Enhance Machine Safety Awareness Training
description: Develop and deliver targeted training to all production operators on recognizing signs of failing safety systems, proper reporting procedures, and the critical importance of immediately stopping operations when interlocks appear compromised. Training will be delivered by the HSE team and documented in individual training records. All operators will be required to re-certify annually. This administrative control will ensure workers are empowered to identify and report safety hazards early.

name: Install Automated Conveyor Cleaning System
description: Replace manual mold release agent cleanup procedures with an automated spray-cleaning station integrated into the conveyor line. This engineering control will eliminate contact with hot residue by automatically cleaning conveyor surfaces every 30 minutes during operation. The system will use food-grade cleaning solution heated to safe levels and include integrated dryer elements. Installation will occur during scheduled maintenance window, with full operator training before restart. This substitution approach removes the hazard rather than relying on worker behavior or PPE.

name: Establish Mandatory PPE Inventory Checks and Restocking Protocol
description: Implement a daily checklist requiring shift supervisors to verify that all required PPE (heat-resistant gloves, safety glasses, aprons) is stocked, accessible, and in good condition at each work station. Supervisors will document checks in the HSE management system. Any depleted or damaged items trigger immediate restocking from central supplies. This administrative control ensures PPE is always available as a temporary measure pending engineering solution implementation.

name: Enhanced Heat Hazard and Chemical Safety Training
description: Develop specialized training module covering thermal burns from hot equipment and chemicals, proper use of heat-resistant PPE, safe work distances, and emergency response procedures. Training will be mandatory for all finishing and assembly operators, conducted by HSE staff with documentation. Video demonstrations of proper glove fitting and technique will be provided. Annual refresher training required. This training will raise awareness of the specific hazards in finishing operations.

name: Implement Supplier Pallet Packaging Standards and Verification Protocol
description: Establish and communicate mandatory pallet packaging standards to all raw material suppliers, specifying requirements for sling attachment security, pallet wrapping tension, and load distribution. All incoming pallets will be visually inspected and weighed before being lifted with the overhead crane. A weight verification scale will be installed at the receiving dock. Any non-compliant pallets will be rejected or repacked by the supplier before acceptance. This engineering and administrative control eliminates the root cause of load instability from the receiving process.

name: Install Enhanced Load Monitoring and Safety Systems on Overhead Crane
description: Upgrade the existing overhead crane with load monitoring sensors that provide real-time feedback to the operator regarding load weight, balance, and sling integrity. Install automated shutdown systems that will halt operations if load imbalance is detected exceeding safety thresholds. Add audible and visual alarm systems. Conduct full system testing and operator retraining. This engineering control adds a secondary safety layer to prevent unsafe loads from being lifted.

name: Redesign Storage Layout to Separate Medical Products from Raw Materials
description: Reconfigure warehouse layout to physically separate high-value medical device products from raw material storage areas, with additional protective barriers installed between zones. Medical products will be stored in an isolated, climate-controlled section with redundant racking systems. This elimination/substitution approach reduces exposure of critical inventory to falling object hazards from material handling in the raw materials section.

name: Install Thermal Imaging Safety System on Molding Lines
description: Implement thermal imaging sensors on all injection molding equipment to provide real-time mold temperature monitoring independent of the machine's display system. This engineering control will provide automated alerts when mold surfaces exceed 50°C and prevent part removal cycles until thermal conditions are safe. The system will integrate with the machine lockout system to physically prevent mold opening until temperature thresholds are met. This addresses the root cause of the failed temperature indicator and creates a redundant safety layer.

name: Mandatory Heat-Resistant Glove Policy for Mold Handling
description: Establish and enforce a new administrative control requiring all machine operators handling molds above 45°C to wear certified heat-resistant gloves rated for 200°C+ contact. Update the standard operating procedures (SOP) for all injection molding lines to mandate glove inspection and replacement every 6 months. Conduct training with all production operators on proper glove selection, donning/doffing procedures, and limitations. This PPE-based control provides immediate personal protection while engineering controls are being implemented.

name: Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Temperature Monitoring Systems
description: Establish a quarterly preventive maintenance and calibration protocol for all machine temperature indicators and sensors on injection molding lines. Assign Fernand Giguère (Maintenance Technician) to lead monthly audits of all temperature display systems against independently calibrated thermal reference probes. Create a maintenance log requiring documentation of calibration status and any discrepancies. This administrative control ensures early detection of future sensor failures and prevents similar incidents from recurring.

name: Install Non-Slip Flooring in Warehouse Material Handling Zone
description: Replace existing concrete flooring in the chemical storage and material handling area with high-grip anti-slip coating system rated for wet environments. The coating will be applied to all high-traffic areas within a 50-foot radius of chemical mixing stations and storage zones. This engineering control directly eliminates the slip hazard by providing consistent friction coefficient of 0.7+ even when wet. The implementation will include demarcation of wet zones during application and regular maintenance schedule for coating integrity checks.

name: Implement Spill Containment and Secondary Containment Protocol
description: Establish administrative controls requiring all cleaning and chemical operations to use designated spill containment trays with integrated drip catching capability. Create a new procedure mandating that spill materials are placed in secured holders attached to work carts rather than free-standing. Conduct monthly training for all warehouse and material handling staff on spill response procedures, including immediate cleanup requirements and hazard communication. Place absorbent spill kits at all chemical mixing stations with clear labeling and usage instructions.

name: Upgrade Tool Room Ventilation System with HEPA Filtration
description: Replace the existing ventilation system in the Mold Manufacturing and Repair Shop with an upgraded system featuring HEPA-grade intake filtration and continuous monitoring of air quality. The new system will maintain minimum air changes per hour (ACH) of 12 for solvent handling areas, exceeding the regulatory requirement of 8 ACH. Install real-time carbon monoxide and VOC sensors connected to automated alerts that trigger when ambient concentrations exceed 50% of OSHA Permissible Exposure Limits (PEL). This engineering control eliminates the hazard source by ensuring adequate ventilation during all solvent operations.

name: Mandatory Respiratory Protection Program and Training
description: Implement a comprehensive respiratory protection program for all employees in the tool room and chemical handling areas. Conduct fit-testing for all personnel requiring respirators and maintain individual fit-test records. Provide cartridge-style respirators rated for organic vapors (Type P100) to all mold maintenance and cleaning personnel. Establish a monthly training requirement covering proper donning/doffing, cartridge replacement schedules, and limitations of respiratory equipment. This administrative and PPE control provides immediate personal protection while the ventilation system upgrade is being completed.

name: Preventive Maintenance for HVAC Filtration Systems
description: Establish a bi-weekly preventive maintenance schedule for all HVAC intake and exhaust filters in chemical and solvent handling areas. Create a maintenance log documenting filter inspection dates, pressure drop measurements, and replacement dates. Assign Fernand Giguère as the responsible technician for monthly audits and quarterly replacement cycles. Integrate filter status monitoring into the facility's maintenance management system with automatic work order generation when filter pressure differential exceeds acceptable thresholds. This administrative control prevents future ventilation failures.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Monitoring for Conveyor Systems
description: Install vibration monitoring sensors on all conveyor belt systems in the warehouse to detect early signs of belt stress, misalignment, and component wear. Data will be transmitted to the predictive maintenance program dashboard for real-time analysis. Maintenance technicians will receive automated alerts when vibration levels exceed safety thresholds, enabling proactive repairs before equipment failure. This engineering control eliminates the hazard by preventing equipment from reaching critical failure states.

name: Establish Weekly Conveyor Belt Tension Verification Procedure
description: Create a standardized checklist for conveyor belt tension inspection to be completed every Monday morning before production begins. Maintenance Manager Carlos Rodriguez will assign responsibility to designated technicians who will verify tension using calibrated tension gauges and document results in the maintenance tracking system. Any deviation from specification will trigger immediate corrective action. This administrative control ensures consistent equipment condition monitoring and prevents repeat incidents.

name: Upgrade LOTO Procedures with Solenoid Valve Pre-Check Requirements
description: Revise all LOTO procedures for hydraulic equipment to include a mandatory pre-check step where technicians must manually verify solenoid valve responsiveness before beginning maintenance work. Technicians will apply air pressure to confirm valve closure and isolation. This procedure will be added to the equipment-specific LOTO checklist and communicated through a 30-minute mandatory retraining session for all maintenance personnel. Implementation includes updated LOTO procedure cards posted at each hydraulic press station.

name: Establish Quarterly Solenoid Valve Inspection Schedule with Digital Tracking
description: Create a calibrated maintenance schedule in the computerized maintenance management system to generate automatic work orders every 90 days for solenoid valve inspection, cleaning, and replacement if needed. Maintenance Manager will assign specific technicians to each valve and require photographic documentation of inspection completion. System will generate alerts 7 days before due date. This administrative control ensures critical safety components receive timely preventive maintenance and eliminates the risk of valve sticking during emergency situations.

name: Repair and Resurface Chemical Storage Room Concrete Floor
description: Engage a licensed concrete contractor to inspect, repair, and resurface the entire floor of the Chemical Storage and Mixing Room, with particular attention to drainage areas near exterior doors. The work will include filling depression areas, sealing micro-cracks, and applying an epoxy coating to prevent future water damage and erosion. This engineering control eliminates the environmental hazard that caused equipment instability and creates a level, stable work surface that meets safety standards. Work will be scheduled during a production downtime window.

name: Conduct Forklift Load Capacity Verification and Recertification
description: Engage a certified forklift technician to perform a comprehensive load capacity test on all three forklifts assigned to materials handling operations. Post-repair load capacity will be officially verified and recalibrated using standard load cells. New capacity placards will be installed on each forklift and all operators will receive a 45-minute recertification training on the updated load limits and handling procedures. Documentation will be filed in the equipment maintenance database with photos of certification tags.

name: Implement Monthly Rack Structural Integrity Inspection Program
description: Establish a monthly visual inspection procedure for all storage racks in the Chemical Storage and Mixing Room to identify signs of rust, bending, loose bolts, or load shifting. Inspections will be performed by designated personnel using a standardized checklist and any defects will be documented and corrected immediately. This administrative control ensures racks maintain their load-bearing capacity and prevents materials from falling due to structural failure. Results will be tracked in the maintenance system.

name: Implement Preventive Ventilation Maintenance Program
description: Establish a quarterly deep-cleaning schedule for all ventilation ductwork in materials handling and chemical storage areas. Install high-temperature monitoring sensors in air ducts connected to the building management system with automatic alert thresholds. Conduct weekly visual inspections of ductwork for dust accumulation. Hire specialized industrial duct cleaning service to perform comprehensive system purge within 14 days. Maintenance Planner Roland Dostie will coordinate with external contractors and document all activities. Expected outcome: eliminate dust accumulation fire hazard and reduce chemical exposure risks.

name: Enhanced Fire Safety Training for Day Shift
description: Conduct mandatory 2-hour fire safety and emergency response refresher training for all 120 day shift personnel within 30 days. Include hands-on demonstration of fire suppression system operation, evacuation route verification, and assembly point procedures. Create laminated quick-reference guides for chemical storage area hazards with placement at all entry points. Develop scenario-based drills quarterly to maintain readiness. Incident Investigation Specialist Brigitte Mathieu will coordinate training delivery. Expected outcome: improve emergency response speed and ensure all personnel understand fire prevention procedures specific to TechnoPlast operations.

name: Upgrade Fire Detection and Suppression System Sensors
description: Install advanced optical flame detection sensors (IP65-rated, resistant to dust) in chemical storage zone with redundant triggering capability independent of smoke detection. Replace existing dry chemical suppressant with eco-friendly alternative compatible with plastic manufacturing operations. Conduct full system pressure test and certification by licensed fire protection engineer. Implement automatic alert notification system to HSE department and site management. Expected outcome: faster fire detection response time and improved suppression effectiveness tailored to plastic dust and resin fume hazards.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance for Injection Molding Machines
description: Deploy ultrasonic vibration monitoring sensors on all 32 injection molding machines to detect early signs of coupling degradation and thermal stress. Establish automated maintenance scheduling system that generates work orders when sensors detect anomalies before failures occur. Integrate with existing enterprise resource planning system to ensure no maintenance tasks are deferred. Conduct baseline assessment and sensor calibration on all machines within 10 days. Maintenance Planner Roland Dostie will oversee implementation and train technicians on sensor interpretation. Expected outcome: reduce unplanned downtime by 65% and extend equipment service life by detecting failures 6-8 weeks in advance.

name: Establish Mandatory Preventive Maintenance Schedule Compliance
description: Create departmental policy requiring 100% compliance with equipment maintenance schedules, with management escalation if any task is deferred beyond 30 days. Assign backup technicians to critical machines to ensure scheduling conflicts do not delay maintenance. Implement weekly compliance dashboard reporting to Production Operations leadership. Monthly audits will verify maintenance records match actual equipment condition. Roland Dostie will manage the tracking system and provide weekly updates to Facilities Manager. Expected outcome: eliminate maintenance deferrals and establish consistent equipment servicing protocols.

name: Ergonomic Workstation Design and Equipment Installation
description: Install four height-adjustable mobile work platforms (0.3 to 1.2 meters elevation) in the Finished Goods Warehouse to eliminate reaching above shoulder height. Provide each platform with electric lift assist capability for loads up to 25 kg. Conduct ergonomic assessment of all pallet positions and reorganize inventory layout to position frequently handled items at waist height (66-76 cm). Replace manual pallet jacks with powered options to reduce physical strain during material movement. Expected outcome: reduce repetitive strain injury risk by 70% and improve operational efficiency through ergonomic design.

name: Operator Training for Automated Material Handling System
description: Deliver comprehensive 4-hour training program to all 15 warehouse personnel on proper use of the automated material handling system, including system capabilities, safety interlocks, and efficiency optimization. Create quick-reference laminated guides for common order fulfillment scenarios. Conduct hands-on supervised practice sessions for each operator over 2 days to build confidence and competency. Establish performance incentives for personnel who utilize automated systems for 80% or more of applicable tasks. Expected outcome: increase automation utilization rate from 30% to 85% and reduce manual handling demands on warehouse staff.

name: Implement Ergonomic Assessment and Monitoring Program
description: Establish quarterly ergonomic assessments for all warehouse and material handling personnel using standardized RULA (Rapid Upper Limb Assessment) methodology. Create individual ergonomic improvement plans for employees scoring above safe thresholds. Integrate ergonomic hazard recognition into new employee orientation and annual refresher training. Establish confidential reporting mechanism for workers to self-report discomfort without penalty. Track cumulative strain indicators through HSE department monitoring. Expected outcome: create continuous improvement culture around ergonomics and enable early intervention before injuries develop.

name: Implement Comprehensive Dust Management and Cleaning Program
description: Establish daily, weekly, and monthly cleaning schedules specifically for all chemical storage and resin mixing areas with documented checklists. Deploy industrial vacuum systems equipped with HEPA filters rated for composite dust collection in the Chemical Storage building. Train all maintenance personnel on proper dust removal techniques that minimize static electricity risk. Install permanent grounding straps on all equipment and metal surfaces in high-risk areas. Integrate dust accumulation inspections into the facility's preventive maintenance program with photo documentation. Conduct quarterly audits of ventilation duct cleanliness. This multi-layered approach directly addresses the root cause of insufficient housekeeping and eliminates the fire hazard.

name: Upgrade Ventilation System Monitoring and Maintenance Records
description: Install real-time ventilation efficiency monitoring sensors in the Chemical Storage building that alert maintenance staff when airflow drops below optimal levels. Create a comprehensive maintenance log that tracks all ventilation modifications and correlates them with cleaning schedule updates. Establish a monthly review process where HSE coordinates with maintenance to ensure cleaning protocols reflect any equipment or layout changes. Schedule preventive ventilation duct cleaning quarterly by certified contractors. This ensures that future facility upgrades automatically trigger corresponding safety procedure updates.

name: Install Additional Fire Detection and Suppression Equipment
description: Install supplementary smoke detectors in ceiling areas prone to dust accumulation within the Chemical Storage building. Deploy portable ABC dry powder fire extinguishers at two additional strategic locations within the resin mixing area (in addition to existing equipment). Conduct enhanced fire safety training for all personnel working in chemical handling areas, with particular emphasis on recognizing dust hazards and responding to early warning signs. Test the automatic suppression system quarterly and document all results. This engineering control provides multiple layers of fire detection and response capability.

name: Replace and Upgrade Mold Safety Interlock Systems
description: Conduct immediate comprehensive audit of all 18 injection molding machines to identify and replace failed or degraded proximity sensors in interlock circuits. Install redundant dual-sensor interlock systems on all IMMs that use mechanical mold closure (engineering control—highest hierarchy priority). Upgrade to solenoid-based fail-safe interlocks that require continuous signal validation to allow mold closure operation. Implement real-time sensor diagnostics that trigger equipment shutdown if sensor signals degrade by more than 5% from baseline calibration. Perform calibration verification testing weekly rather than monthly. This eliminates the hazard by providing multiple independent safety mechanisms that cannot fail simultaneously.

name: Establish Enhanced Preventive Maintenance Program for Safety-Critical Components
description: Develop a predictive maintenance protocol specifically for interlock and sensor systems using vibration analysis and electrical signature analysis to detect sensor degradation before functional failure. Schedule sensor replacement on a fixed 12-month cycle regardless of apparent condition, rather than reactive replacement. Create a dedicated maintenance log for each machine tracking all interlock system work with digital photo documentation of sensor conditions. Implement daily operator pre-shift checks that include manual verification of interlock function before machine startup. This administrative/preventive control catches degradation early before safety failure.

name: Provide Comprehensive Mold Safety and Lockout/Tagout Training
description: Conduct mandatory refresher training for all 24 injection molding operators on proper mold handling procedures, emphasizing the hazards of manual mold adjustment during powered operation. Require certification in LOTO (Lockout/Tagout) procedures with competency testing. Establish a rule that all manual mold adjustments must be performed with the machine in lockout mode with energy isolated and verified. Implement a buddy system where one operator must verify mold enclosure is fully closed before another operator initiates any closure cycle. Create laminated reference cards for each machine displaying prohibited manual adjustment operations. This administrative control reinforces proper work procedures.

name: Implement Comprehensive Equipment Documentation and LOTO Procedure Audit
description: Conduct an immediate full audit of all maintenance manuals and LOTO procedures for equipment modified since 2020, specifically focusing on electrical isolation circuits. Verify that all equipment modifications are documented and LOTO procedures are updated to reflect actual circuit configurations. Create a standardized equipment data sheet for each machine that includes electrical schematics, control circuit diagrams, and complete interlock specifications. Establish a requirement that all maintenance work orders include reference to the current validated LOTO procedure with technician sign-off confirming understanding. Implement a quarterly review process where electrical schematics are compared to actual equipment to catch undocumented modifications. This eliminates incomplete procedures that could lead to electrocution.

name: Install Additional Electrical Safety Devices and Controls
description: Install clearly labeled electrical isolation disconnect switches at the point of use for all mold temperature controllers and similar maintenance-prone equipment. Install lockout hasps rated for electrical service on all disconnect switches. Apply high-visibility warning labels identifying multi-circuit equipment and specifying which circuits require isolation for different maintenance tasks. Install arc-flash warning labels on all equipment containing electrical hazards above 50V. Verify that all LOTO equipment (locks, tags, devices) is available in the maintenance workshop and maintained in inventory. This engineering control provides multiple barriers to accidental electrical contact.

name: Mandatory LOTO Verification Program
description: Implement a mandatory pre-maintenance LOTO verification checklist that must be visually confirmed by a second trained employee before any maintenance work begins. All equipment will have prominently displayed laminated LOTO procedure cards at machine stations. Monthly audits by the HSE department will verify compliance, with 100% audit completion required. Any employee found bypassing LOTO procedures will be required to retake certification training immediately. This addresses the root cause of inadequate lockout discipline.

name: Install Pressure Release Safety Blocks
description: Engineering control: Install mechanical pressure release blocks and secondary containment systems on all injection molding machines to prevent unexpected pressure discharge during maintenance. These automated safety barriers will physically prevent pressurized fluid release until the system is confirmed depressurized. A total of 24 machines will be retrofitted over 60 days, prioritizing high-risk units. This engineering solution eliminates the hazard at the source rather than relying on employee compliance.

name: Enhanced Thermal Burn First Aid Training
description: Conduct specialized first aid training for all production supervisors and HSE staff focusing on treatment of high-temperature thermal burns. Training will include proper cooling techniques, wound assessment, and decision-making for hospital transport. Schedule quarterly refresher sessions. Ensure emergency eyewash and safety shower stations are inspected monthly and accessible within 10 seconds of all high-heat equipment areas. Stock additional burn treatment supplies (sterile gauze, burn gel) at first aid stations.

name: Chemical Drum Receiving and Securing Protocol Revision
description: Revise the receiving procedure to include mandatory photographic documentation of drum positioning and tie-down verification before shift sign-off. Implement a two-person verification system where both the receiving operator and warehouse supervisor must physically inspect and sign off on all hazardous chemical deliveries. Create laminated reference cards showing proper drum securing techniques. Train all warehouse staff within 5 days. Establish monthly audits of chemical storage areas to verify compliance and proper positioning of all drums.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Warning Systems
description: Engineering control: Install secondary containment barriers around all flammable chemical storage areas with capacity to hold 110% of the largest individual drum volume. Add motion sensors and automated warning lights that activate when loads shift or destabilize. Paint bright yellow warning zones on flooring demarcating the hazard area. This prevents spills from reaching adjacent areas and provides visual deterrent to unauthorized access.

name: Deburring Equipment Maintenance and Tool Replacement
description: Immediately replace worn deburring tool bits on all finishing machines and implement a preventive maintenance schedule requiring tool inspection and replacement every 500 operating hours or when edge finish quality measurements fall below specification. Establish statistical process control charts to track edge quality and alert operators when trends indicate tool degradation. Train deburring equipment operators to perform daily visual tool inspections and report any damage or wear.

name: Enhanced Quality Control Edge Inspection Protocol
description: Implement mandatory tactile edge inspection using calibrated edge smoothness gauges at the QC stage. All parts must pass both visual and tactile inspection before release to assembly. Create a 100% inspection process for medical device and automotive components until process stability is demonstrated over 14 consecutive days. Samantha Brown (Composite Materials Lead) will oversee implementation of automated edge detection systems for future equipment upgrades to eliminate manual edge handling.

name: Cut-Resistant Glove Requirement for Assembly Operations
description: Issue ANSI Level 3 cut-resistant gloves to all assembly operators handling finished plastic components. Establish a glove replacement program ensuring all staff have properly fitted gloves at work start. Conduct toolbox talk training on proper PPE usage and the importance of hand protection during assembly tasks. Stock replacement gloves at all assembly stations for immediate availability when damage occurs.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Motor Couplings
description: Establish a data-driven predictive maintenance schedule for all motor couplings and drive components, utilizing vibration analysis and oil analysis to detect early signs of wear and fatigue. Replace couplings proactively at 35,000 operating hours (well before the 40,000 hour manufacturer limit) to prevent catastrophic failure. Integrate monitoring into the existing computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) with automatic work order generation at predetermined thresholds. This engineering/administrative control eliminates the risk of coupling failure through preventive replacement before metal fatigue occurs.

name: Install Hydraulic Fluid Containment and Shielding
description: Design and install protective steel mesh shielding around the coupling and hydraulic line assembly to contain any ejected metal fragments or fluid spray in the event of future component failure. Add spill containment trays beneath hydraulic connections with drain lines to collection tanks. This engineering control provides secondary protection to prevent worker exposure to hydraulic fluid injection hazards and contains environmental contamination.

name: Enhance LOTO Procedures with Pressure Relief Verification
description: Revise the lockout/tagout procedure for all injection molding machines to include mandatory verification steps that confirm complete hydraulic pressure dissipation before any manual intervention inside mold cavities. Install pressure gauge monitoring at each station requiring verification signatures from both the operator and a second supervisor. Implement a minimum 10-minute wait period after pressure readings confirm zero PSI before permitting hand entry into mold areas. Create visual step-by-step procedures with photographs displayed at each station. This administrative control directly addresses the root cause of inadequate pressure relief verification.

name: Install Automated Mold Pressure Relief Systems
description: Retrofit all 32 injection molding machines with upgraded automatic hydraulic pressure relief valves that discharge to a secondary tank when mold pressure exceeds safe levels for manual intervention. These systems will operate independently of the LOTO procedure as a redundant safety layer. All units will be equipped with visual and audible indicators confirming safe pressure states. This engineering control eliminates the risk of residual hydraulic pressure causing crush injuries through automated pressure management.

name: Provide Comprehensive LOTO and Mold Safety Retraining
description: Conduct mandatory retraining for all production operators and technicians on lockout/tagout procedures specific to injection molding equipment, with emphasis on the new pressure relief verification requirements and wait time protocols. Include hazard identification exercises and incident simulations. Require all night shift operators to pass competency assessments before returning to independent operation. This administrative control reinforces proper procedures and builds operator awareness of critical safety steps.

name: Implement Mandatory Energy Isolation Verification Protocol
description: Establish a two-person verification system for all LOTO procedures on injection molding equipment. Before any maintenance or cleaning work begins, a designated safety observer must physically verify that all energy sources (hydraulic, electrical, pneumatic) are isolated and locked. Create a checklist signed by both the operator and observer, photographed, and filed. Conduct immediate retraining of all operators on proper LOTO procedures with emphasis on hydraulic system isolation. This engineering control combined with administrative measures will eliminate the risk of unexpected machine startup during maintenance.

name: Upgrade Injection Molding Machine Safety Systems
description: Install additional safety interlocks on all 32 injection molding machines to prevent mold closure when access gates are open or when LOTO devices are engaged. Upgrade to electronically monitored isolation valves that provide visual and audible confirmation when hydraulic pressure is fully isolated. Retrofit machines with redundant pressure relief systems to prevent backdoor pressurization during maintenance. Partner with equipment manufacturer for full system audit and upgrade implementation.

name: Establish Quarterly LOTO Audits and Certification Program
description: Create a comprehensive audit program where the Safety Officer and Electrical Maintenance Lead conduct quarterly inspections of all LOTO devices on production equipment. Operators must recertify annually on proper lockout procedures with hands-on demonstration. Maintain audit logs and certification records. Any deficiencies in LOTO compliance result in immediate retraining before the employee can return to that equipment. This administrative control ensures consistent adherence to safety procedures.

name: Complete Storage Rack Inspection and Weight Redistribution
description: Conduct immediate comprehensive inspection of all 47 storage racks in the Raw Materials Warehouse and Regrind Department by a qualified engineer. Verify structural integrity, calculate actual weight distribution, and reduce stored materials to within safe capacity limits. Redistribute heavy items to lower shelves and implement a weight-limit labeling system with clear pictorial warnings on each rack. Install safety cables as secondary containment on all upper-level storage. This engineering control directly eliminates the falling materials hazard.

name: Establish Monthly Storage Rack Safety Audit Program
description: Create a monthly inspection checklist covering load security, visual damage assessment, securing strap condition, and weight capacity compliance. Assign responsibility to the Maintenance Lead and a rotating production supervisor. Document all findings and corrective actions. Any racks showing signs of wear or non-compliance must be immediately secured and emptied. Training for all warehouse staff on proper loading procedures will accompany the audit implementation.

name: Replace Hydraulic Pressure Relief Valve and Install Pressure Monitoring System
description: Immediately replace the faulty pressure relief valve on the affected robotic arm with a new component rated for the system specifications. Install an electronic pressure monitoring sensor that provides real-time data to the maintenance dashboard with automatic alerts when pressure begins to deviate from normal parameters. This will enable predictive maintenance before failures occur. The new valve includes enhanced safety features and secondary release mechanisms.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Robotic Systems
description: Establish a quarterly schedule for comprehensive inspection of all hydraulic components on robotic arms, including pressure relief valves, seals, and hose connections. Use ultrasonic and thermal imaging technology to detect developing failures before they cause incidents. Create a predictive maintenance database tracking component age and usage patterns. Train maintenance staff on early warning signs of hydraulic system degradation. This administrative and engineering control combination will prevent similar incidents across all automated equipment.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Procedure with Dual Sign-Off
description: Establish enhanced LOTO protocol requiring: (1) trained operator performs full electrical and hydraulic system lockout and depress all pressure; (2) second qualified technician verifies all energy sources are isolated; (3) both parties sign written verification checklist before any maintenance begins; (4) verification checklist posted on machine; (5) machine cannot be re-energized until both signatories confirm completion. This administrative control prevents unauthorized re-activation during maintenance and creates accountability through dual verification.

name: Install Physical Interlock Blocking Device on Secondary Safety Controls
description: Engineer and install mechanical blocking plates on all secondary safety interlock access points during LOTO status. When primary lockout is engaged, secondary interlocks become physically inaccessible without removal of blocking device by authorized personnel. Use color-coded blocking devices (red/white) to indicate locked-out status. Integrate with existing energy isolation system on all 32 injection molding machines in facility.

name: Conduct Comprehensive LOTO Retraining for All Production Staff
description: Deliver 2-day intensive LOTO certification training to all 120 day shift and 60 evening shift production personnel. Include: identification of energy sources on each machine type; proper lockout/tagout device usage; verification procedures; consequences of bypassing controls; case study analysis of similar incidents. Require hands-on practice on live equipment with supervision. Document training completion and competency assessment. Repeat annually and after any machine modifications.

name: Implement Monthly Preventive Ventilation System Maintenance Schedule
description: Establish mandatory monthly cleaning protocol for all ventilation ducts in regrind and recycling areas. Hire certified HVAC contractor to perform quarterly deep cleaning and inspection of main ductwork, fans, bearings, and filters. Replace or repair worn bearings before failure occurs. Implement real-time dust accumulation monitoring using pressure differential sensors that alert maintenance team when ductwork requires cleaning. Document all maintenance activities in centralized facility management system. This engineering control eliminates dust accumulation fire hazard.

name: Upgrade Fire Suppression System with Automated Detection and Enhanced Coverage
description: Install supplementary flame detectors (IR-based) in regrind area that automatically activate fire suppression systems faster than thermal devices alone. Expand suppression nozzle coverage to 100% of ductwork and collection bin areas. Conduct full system inspection, testing, and certification by licensed fire protection company. Implement quarterly fire suppression system inspections with documented sign-off. Ensure compliance with NFPA 654 standards for combustible dust hazards in plastic processing facilities.

name: Establish Combustible Dust Hazard Awareness Training Program
description: Develop and deliver mandatory training for all production, maintenance, and warehouse staff on combustible dust fire risks, ignition sources, prevention strategies, and emergency response procedures. Include facility-specific training on regrind operation hazards, ventilation system importance, and proper housekeeping practices. Conduct annual refresher training and additional training for new employees. Partner with safety consultant specializing in plastic processing to ensure technical accuracy and relevance.

name: Install Two-Hand Control Safety Interlock on All Injection Molding Lines
description: Retrofit all four injection molding lines (A, B, C, and any additional production lines) with certified two-hand control systems that require simultaneous activation by the operator before any mold closing cycle can initiate. Implement electronic interlocks that prevent single-hand activation and require both hands to be removed before closure begins. This engineering control eliminates the ability to have hands near the point of operation during mold closing operations. Training will be mandatory for all operators.

name: Implement Mandatory Lockout/Tagout During Mold Changes
description: Establish and enforce a comprehensive LOTO procedure for all mold changeovers that requires the press to be powered down, energy sources isolated, and locks applied before any maintenance begins. Create laminated LOTO cards specific to each press model with step-by-step instructions. Conduct quarterly LOTO audits to verify compliance. Designate Electrical Maintenance Technician Daniel Kim as LOTO coordinator to conduct monthly training refreshers. This administrative control ensures equipment cannot be energized during changeover operations.

name: Install Point-of-Operation Guards on All Mold Closing Mechanisms
description: Design and install rigid or electronically-monitored protective guards that physically prevent hand access to mold closing points during operation. Install presence-sensing safety devices that detect hand intrusion and automatically trigger emergency stop. Post clear warning signage and high-visibility tape at all hazardous points. Conduct a full machine guarding audit and retrofit any gaps identified. This engineering control creates a physical barrier to the primary hazard.

name: Install Redundant Temperature Monitoring and Automated Shutdown System
description: Retrofit the resin dryer with a secondary independent temperature monitoring system featuring a high-temperature alarm and automatic emergency shutdown when internal temperature exceeds 170°C. Install both a thermocouple and RTD probe in separate thermowells to provide cross-verification. Connect to the facility's Building Management System for remote monitoring and alerts. This engineering control creates a fail-safe mechanism that prevents dangerous temperature excursions. The system must be tested monthly and records maintained.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Schedule with Temperature Verification
description: Establish a documented preventive maintenance procedure for UNIT-016 equipment that includes weekly sensor security inspections, monthly thermowell integrity checks, and quarterly heating element performance verification. Create a maintenance log template requiring technician sign-off confirming sensor probe position, security clips are engaged, and temperature readings are within calibrated ranges. Replace all temperature sensor lock-clips with locking designs that cannot vibrate loose. Schedule maintenance during day shift when multiple personnel are present. This administrative control ensures equipment condition is continuously monitored.

name: Install Automatic Mold Temperature Monitoring System
description: Implement a dual-sensor temperature monitoring system on all injection molding machines with automatic shutoff capability if temperatures exceed safe limits. The system will integrate with the machine control panel and trigger an audible alarm and emergency stop if mold temperature rises above 180°C during the cooling cycle. This engineering control eliminates the hazard of unexpected high mold temperatures and provides real-time operator feedback. All 32 molding machines will be retrofitted with this system within 60 days, with priority given to the 500-ton machines used for high-temperature operations.

name: Enhanced Heat-Resistant PPE Requirements for Mold Handlers
description: Establish mandatory use of heat-resistant gloves (rated to 350°C), long-sleeved Nomex shirts, and arm guards for all employees working directly with injection molding machines. Provide training on proper PPE donning/doffing and inspection procedures. Update the standard operating procedure to require visual confirmation of cooling cycle completion before any mold contact. Stock all production areas with properly sized protective equipment and implement a weekly PPE inspection checklist.

name: Implement Quarterly HVAC System Maintenance and Inspection Program
description: Establish a mandatory quarterly maintenance schedule for all chemical storage and mixing area ventilation systems, including inspection of extraction fans, ductwork, filters, and dampers. Create a preventive maintenance log to track service dates, repairs, and filter replacements. Assign Carlos Rodriguez as the responsible party to oversee compliance and coordinate with external HVAC contractors. This administrative control ensures that ventilation equipment remains functional and that VOC exposure is minimized through continuous proper air exchange rates of at least 12 air changes per hour in chemical areas.

name: Install Real-Time Air Quality Monitoring Sensors
description: Deploy continuous air quality monitoring sensors in the Chemical Storage and Mixing area to measure VOC concentrations, temperature, and humidity in real-time. Sensors will be connected to a central alert system that notifies supervisors when VOC levels exceed 50% of the OSHA PEL. Install digital displays visible to all workers and set automatic ventilation fan boost when readings approach danger levels. This engineering control provides objective data on air quality and enables immediate corrective action before employee exposure occurs.

name: Upgrade Storage Rack Load Rating Labels and Weight Distribution Guidelines
description: Install permanent, color-coded load capacity labels on all warehouse storage racks specifying maximum weight per shelf, weight distribution patterns, and acceptable stack heights for different material types. Create laminated instruction cards showing proper stacking configuration with diagrams and place them at all storage locations. Conduct immediate audit of all current inventory to ensure compliance. This administrative control eliminates confusion about proper loading and ensures that weight is distributed according to structural design specifications, preventing destabilization and falls.

name: Install Safety Barriers and No-Park Zones Under Elevated Storage
description: Install physical safety barriers (bollards or guardrails) in the warehouse to prevent parking of equipment directly beneath elevated storage racks. Mark no-park zones with bright yellow line striping and signage. This engineering control reduces property damage risk by ensuring vehicles and equipment cannot be struck by falling materials. Additionally, implement a warehouse layout optimization to designate safe equipment storage areas minimum 3 meters away from overhead storage systems.

name: Mandatory Storage and Material Handling Certification for All Warehouse Staff
description: Require all warehouse personnel to complete CNESST-approved material handling and safe storage practices certification within 30 days. Training will cover proper stacking techniques, load distribution principles, rack capacity calculations, and inspection of equipment before use. Implement annual refresher training for all warehouse staff and make it a requirement for any new hire. Create a training matrix and track completion dates to ensure accountability.

name: Implement Ergonomic Lifting Training Program
description: Develop and deliver comprehensive ergonomic training focusing on proper lifting mechanics, load assessment, and body positioning. Training will be mandatory for all warehouse and packaging staff, conducted by Zahra Nasri (HSE Hazard Assessment Specialist) within 2 weeks. Curriculum will include video demonstrations, hands-on practice, and assessment. Refresher training will occur annually and for all new employees during orientation.

name: Redesign Storage Rack Shelf Heights
description: Engineer and install adjustable shelving in the packaging prep area to maintain all frequently accessed boxes between waist and shoulder height (approximately 45-120 cm from floor). This eliminates deep bending and awkward postures. Install mechanical lifting assists or pneumatic shelf lifts for boxes exceeding 15 kg. Target completion within 45 days with ongoing monitoring for compliance.

name: Establish Back Injury Prevention Protocol
description: Create written standard operating procedure for safe material handling in packaging operations. Implement buddy system for loads over 15 kg and require team lifting for boxes exceeding 20 kg. Conduct monthly safety talks on musculoskeletal injury prevention. Establish early reporting system for back pain or strain symptoms to enable early intervention.

name: Replace and Upgrade Cooling Cycle Pressure Relief System
description: Replace degraded ejection pressure suppressors on Injection Molding Line C cooling system with new industrial-grade pressure regulators designed to reduce flash particle ejection velocity by 60%. Install pressure monitoring sensors with automated alerts if thresholds are exceeded. Conduct full system commissioning and testing. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of particle ejection and protects all operators on the line.

name: Implement Mandatory Safety Eyewear Fit and Comfort Program
description: Establish formal eyewear fitting protocol where trained personnel (Facilities Technician Georges Plante) fit all operators with properly sized and adjusted safety glasses monthly. Supply various frame sizes and styles to ensure proper fit. Create visual inspection checklist for daily PPE condition verification. Any glasses with loose fit, cracks, or misalignment must be replaced immediately. Document all fittings in employee safety files.

name: Install Adjustable Shelving with Weight Capacity Labels
description: Replace existing shelving units at the Shipping and Receiving Dock with commercial-grade adjustable shelving that includes permanent weight capacity labels on each shelf. Install load capacity placards clearly visible from all angles. Implement a maximum load of 15 kg per shelf with visual indicators (colored tape) to prevent overloading. Conduct staff training on proper load distribution and weight limits. Install safety netting or barriers underneath elevated storage to contain any items that may fall.

name: Implement Quarterly Shelving Safety Audits
description: Establish a mandatory quarterly inspection program for all storage shelving units facility-wide. Assign responsibility to the Workplace Hazard Assessment Specialist to inspect each unit for proper load distribution, structural integrity, and compliance with weight capacity limits. Document findings in a centralized log and communicate violations to department managers within 24 hours. Non-compliant units are immediately taken out of service until corrected. Train all supervisors to conduct informal daily visual checks during morning briefings.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Spill Kits
description: Implement secondary containment trays beneath all solvent storage containers and work areas in UNIT-013. Each tray must have capacity of at least 110% of the largest container volume stored above it. Install clearly marked spill kits at strategic locations containing absorbent materials, chemical neutralizers, and disposal containers. Require all technicians to place absorbent pads directly under any open solvent containers during maintenance operations. Update inventory to track all flammable liquids with barcode system to prevent overstocking and ensure proper rotation using FIFO (First In, First Out) principle.

name: Upgrade Ventilation System and Install Explosive Atmosphere Detection
description: Install enhanced exhaust ventilation system in the Mold Manufacturing Shop that operates continuously at minimum 8 air changes per hour. Add automated vapor detection sensors that trigger audible/visual alarms when solvent vapor concentrations reach 25% of lower explosive limit (LEL). Install emergency ventilation boost buttons at work stations. Retrofit electrical fixtures to Class II Division 1 rated equipment suitable for hazardous locations. Conduct quarterly professional ventilation system inspections and document compliance. Provide staff training on new alarm systems and emergency procedures.

name: Implement Solvent Handling and Electrical Maintenance Separation Protocol
description: Establish administrative control requiring that any electrical work, testing, or inspection activities cannot occur simultaneously with solvent handling operations in UNIT-013. Create a 'Hot Work Permit' system requiring electrical technicians to verify that no flammable liquids have been spilled or are being used within 10 meters of their work area. Mandate 15-minute ventilation purge periods after solvent spills before any electrical activities resume. Provide toolbox talks to all staff monthly on flammable solvent hazards and include this protocol in the standard maintenance check-in procedures.

name: Implement Mandatory Dual-Key Lockout/Tagout System
description: Install mechanical dual-key lockout system on all injection molding presses at UNIT-003 requiring two separate authorized personnel to unlock the machine before startup. Designate a primary equipment operator and a secondary verification technician who must both physically unlock individual components before machine operation is permitted. Establish a sign-in/sign-out log at each machine documenting who locked and who verified. Conduct quarterly audits of LOTO compliance. Provide 2-hour certification training to all operators and technicians on the dual-key system, with annual recertification mandatory. Make LOTO status visually obvious with multiple colored tags at each lockout point.

name: Install Fixed Guarding on Manual Work Positions
description: Install stationary perimeter guarding around the mold gate area of Injection Molding Line B that prevents hand access to pinch points during any portion of the injection cycle. Design guards to allow only necessary access for tool changes while preventing accidental hand placement in hazard zones. Install electronic interlocks that prevent machine operation if guards are not properly seated. Retrofit all similar manual setup positions on Lines A and C with equivalent guarding. Conduct validation testing to ensure guards prevent entry during all machine motions. Document guard specifications and maintenance requirements in equipment manuals.

name: Enhance Deburring and Edge Finishing Process
description: Implement mandatory 100% visual and tactile inspection of all extracted injection-molded parts for sharp edges before release from the mold area. Train assembly operators on proper handling techniques and provide fingertip guards during part inspection activities. Update the post-processing checklist to specifically identify polycarbonate and ABS components as requiring enhanced edge finishing verification. Install specialized deburring equipment in the Post-Processing and Heat Treatment area to catch missed edges before parts reach assembly lines.

name: Distribute Cut-Resistant Gloves to Assembly Operators
description: Procure and distribute ANSI Level 3 cut-resistant nitrile gloves to all assembly operators working with thermoplastic components. Ensure gloves are sized appropriately for each worker and stored at assembly stations. Conduct brief training on proper glove selection and replacement protocols. This serves as a temporary PPE control while engineering improvements are implemented.

name: Replace Chemical Transfer Equipment with Spill-Proof System
description: Eliminate manual pneumatic pump transfers by installing a mechanical drum pump with integrated spill containment tray and secondary containment basin rated for 110% of drum volume. Mount the system on a fixed stand with anti-vibration pads to prevent equipment movement. Add drip trays under all coupling points. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of unintended chemical release and reduces slip hazards associated with spills.

name: Inspect and Replace Corroded Chemical Coupling Hardware
description: Conduct comprehensive audit of all 18 drum transfer coupling connections in the Chemical Storage area. Replace all corroded fittings with stainless steel fittings rated for acetone and other solvents used in-house. Establish quarterly inspection and maintenance schedule for chemical transfer equipment. Train all operators on proper coupling inspection procedures and when to request maintenance support.

name: Install Non-Slip Flooring in Chemical Storage Area
description: Install commercial-grade anti-slip epoxy coating on all concrete floors in the Chemical Storage and Mixing area. Coating is resistant to acetone, isopropanol, and other solvents used in facility. Add clearly marked yellow safety zones around high-risk equipment. This control reduces slip hazard even when minor spills occur during normal operations.

name: Establish Pallet Inspection and Rotation Program
description: Implement mandatory pre-use inspection protocol for all wooden pallets entering the Regrind and Recycling Department. Inspect for cracked boards, nails, rot, and structural integrity. Create a rejection/repair process for compromised pallets. Transition high-use areas to certified plastic or metal pallets as wooden pallets are retired. Conduct quarterly pallet audits to ensure compliance and track pallet age and condition.

name: Recognize and Reward Safety Decision-Making
description: Formally recognize Tariq Aziz's decision to stop operations and assess the load condition through the monthly safety committee meeting. Feature this incident as a positive example in the next toolbox talk with all material handling personnel. Offer Aziz a $100 safety recognition bonus to reinforce the importance of pausing operations when hazard indicators are observed. This administrative control emphasizes that stopping work is the right decision when equipment appears unsafe.

name: Replace All Cooling System Copper Fittings with Stainless Steel
description: All corroded copper cooling line fittings throughout Injection Molding Line B will be replaced with marine-grade stainless steel fittings rated for continuous operation. A preventive maintenance schedule will be implemented to inspect all cooling system components monthly for corrosion signs. Additionally, a water softening system will be installed at the cooling water intake to reduce mineral deposit accumulation. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of fitting degradation and reduces future leak probability by 95%.

name: Install Automated Coolant Level Monitoring System
description: An automated sensor system will be installed on all injection molding machine cooling loops to detect pressure drops indicating leaks. The system will trigger immediate alerts to production supervisors and automatically activate secondary containment protocols when leaks are detected. This will ensure faster response times and minimize environmental contamination and production loss during future incidents.

name: Upgrade Hopper Level Sensors with Redundant Monitoring
description: Install dual hopper level sensors on all material dryer hoppers with automatic switchover capability if one sensor fails. Implement a preventive maintenance schedule requiring monthly calibration and quarterly replacement of all sensors. Add visual high-level alarm indicators on each hopper and integrate sensor data into the production management system for real-time monitoring. Operators will receive alerts at 85% capacity to prevent overload conditions.

name: Implement Mandatory Hopper Loading Verification Procedure
description: All material handlers must complete a pre-loading checklist that includes visual level verification using a calibrated dipstick tool before initiating automated hopper loading. Supervisors will conduct weekly spot-checks to ensure compliance. Training materials and laminated procedure cards will be posted at each hopper station in both French and English. This administrative control ensures human verification of hopper levels regardless of sensor status.

name: Replace Pneumatic Support Systems with Hydraulic Locking Mechanisms
description: All pneumatic support cylinders on mold maintenance tables will be replaced with dual hydraulic locking systems featuring manual release valves and mechanical pin locks as backup. Each system will include redundant pressure monitoring with audible alarms if pressure drops below safe thresholds. A certified hydraulic technician will conduct full system inspections monthly. This engineering control eliminates the risk of sudden pressure loss that caused this incident.

name: Implement Mandatory Lockout/Tagout for All Mold Maintenance Operations
description: All pneumatic and hydraulic systems supporting molds must be de-energized and locked out using LOTO procedures before any maintenance work begins. A lockout/tagout kit will be permanently stationed at each maintenance table. All technicians will complete quarterly LOTO certification training. Work permits will be required for all mold maintenance tasks, documenting LOTO compliance. Supervisors will conduct monthly LOTO audits to verify compliance and procedure adherence.

name: Install Emergency Stop Buttons and Hand Guards at All Mold Work Stations
description: Install large red emergency stop buttons within arm's reach of all mold maintenance work tables. Install perimeter hand guards and position markers indicating where hands must be kept clear during mold positioning and support system operations. Retractable safety shields will be added above all critical mold support points. Workers will receive hands-on training in use of all safety equipment and hazard recognition.

name: Enhanced Mold Pre-Production Inspection Protocol
description: Implement a mandatory enhanced inspection procedure for all molds prior to production run initiation. This procedure will include visual inspection for burrs, cracks, and sharp edges using tactile gloves and magnification tools. All molds will be documented in a tracking log with inspection date and sign-off by maintenance personnel. This addresses the root cause of inadequate equipment maintenance and will prevent future contact hazards. Expected outcome: 100% detection of mold defects before production startup.

name: Operator Safety Awareness Training - Machine Guarding
description: Conduct refresher training for all production operators and QC staff on proper machine guarding protocols and safe part retrieval procedures. Training will emphasize maintaining safe distance from moving parts, proper use of part retrievers/tools rather than hands, and emergency stop procedures. Video demonstrations will be incorporated showing near-miss scenarios. Training will be documented and tracked. This addresses procedural gaps and human factors in the incident.

name: Forklift Battery Maintenance Schedule Implementation
description: Establish and enforce a comprehensive preventive maintenance schedule for all warehouse forklifts, including monthly battery terminal inspection and cleaning. Maintenance will include corrosion removal, terminal protection application, and battery fluid level checks. A digital tracking system will monitor compliance. All forklift operators will be trained to visually inspect terminals before each shift and report any corrosion. This eliminates the root cause of acid exposure by preventing terminal deterioration.

name: Battery Acid Safety PPE Requirement
description: Require all warehouse personnel operating or working near forklift equipment to wear chemical-resistant gloves and long-sleeved protective clothing during shifts. Provide training on proper PPE donning/doffing procedures and inspection of PPE for damage. Stock readily accessible PPE at all warehouse stations. This administrative control provides additional protection while maintenance improvements are being implemented and sustained.

name: Installation of Local Exhaust Ventilation at Solvent Workstation
description: Install a dedicated fume hood with local exhaust ventilation (LEV) system at the solvent cleaning workstation in the Electrical and Instrumentation Shop. The hood will be equipped with a variable-speed fan and ducting routed to exterior exhaust. The system will be certified and tested upon installation. This engineering control eliminates solvent vapor accumulation at the point of generation, directly addressing the root cause of inhalation exposure.

name: Ventilation System Maintenance and Obstruction Removal
description: Conduct immediate inspection and cleaning of all HVAC intake vents and exhaust pathways in the maintenance workshop. Remove all stored materials from within 3 feet of ventilation intake grilles. Establish a monthly maintenance schedule for vent inspections and cleaning.
