description: Retrofit all hydraulic press equipment in Assembly and Finishing Department with dual-channel safety monitoring systems that include redundant pressure sensors and load-cell verification. Install photo-electric safety light curtains extending 15 cm into the danger zone on all press platens. These systems will automatically halt press operation if any object is detected in the danger zone. The dual-channel design meets ISO 13849-1 PLd safety standards and provides independent verification that prevents single-point control failures.

name: Preventive Maintenance Program for Hydraulic Control Systems
description: Implement a quarterly preventive maintenance schedule for all hydraulic press control systems, including full flow testing, pressure regulator verification, and solenoid valve inspection. Maintenance will be performed by certified hydraulic technicians and documented in a maintenance log. This administrative and preventive control addresses the root cause of the control malfunction and prevents similar failures.

name: Mandatory Nitrile Gloves for Part Removal
description: Implement mandatory use of powder-free nitrile gloves (minimum 5-mil thickness) for all operators during part removal and handling from injection molding machines. Update Machine Operator standard work procedures to require glove donning before machine discharge begins. Provide sized glove dispensers at each production line and conduct brief toolbox talks on proper donning/doffing techniques. This engineering control combined with administrative procedure will eliminate direct skin contact with mold release agents and other chemical residues on hot parts.

name: Mold Release Agent Safety Training Module
description: Develop and deliver a 15-minute online training module covering mold release agent properties, hazards, routes of exposure, and appropriate PPE requirements. Module will be mandatory for all production operators and maintenance technicians. Include information on first aid measures, skin irritation symptoms, and when to seek medical attention. Implement annual refresher training with sign-off documentation. Ensure WHMIS Safety Data Sheets are accessible at all production stations.

name: Install Pressure Relief Valve with Isolating Ball Valves
description: Retrofit all 32 injection molding machines with automatic pressure relief valves (set to maximum safe operating pressure) on cooling water circuits. Install isolating ball valves on both sides of all pressure-sensitive connections to allow safe depressurization before maintenance work. Add pressure gauges with clear maximum operating limits. This engineering control prevents unexpected pressure surges during maintenance by providing controlled pressure release and safe system isolation procedures.

name: Establish Mandatory Pressure Release and Lockout Procedures
description: Update all Machine Maintenance SOPs to require depressurization of cooling systems through installed drain valves before any line disconnections. Implement energy isolation procedures (LOTO - Lockout/Tagout) with documented verification checklists for all cooling system maintenance. Require written work permits for all cooling system maintenance tasks with supervisor sign-off. Provide refresher LOTO training for all maintenance personnel with emphasis on cooling system hazards and multiple energy sources (hydraulic pressure, electrical power, thermal energy).

name: Install Water-Resistant Electrical Control Panel Enclosures
description: Upgrade electrical control panels on all injection molding machines to NEMA 4X or equivalent water-resistant, sealed enclosures with drain ports. Install splash guards around servo motor connections and electrical harnesses. Relocate electrical components away from cooling system pressure points where possible. Consider secondary containment trays beneath machines to contain minor cooling fluid leaks. This multi-layered engineering control minimizes electrical system exposure to cooling fluid spray and reduces fire risk from electrical-fluid contact.

name: Upgrade Drum Securing System on Forklifts
description: Replace standard nylon straps with heavy-duty ratchet tie-down systems rated for 500+ lbs on all 12 company forklifts. Install load sensors that alert operators if securing tension drops below safe threshold. Conduct training on new securing procedures for all forklift operators and supervisors. Expected outcome: 95% reduction in drum slip incidents and improved load stability during transport.

name: Install Enhanced Ventilation in Chemical Storage Area
description: Install additional spot ventilation units in the Chemical Storage and Mixing building with dedicated exhaust to exterior. Upgrade to HEPA filtration system with real-time VOC monitoring and automatic alarm at 50% WHMIS threshold. Place three additional emergency eyewash stations and safety showers within 30 seconds walking distance. Expected outcome: Reduce VOC exposure incidents by 80% and improve emergency response capabilities.

name: Implement Mandatory Chemical Spill Response Drills
description: Establish quarterly spill response simulation drills involving production, maintenance, and HSE teams. Rotate leadership responsibilities and update procedures based on lessons learned. Document all drills and track corrective actions. Provide annual refresher training on spill containment, PPE requirements, and evacuation procedures to all affected staff. Expected outcome: Faster response times, better coordination, and improved employee awareness of hazards.

name: Establish Predictive Maintenance Program for Critical Safety Systems
description: Implement quarterly thermographic inspection of all E-stop solenoid valves on 32 injection molding machines to detect early corrosion and electrical degradation. Establish replacement intervals based on equipment age and environmental conditions. Create maintenance log database with automated alerts for overdue inspections. Train maintenance staff on early failure indicators and corrective replacement procedures. Expected outcome: Prevent catastrophic E-stop failures and reduce unplanned downtime by 60%.

name: Upgrade E-Stop Systems with Redundant Safety Circuits
description: Replace existing single-circuit E-stop systems with dual-channel safety-rated systems on all 32 injection molding machines over 6-month period. Install redundant solenoid valves and hardwired safety relays compliant with ISO 13850 standards. Conduct full system validation and documentation for each machine. Expected outcome: Achieve SIL 2 (Safety Integrity Level) compliance and eliminate single-point-of-failure scenarios in emergency shutdown systems.

name: Implement Ergonomic Work Station Redesign
description: Raise packaging work tables from 27 inches to 32 inches to reduce wrist extension strain. Install adjustable wrist support cushions and anti-fatigue mats at each of 9 packaging stations. Install task-specific lighting to reduce eyestrain-related posture compensation. Replace grip tools with ergonomically optimized applicators with soft-grip handles. Conduct individual fit assessment for each operator. Expected outcome: Reduce repetitive strain symptoms by 70% and decrease absence due to hand/wrist pain.

name: Establish Mandatory Micro-Break and Job Rotation Protocol
description: Implement 5-minute structured micro-breaks every 60 minutes of repetitive labeling work with guided stretching and hand exercises. Rotate packaging operators through light-duty tasks (quality inspection, labeling verification) every 2 hours to vary muscle group usage. Document rotation schedule and enforce via supervisor checklist. Provide ergonomic training to all packaging staff on proper posture, stretching techniques, and symptom self-monitoring. Expected outcome: Reduce cumulative strain exposure by 40% and improve early detection of developing conditions.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Schedule for Supply Hoses
description: Establish a documented preventive maintenance program that tracks all resin and solvent supply hoses with replacement intervals at 12 months maximum. Create a color-coded tagging system (with date installed) visible on all hoses in production areas. Maintenance Supervisor François-Xavier Mailhot will conduct quarterly audits to verify compliance. All hose replacements will be logged in the maintenance management system with photographic documentation. Training will be provided to all production staff on identifying hose degradation signs.

name: Upgrade Chemical Spill Response Containment System
description: Install permanent secondary containment berms (40-gallon capacity minimum) beneath all resin transfer points and hopper fill stations in production areas. Upgrade the existing spill kit inventory to include additional absorbent materials specific to epoxy and polyester resins. Mount clearly labeled spill response signs at each station with step-by-step containment procedures in both English and French. Conduct monthly spill response drills with production staff to ensure rapid, effective response.

name: Enhanced Chemical Safety Training for Production Staff
description: Develop and deliver a mandatory 2-hour training module covering chemical properties of epoxy and polyester resins, hazard recognition, proper handling procedures, and spill response protocols. Include specific instruction on hose integrity assessment and when to request replacement. Training will be delivered quarterly to all production and maintenance staff. Competency assessments will be documented and retained. Refresher training will be required following any spill incident.

name: Install Mechanical Material Handling Equipment
description: Procure and install two powered pallet jacks and one electric lift table (capable of adjusting height 0.6m to 1.5m) in the Raw Materials Warehouse. Equipment will be positioned at key material handling workstations. All warehouse staff will receive mandatory certification training on safe operation. Establish a policy prohibiting manual lifting of bags weighing more than 15 kg above shoulder height. Create color-coded signage identifying weight-restricted lifting zones. Conduct monthly equipment maintenance and safety checks.

name: Redesign Warehouse Storage Rack Configuration
description: Re-engineer storage rack layouts in the warehouse to place frequently handled materials between waist and shoulder height (ergonomic zone). Heavy items will be stored at lower levels. Implement a kanban inventory system to reduce manual reorganization frequency. Install clear labeling indicating maximum safe lifting weight for each storage location. Work with warehouse staff to identify optimal placement based on actual handling patterns. Conduct ergonomic assessment of all material handling tasks.

name: Comprehensive Ergonomics Training and Refresher Program
description: Deliver comprehensive ergonomics training to all warehouse and production staff focusing on proper lifting techniques, load assessment, use of mechanical aids, and recognition of strain symptoms. Training will be 90 minutes and include practical demonstrations. Annual refresher training will be mandatory. Include modules on early reporting of ergonomic discomfort. Establish a stretching and warm-up routine for shift start. Create a peer mentorship program where experienced safe workers demonstrate proper techniques.

name: Implement Pallet Securing and Load Stabilization Standards
description: Establish mandatory standards for securing composite component pallets using high-strength strapping bands (minimum 3 bands per pallet) and corner protectors to prevent shifting. All pallets receiving finished goods must pass a visual stability inspection before shipping or internal movement. Create a standardized pallet preparation checklist that must be completed before dock operations. Supervisory verification will be required on 100% of shipments for the first 60 days, then random audits at 10% thereafter. Training will be provided to all personnel handling pallets.

name: Install Protective Barriers and Access Controls at Receiving Dock
description: Install protective bollards and access barriers to designate safe pallet handling zones at the shipping and receiving dock. Implement a no-reach policy restricting hand access between stacked pallets during load movement. Install mirrors and improved overhead lighting to enhance visibility of stacked materials. Mark hazardous high-stack zones with red warning tape and signage in multiple languages. Establish a buddy system policy requiring a second person to verify stability before any manual adjustment of pallet positions.

name: Install Automated Cooling System Interlocks on Injection Molding Equipment
description: Engineering modification: Install mechanical interlocks that prevent access to the mold area until temperature sensors confirm cooling below 80°C. The interlock will physically block the access panel with audible and visual alerts when temperature exceeds safe limits. Technicians will be unable to bypass the system without supervisor authorization and documented reason. This engineering control eliminates the possibility of skin contact with hot surfaces by making manual access impossible during unsafe conditions.

name: Implement Mandatory Heat-Resistant Glove Requirements and Temperature Monitoring Protocol
description: Establish administrative requirement that technicians must wear certified heat-resistant gloves (rated to 250°C) during all post-production equipment handling. Require visible temperature gauges on each machine displaying real-time mold temperature. Implement a mandatory 30-minute cooling period between final cycle and manual inspection, with electronic timers preventing equipment access before expiration. Supervisors will conduct spot audits of glove compliance. Training will emphasize that protocol shortcuts increase injury risk and are disciplinary violations.

name: Implement Mandatory Mold Cooling and Temperature Verification Protocol
description: Establish a formal pre-maintenance checklist requiring operators to cool molds to below 60°C before touching and verify temperature using calibrated infrared thermometers. Install temperature display gauges on all injection molding machines visible to operators. Conduct mandatory retraining for all 32 operators on the revised LOTO procedures with emphasis on thermal hazard identification. Documentation of temperature verification must be signed off by both operator and supervisor before maintenance begins.

name: Upgrade to Advanced Heat-Resistant Protective Gloves
description: Replace current standard heat-resistant gloves with tier-2 industrial thermal protection gloves rated for sustained contact up to 300°C. Conduct fit testing and training with all production operators and maintenance technicians. Establish quarterly replacement schedule to maintain glove integrity. Coordinate with Materials Management to ensure adequate inventory.

name: Establish Real-Time Supervision Requirements for High-Risk Tasks
description: Implement administrative requirement that all mold maintenance and cleaning operations on injection molding machines require on-site supervisor presence. Supervisors must complete specialized training on thermal hazard recognition and emergency response. Create task-specific supervision cards for display at each machine detailing who to notify and required pre-task verification steps.

name: Complete Storage Rack Load Capacity Assessment and Certification
description: Engage certified structural engineer to assess all overhead reel storage racks for current load-bearing capacity and safety compliance. Conduct non-destructive testing on support welds and connections. Install permanent load capacity placards on each rack section. Any racks failing assessment must be immediately decommissioned or retrofitted. Provide detailed report to JHSC and maintenance team for documentation.

name: Replace All Storage Straps and Install Secondary Containment
description: Replace all deteriorated securing straps with marine-grade synthetic straps rated for 500+ pounds per strap with annual replacement schedule. Install steel cable mesh panels as secondary containment on fronts of reel storage racks to prevent dislodged materials from falling into work zones. Install warning signage and restrict personnel access directly beneath elevated racks. Conduct inventory audit to establish baseline compliance.

name: Establish Mandatory Component Preparation and Inspection Staging
description: Implement two-stage quality control protocol where components must be certified as fully cured and residue-free before entry to clean room inspection areas. Create dedicated staging area with proper ventilation where uncured epoxy surfaces are solvent-wiped and verified using tactile inspection. Require sign-off documentation from Quality Control supervisor. Establish maximum residence time of 2 hours for components in staging before inspection clearance.

name: Upgrade Personal Protective Equipment for Clean Room Quality Technicians
description: Issue all medical device clean room quality technicians with enhanced PPE package including nitrile examination gloves (double-glove protocol), long-sleeved protective undershirts, and forearm guards for handling curing composite materials. Conduct refresher training on proper donning and doffing procedures. Establish monthly PPE inventory checks and replacement protocols.

name: Reinstall and Secure Mold Safety Guards
description: All injection molding machines on Line D will have safety guards permanently reinstalled and welded in place. A daily checklist system will be implemented requiring operators to visually inspect guards before each shift. The maintenance department will establish a protocol where guards can only be removed by authorized personnel with documented work orders, and must be reinstalled immediately upon completion of maintenance. This engineering control directly addresses the root cause of the incident.

name: Implement Proximity Sensor Maintenance Schedule
description: All proximity sensors on injection molding equipment will be tested and calibrated monthly. A preventive maintenance log will track sensor functionality and any false activations. Operators will receive training to recognize signs of sensor malfunction such as unexpected machine cycling. Any faulty sensors will be immediately replaced and the work documented in the maintenance management system.

name: Mandatory Machine Guarding and Lockout Training Refresher
description: All production operators and maintenance technicians will complete a 4-hour refresher training on machine guarding requirements and lockout/tagout procedures. The training will include real incident scenarios including hand injuries from molding equipment. Competency assessments will be administered and documented. This administrative control ensures all personnel understand the critical importance of safety guard integrity.

name: Establish Ladder Inspection and Placement Protocol
description: A comprehensive ladder safety procedure will be developed requiring: inspection of all ladders before each use, proper stabilization on level surfaces only, use of ladder leveling devices on uneven floors, and clear work areas free of debris. Step-by-step laminated placards will be posted at all ladder storage locations. All maintenance staff will sign off on training completion. Monthly audits will verify compliance with the protocol.

name: Install Overhead Equipment Racking System
description: The tool room will implement a new wall-mounted racking system for molds and fixtures currently stored on high shelves. This engineering control eliminates the need for employees to climb ladders to access these items. The system will be installed at ergonomic heights (waist to shoulder level) and properly secured. This directly addresses the hazard that contributed to the fall.

name: Implement Material Stacking Height and Load Limits
description: Clear guidelines will be posted at all storage areas specifying maximum stacking heights for each material type based on pallet capacity. Packaging and warehouse staff will receive training on proper load distribution and weight limits. A visual inspection checklist will be implemented requiring operators to verify stack stability before leaving an area. Monthly audits will verify compliance. Load capacity labels will be affixed to all racks.

name: Install Pallet Rack Safety Barriers and Load Stops
description: Engineering control: Install adjustable load stops and safety barriers on all pallet racks in the packaging station to prevent materials from sliding or tipping forward. Additionally, install high-visibility warning labels at eye level. This physical modification eliminates the potential for materials to fall into walkways.

name: Establish Quarterly Rack Integrity Inspection Program
description: A formal inspection schedule will be established requiring qualified personnel to inspect all storage racks quarterly for damage, deformation, or structural integrity issues. Any damaged racks will be immediately removed from service. Documentation will be maintained and reviewed during safety committee meetings. This administrative control ensures ongoing hazard monitoring.

name: Mandatory Heat-Resistant PPE Protocol for Molding Lines
description: Implement a zero-tolerance policy requiring all personnel on injection molding lines to wear ANSI-rated heat-resistant gloves and sleeves during all mold handling operations. Install visual reminders at each molding station and conduct daily toolbox talks reinforcing PPE compliance. All supervisors will perform hourly audits of PPE usage with documented sign-offs. Personnel found non-compliant will receive immediate retraining and discipline per company policy. Expected outcome: 100% PPE compliance and reduction in thermal burn incidents.

name: Install Automated Part Handling System on Line A
description: Install pneumatic robotic arms at the mold ejection point to automatically transfer hot components to the cooling conveyor, eliminating direct hand contact with high-temperature parts. The system will integrate with existing mold cycle timing and include safety interlock mechanisms. This engineering control prioritizes elimination of the hazard over PPE reliance. Implementation includes operator training and validation testing over 2 weeks.

name: Implement Pre-Shift PPE Inspection Protocol
description: Establish a mandatory daily inspection procedure where all chemical handling personnel must visually inspect gloves, sleeves, and other PPE for tears, cracks, or degradation before beginning work. Create a sign-off sheet posted at each chemical station where workers initial off after inspection. Supply a diverse range of glove thicknesses and materials to accommodate different tasks. Include double-gloving as standard practice for high-risk chemical transfer operations. Expected outcome: early detection of damaged PPE and elimination of 90% of skin contact incidents.

name: Mandatory Machine Maintenance Schedule Compliance
description: Establish a non-deferrable preventive maintenance program for all injection molding equipment where scheduled maintenance tasks are locked into production planning and cannot be delayed for any reason without escalation to Operations Manager and HSE Director. Implement a digital tracking system that sends automated alerts when maintenance is due and prevents machine operation if maintenance is overdue. Include quarterly audits of maintenance compliance. All maintenance personnel must document completion with photographic evidence. Expected outcome: 100% maintenance compliance and elimination of equipment-related failures.

name: Install Dual-Channel Safety Interlock System on All Molding Lines
description: Replace existing single-channel mold clamp safety systems with redundant dual-channel safety interlocks that meet ISO 13849-1 PLd standards. These systems will include independent backup clamp release mechanisms, real-time pressure monitoring, and automatic shutdown if any anomaly is detected. The dual-channel design ensures that a single component failure cannot result in a pinch point hazard. Full system integration, testing, and operator training will be completed on all production lines within 90 days.

name: Emergency Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Training and Certification
description: Implement comprehensive LOTO training for all production operators and engineers with focus on emergency procedures when equipment malfunctions occur. Conduct monthly hands-on drills where operators practice proper emergency stop procedures and communication protocols. Maintain current LOTO certification records and conduct refresher training every 6 months. Ensure every operator can confidently activate emergency stops and communicate hazards without hesitation. Expected outcome: faster emergency response times and reduced dwell time in hazardous situations.

name: Install Static-Dissipative Flooring in Chemical Mixing Area
description: Replace standard concrete flooring in the solvent mixing room with conductive epoxy flooring specifically designed to dissipate static electricity. Install grounding points every 15 feet and connect all equipment used in chemical transfer to dedicated grounding straps. This engineering control eliminates the root cause of static ignition and prevents future vapor ignition incidents. Expected outcome: reduction in static-related fire risk by 95%.

name: Mandatory Static-Safe Chemical Transfer Training
description: Develop and deliver comprehensive training for all employees involved in chemical handling on proper grounding techniques, static risks, and safe transfer procedures. Training will include hands-on demonstrations of proper equipment grounding and use of anti-static wrist straps and mats. Implementation of monthly refresher training and competency assessments. Create visual signage at all chemical storage and mixing areas emphasizing static hazards.

name: Upgrade Fire Suppression System Monitoring
description: Install automated alerts and remote monitoring of fire suppression system status connected to facility management and emergency response. Implement quarterly inspections instead of annual inspections for solvent storage areas. Upgrade pull-station locations and add additional stations to ensure 100% coverage of chemical areas. Ensure all staff are trained on activation procedures annually.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification Protocol
description: Establish a two-person verification system where a supervisor must physically verify and sign-off on all LOTO procedures before maintenance or cleaning begins. Install electronic LOTO devices with digital logging that automatically documents lockout status and personnel involved. Require photographic evidence of locked switches before work commences. Conduct monthly audits of LOTO compliance with corrective action for violations. This engineering and administrative control directly addresses the root cause of bypassed lockout procedures.

name: Production Quota Policy Revision
description: Revise manufacturing policies to explicitly state that safety procedures cannot be bypassed to meet production targets. Implement a documented accountability system where supervisors must report any requests to bypass safety procedures to HSE management. Add safety compliance metrics to supervisor performance evaluations, ensuring that quota achievement does not supersede safety. Communicate policy changes through mandatory staff meetings and posted signage throughout production areas.

name: Enhanced Machine Guarding and Barrier Installation
description: Install physical barriers and interlocked guards on all injection molding nozzle areas to prevent operator hand access during machine operation. These guards will automatically trigger machine shutdown if compromised. Install emergency stop buttons within arm's reach of all nozzle areas. Retrofit injection molding machines to require active LOTO compliance before any cycle can begin. This engineering control prevents inadvertent contact with hazardous areas.

name: Install Secondary Containment System in Maintenance Workshop
description: Construct a secondary containment system with 110% capacity of the largest single container stored in the workshop. Install absorbent floor mats and dedicated spill kits at all material handling stations. Mark floor drain locations clearly and install drain plugs that can be activated during spill events. This engineering control prevents environmental contamination and meets regulatory requirements. Expected outcome: complete containment of future spills within the workshop area.

name: Forklift Load Securing and Safe Handling Procedures
description: Develop and implement mandatory forklift load-securing procedures requiring all drums and containers to be secured with straps before transport. Conduct refresher training for all forklift operators on proper load configuration, weight distribution, and securing techniques. Establish a pre-operation checklist that includes load securing verification. Create visual training materials showing correct and incorrect load configurations posted at all forklift stations. Monthly competency assessments for operators.

name: Replace Temperature Sensors on All Regrind Equipment
description: Conduct comprehensive audit of all temperature sensors and heating elements in the Regrind and Recycling Department. Replace all sensors exceeding manufacturer-recommended service life (2 years). Implement quarterly sensor calibration verification with documented results maintained in the computerized maintenance management system. Establish sensor replacement as non-deferrable maintenance task requiring sign-off from HSE manager before deferral approval.

name: Implement Preventive Maintenance Compliance System
description: Deploy automated alerts in maintenance tracking software to notify supervisors when preventive maintenance schedules lapse by more than 5 days. Train all maintenance technicians on the new system. Conduct monthly audits of maintenance logs with corrective actions for non-compliance. Link supervisor performance evaluations to maintenance compliance metrics to ensure accountability and reduce maintenance backlogs.

name: Install Advanced Fire Detection and Suppression in Regrind Area
description: Upgrade the existing dry powder suppression system to include dual-stage detection (optical and thermal) with reduced detection time from 45 seconds to 15 seconds. Install real-time monitoring that alerts the control room and emergency contacts when suppression system activates. Conduct quarterly system testing and maintenance. Provide annual training to all regrind operators on proper response procedures when suppression systems activate.

name: Restore and Test All Interlock Sensors on Molding Machines
description: Conduct comprehensive inspection and testing of all safety interlocks on 32 injection molding machines. Repair or replace 4 units with known or suspected bypasses. Implement a lockout/tagout protocol requiring documentation of any sensor bypass, with mandatory notification to the HSE department and supervisor sign-off. Any bypass exceeding 24 hours requires written explanation and corrective action plan. Install tamper-evident labels on all interlock bypasses to detect unauthorized removal.

name: Enhance Machine Guarding and Operator Training Program
description: Develop updated standard operating procedures for part removal on all molding machines, emphasizing confirmation of full mold opening before hand insertion. Conduct mandatory retraining for all 47 production operators on proper mold cycle verification techniques. Install visual indicators (LED lights) on each machine showing real-time mold position (open/closing/closed/opening). Require annual recertification on machine-specific hazards with practical testing component.

name: Replace and Implement Ladder Safety Program
description: Replace all defective ladders in the facility (identified 7 units with worn feet, loose rivets, or bent rails). Conduct professional inspection of remaining 12 ladders per ANSI A14.2 standards. Implement quarterly ladder inspection protocol with documented maintenance log. Tag all ladders with inspection dates. Provide training to all 47 staff members with ladder access on proper positioning, load ratings, and safe climbing techniques. Establish rule requiring three-point contact (two hands, one foot or two feet, one hand) at all times.

name: Install Height Safety Systems on Mezzanine
description: Install engineered fall arrest system with cable anchoring points around the 8-foot storage mezzanine perimeter. Provide personal fall arrest harnesses rated for mezzanine height to all staff accessing this area. Implement mandatory fall protection training covering harness inspection, donning/doffing procedures, and rescue response. Install warning signs and floor markings indicating fall hazard zones. Alternatively, for staff retrieving items at low frequency, restructure storage layout to eliminate mezzanine access by moving high-use items to waist-height shelving.

name: Establish Height Work and Mezzanine Access Procedures
description: Develop and implement standard operating procedures for all mezzanine access and elevated work activities. Require two-person rule for any work on the mezzanine—one worker performing task while second serves as ground-level spotter. Create digital reservation system for mezzanine access to track who accesses the area and when. Conduct orientation for all new employees on height hazards and fall protection requirements. Include mezzanine safety in new hire onboarding checklist and conduct refresher training annually.

name: Implement Rack Load Capacity Labeling and Inspection Program
description: Install clear load capacity labels on all storage racks in the warehouse and conduct a comprehensive inspection of all securing straps and attachment points. Establish a monthly inspection schedule with documented findings. Replace all worn or damaged straps with heavy-duty stainless steel securing mechanisms rated for 1.5x maximum load. Train all warehouse personnel on proper part placement, weight distribution, and load securing procedures. This engineering control will eliminate the root cause of strap failure by ensuring redundant securing methods and preventing overloading.

name: Warehouse Ergonomics and Material Handling Training
description: Conduct mandatory retraining for all warehouse staff on proper ergonomic practices when retrieving items from shelves, including the use of step ladders and mechanical lifts for items above shoulder height. Implement a policy requiring mechanical assistance for any part weighing more than 5 kg stored above waist height. Include proper lifting techniques, risk assessment before retrieval, and when to request assistance. Distribute laminated ergonomic posters at key locations. This administrative control will reduce the risk of similar injuries through improved work practices and increased awareness.

name: Upgrade Drum Transport Equipment with Secondary Containment
description: Replace all existing hand trucks with specialized drum transport carts featuring integrated secondary containment trays with 50-liter capacity, capable of capturing 100% of a drum's contents. These carts will have stabilizing mechanisms to prevent tilting and secure locking systems for container caps. Retrofit the doorway between storage and mixing areas with a wider passage and smooth flooring to reduce vibration during transport. Install redundant drain plugs with lock-down mechanisms on all resin containers. This engineering control eliminates the risk of spills during transport by ensuring containment at the source.

name: Enhanced Chemical Spill Response and Prevention Training
description: Implement mandatory quarterly training for all personnel working with hazardous materials covering spill prevention, immediate response procedures, proper use of absorbent materials, and environmental reporting requirements. Create laminated quick-reference cards for spill response locations and emergency contact numbers. Conduct tabletop exercises simulating various spill scenarios. Establish clear procedural documentation for cap inspection before transport and require workers to report any loose caps immediately. This administrative control will improve preparedness and reduce human error in preventing and responding to spills.

name: Complete LOTO Procedure Revision and Hydraulic System Engineering Control
description: Immediately revise all LOTO procedures for injection molding equipment to include mandatory hydraulic pressure venting to zero PSI verified by certified pressure gauge before any maintenance work. Install automatic pressure relief valves on all mold clamping cylinders that discharge to atmosphere when accumulator pressure exceeds safe working limits. Install permanent pressure release levers and clear labeling at each potential accumulation point. Conduct full engineering assessment of all 32 injection molding machines and implement these controls facility-wide. Document all modifications with dated photographs and revised P&IDs. This engineering control eliminates the root cause by preventing pressurized systems from causing unexpected equipment movement.

name: Mandatory LOTO Retraining and Competency Verification for All Maintenance Personnel
description: Conduct comprehensive LOTO retraining for all 25 maintenance and operator personnel with emphasis on hydraulic system hazards and updated procedures specific to recently modified equipment. Implement a competency verification program requiring each worker to demonstrate proper lockout/tagout procedures on their assigned equipment with a certified trainer before returning to independent maintenance work. Create a tracking system for LOTO certifications with mandatory annual recertification. Establish a peer verification requirement where a second qualified person must independently verify LOTO compliance before work begins. This administrative control ensures all personnel understand and follow updated procedures correctly.

name: Install Electronic Mold Position Sensors and Interlocks
description: Install non-contact position sensors on all injection molding machines to electronically verify that mold halves are fully open and secured before permitting manual access or maintenance. Program PLCs to prevent any hydraulic motion commands when maintenance mode is active and sensors detect personnel proximity to the mold area. Install redundant safety interlocks that require manual acknowledgment that LOTO has been verified before any system can be energized. These engineering controls provide an additional layer of protection against unexpected equipment motion during maintenance, reducing entanglement risk even if LOTO procedures are not perfectly executed.

name: Implement Mandatory Safety Interlock Verification Protocol
description: Establish a written procedure requiring maintenance staff to document all safety bypass activities with specific timestamps, reason for bypass, and verification checklist before resuming operations. All bypasses must be logged in a centralized system accessible to supervisors. Line A operations will not resume until a qualified supervisor physically verifies the interlock is properly re-engaged and signs off on the verification form. Training will be mandatory for all maintenance personnel within 5 days of implementation.

name: Install Interlocked Safety Gate with Guard Locks
description: Replace the existing mold safety interlock system on Line A with a redundant dual-channel safety gate system that cannot be bypassed without permanent equipment modification. The new system will feature mechanical and electronic locking mechanisms that must both be satisfied before mold access is possible. Installation will be performed by certified safety equipment specialists. This engineering control eliminates the possibility of operator error or intentional bypass.

name: Conduct Comprehensive LOTO and Safety Interlock Training
description: Karine Cloutier, Safety Trainer, will develop and deliver a 4-hour mandatory training module covering proper Lockout/Tagout procedures, safety interlock systems, consequences of bypass, and incident case studies. All production operators, maintenance technicians, and injection molding setters on all lines will complete this training. Competency will be assessed through written and practical exams. Retraining will be required annually and whenever equipment is modified.

name: Complete Overhead Crane Rail System Replacement
description: Contract certified industrial equipment specialists to replace the entire overhead crane rail system in Warehouse Section B, including all support brackets, fasteners, and welds. New rail system will be fabricated from premium-grade structural steel with enhanced corrosion resistance. Installation must include re-certification testing to 150% of rated load capacity before returning to service. All work must be completed by qualified personnel with proper documentation and safety protocols during facility downtime.

name: Establish Quarterly Detailed Crane Inspection Program
description: Implement a comprehensive quarterly inspection schedule for all overhead cranes beyond the annual CNESST requirement. Inspections will include ultrasonic thickness testing of rail systems, thermographic imaging to detect corrosion initiation, and detailed documentation of all findings in a digital maintenance tracking system. All inspection reports will be reviewed by plant management, and any defects will be classified by severity with mandatory remediation timelines. Inspections will be conducted by certified crane technicians.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Drip Trays
description: Install engineered secondary containment systems beneath all packaging adhesive dispensing connections on Line D to capture any minor leaks or splashes at source before they reach employee work zones. Containment systems will include removable drip trays lined with absorbent material and sloped collection channels. All adhesive line connections will be inspected and upgraded to higher-pressure rated fittings. This engineering control will prevent splashing at the source rather than relying solely on PPE.

name: Emergency Ventilation System Overhaul and Preventive Maintenance Schedule
description: Engage qualified HVAC contractor to perform complete inspection, bearing replacement, and motor servicing of all ventilation systems in chemical storage areas. Establish quarterly preventive maintenance schedule with documented inspections, bearing lubrication, and motor testing. Implement automated alert system to track maintenance intervals. Install redundant ventilation system with automatic switchover capability in chemical mixing room to ensure continuous air extraction. Expected outcome: Eliminate single-point failure risk and ensure chemical hazard exposure remains below regulatory limits.

name: Enhanced Chemical Handling Training and Vapor Monitoring Protocol
description: Develop mandatory refresher training for all personnel working in chemical storage areas covering hazard recognition, ventilation system components, and emergency response procedures. Install continuous air quality monitors with audible alarms set at 50% of PEL for common solvents. Train operators to evacuate immediately upon alarm activation. Conduct quarterly drills simulating ventilation failure scenarios. Documentation will be maintained by HSE department. Expected outcome: Increase situational awareness and reduce time to recognition and evacuation.

name: Implement Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS)
description: Deploy CMMS software to track all equipment maintenance activities, generate automatic work orders for scheduled preventive maintenance, and maintain historical records for all production equipment including ventilation systems. System will provide advance notifications 30 days before service intervals are due. All maintenance personnel will receive system training. Reports will be reviewed monthly by maintenance lead and HSE committee. This addresses the documentation gap that contributed to the missed maintenance schedule.

name: Implement Color-Coded Waste Segregation System and Removal Protocol
description: Install clearly labeled, color-coded waste containers throughout production areas (red for combustible plastics, blue for metal, green for general waste). Position containers minimum 3 feet from all heat-producing equipment. Establish mandatory waste removal schedule requiring containers to be emptied every 4 hours during shift changes. Provide laminated signage at each workstation showing proper disposal procedures. All personnel will receive training on new system during next monthly safety meeting. Containers will be located in designated waste staging area away from production floor.

name: Establish Heat Source Safety Perimeter Guidelines
description: Conduct facility walk-through to identify all heat-generating equipment (sealing machines, ovens, dryers) and establish 5-foot exclusion zones around each device where combustible materials are prohibited. Paint floor markings to clearly demarcate these zones. Revise equipment operation SOPs to explicitly state combustible material restrictions. Maintenance personnel will verify proper spacing quarterly. Any stored materials within exclusion zones will be relocated. Expected outcome: Eliminate proximity hazards and reduce fire ignition sources.

name: Fire Safety Training and Equipment Inspection Program
description: Conduct mandatory fire safety certification for all production and maintenance personnel covering fire prevention, proper extinguisher use (Classes A, B, C), and evacuation procedures specific to packaging station layout. Schedule quarterly fire extinguisher inspections and maintenance with certified vendor. Conduct fire alarm system testing monthly with documented results. Install additional fire extinguishers in packaging area (minimum 2 units within 50 feet of sealing equipment). Train at least 3 additional personnel per shift as certified fire wardens.

name: Complete Compressed Air System Inspection, Flushing, and Maintenance Protocol
description: Hire certified pneumatic systems technician to conduct complete inspection of all compressed air lines, couplings, regulators, and fittings throughout facility. Perform high-pressure flushing to remove internal corrosion and moisture deposits. Replace all corroded couplings and damaged line sections with stainless steel components rated for sustained 150 PSI operation. Install moisture trap filters and desiccant dryers on main air supply lines. Establish monthly inspection schedule with documented findings. Implement annual system flushing requirement. Expected outcome: Eliminate coupling failure risk and extend equipment life by 5-7 years.

name: Install Protective Barriers and Secondary Containment on Mezzanine
description: Install perimeter safety netting or polycarbonate barriers around mezzanine work areas to contain dislodged objects and prevent items from falling to ground level. Designate secure storage locations for heavy equipment and bearing assemblies with anchoring systems to prevent movement during pressurized events. Install high-impact zone signage indicating fall hazard below. Establish protocol requiring temporary exclusion zone setup when compressed air work is being performed. Expected outcome: Reduce risk of secondary impacts and protect equipment and personnel below.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance Program for Hydraulic Systems
description: Establish an automated alert system that tracks operating hours and fluid condition for all 32 injection molding machines. Hydraulic fluid samples will be analyzed quarterly for viscosity, contamination, and degradation markers. Service intervals will be strictly enforced with automatic work orders generated at 4,500-hour thresholds. Maintenance Planner Roland Dostie will oversee implementation, including technician training on fluid analysis protocols. This engineering control eliminates the primary failure mode by ensuring equipment operates within design parameters and fluid integrity is maintained.

name: Install Secondary Containment and Thermal Shielding
description: Retrofit all injection molding machines with hydraulic fluid secondary containment trays capable of capturing 110% of maximum system fluid volume. Install thermal shielding barriers around pump and seal areas to redirect spray patterns away from operator zones. These engineering controls reduce injury severity if future failures occur while engineering out the maintenance root cause. Installation will be completed over 6 weeks across all 32 machines during scheduled maintenance windows.

name: Enhance Operator Training on Equipment Inspection
description: Develop a daily pre-shift equipment inspection checklist for all injection molding operators. Training will focus on recognizing early warning signs of hydraulic system failure: abnormal vibration frequencies, unusual pump noise, pressure gauge fluctuations, and fluid leakage. Monthly competency assessments will be conducted. This administrative control creates early detection capability and empowers operators as first-line defect identification resources.

name: Upgrade Ventilation Monitoring System
description: Install differential pressure gauges on all HEPA filter systems with automated alert thresholds set at 70% saturation levels, providing 48-hour advance warning before performance degradation reaches critical levels. Integrate monitoring data into the facility's maintenance management system for automatic work order generation. This engineering control ensures proactive filter replacement and maintains consistent air quality without relying on operator observation alone.

name: Establish Quarterly Ventilation System Audits
description: Implement a comprehensive quarterly ventilation inspection protocol conducted by qualified HSE personnel. Audits will include airflow velocity testing, particulate concentration measurements, filter condition assessment, and ductwork integrity verification across all production and chemical handling areas. Results will be documented and shared with the Joint Health and Safety Committee. This administrative control creates systematic oversight and prevents gradual degradation of air quality controls.

name: Implement Physical Separation of Chemical Transfer Zone
description: Designate a dedicated chemical transfer area in UNIT-009 with physical barriers (bollards, raised platform curbing) preventing forklift access within a 15-foot radius. This engineering control eliminates the primary cause of the spill by removing the interaction between heavy equipment and chemical containers. Transfer operations will only occur during designated time windows when forklift traffic is restricted.

name: Upgrade Chemical Container Handling Procedures
description: Transition from rigid 5-liter containers to secondary containment drip trays and flexible tubing systems for acetone transfers. Implement a requirement that all container transfers occur only from stationary, secured transfer stations with integrated spill capture capabilities. Train all personnel on proper connection procedures and containment protocols. Administrative controls will limit spill volume in future incidents and reduce environmental exposure.

name: Enhance Forklift Operator Awareness Training
description: Conduct mandatory refresher training for all forklift operators with specific focus on chemical hazard zones, restricted traffic areas, and communication protocols with dock personnel. Include scenario-based training on consequences of equipment strikes in chemical storage areas. Implement a buddy system where dock workers must communicate via radio before any movement of materials near chemical transfer zones.

name: Mandatory Lockout/Tagout Compliance Enforcement
description: Implement a zero-tolerance policy for bypassing LOTO procedures with mandatory retraining for all machine operators and setters. Install audible alarms that activate whenever a machine is powered on without proper LOTO certification tags. Establish daily pre-shift inspections where supervisors verify LOTO compliance on all molding machines. Link machine access to electronic tag readers that prevent operation if LOTO tags are not properly registered in the system. Track all LOTO events in a digital database and conduct monthly audits with corrective actions for non-compliance.

name: Emergency Stop Button Accessibility Program
description: Conduct a comprehensive audit of all injection molding machines to ensure emergency stop buttons are clearly visible, unobstructed, and within easy reach of operators. Install high-visibility yellow and red protective covers around emergency stops. Remove all production materials and debris from 2-foot radius around each emergency stop button. Establish a daily 5-minute walk-around inspection to verify emergency stop accessibility. Implement a maintenance schedule to test all emergency stop systems weekly and document results.

name: Production Pressure Culture Change Initiative
description: Address the root cause of LOTO bypass by establishing clear communication that safety procedures cannot be compromised to meet production deadlines. Conduct management training on leading indicators versus lagging indicators. Implement a revised production scheduling system that includes realistic timelines accounting for proper safety procedures. Establish a 'production safety bonus' program that rewards departments for zero safety incidents while meeting production targets. Hold monthly town halls where production supervisors reinforce the message that LOTO compliance is non-negotiable.

name: Hazardous Material Temperature Control System Implementation
description: Install climate-controlled storage area in the chemical storage section with temperature monitoring devices set to maintain 65-75°F range. Implement automated alert system that notifies warehouse staff via text and email if temperature deviates by more than 2 degrees from target range. Establish receiving procedure requiring all hazardous chemical deliveries to be immediately moved to climate-controlled storage before documentation verification. Install temperature data loggers on all incoming hazardous material shipments to track exposure history. Provide training to all warehouse staff on proper chemical storage protocols and identification of temperature-compromised materials.

name: Receiving Dock Procedure Enhancement
description: Revise shipping and receiving procedures to prioritize immediate offloading of hazardous materials to secure storage as the first task, before any paperwork or verification processes. Create dedicated fast-track lane for hazardous materials receiving that bypasses standard queuing. Implement accountability system where receiving dock supervisor signs off on completion of hazardous material placement within 30 minutes of arrival. Provide shade structures or covered receiving area for temporary material staging to prevent sun exposure. Conduct weekly training sessions for warehouse staff emphasizing hazardous material handling hierarchy.

name: Air Hose and Cable Management System Installation
description: Install permanent overhead cable trays and hose routing systems in all production areas to eliminate floor-level obstructions. Mark all temporary hose placements with bright yellow warning tape and establish a 48-hour maximum duration before mandatory relocation to permanent overhead routing. Create a maintenance log that documents every temporary hose installation with required removal date and responsible technician signature. Implement daily floor walkthroughs by shift supervisors to identify any hoses or cables that have migrated to walkways. Provide training to all maintenance staff on proper temporary routing protocols and consequences of non-compliance.

name: Electronic Equipment Protection Protocol
description: Install protective barriers and reinforced guards around all critical control panels and electrical systems in production areas to prevent damage from equipment contact or impacts. Relocate control panels to elevated positions away from equipment collision paths where feasible. Implement backup power systems and redundant circuit boards for mission-critical hydraulic press controls to minimize downtime if damage occurs. Establish a preventive maintenance schedule for all control systems including quarterly protective barrier inspections and documentation.

name: Implement Drum Storage Integrity Inspection Program
description: Establish a monthly inspection protocol for all hazardous material storage drums and containers to identify corrosion, rust, and structural damage. All drums showing signs of deterioration will be transferred to new containers or replaced. Inspection records will be maintained and reviewed by the HSE coordinator. This engineering and administrative control directly addresses the root cause of the spill—the corroded straps that failed during normal handling operations.

name: Upgrade Ventilation System Sensors and Response Protocol
description: Install real-time chemical vapor sensors in the mixing room with automated alerts when vapor concentrations exceed safe thresholds. Integrate with HVAC system to increase ventilation rate automatically. Train all personnel on new alarm procedures and emergency response steps. Conduct monthly sensor calibration and maintenance. This engineering control will prevent vapor inhalation injuries and provide early warning for future spills.

name: Implement Predictive Maintenance for Cooling Systems
description: Deploy vibration sensors and temperature monitoring devices on all injection molding machine cooling pump assemblies to detect bearing degradation before failure occurs. Establish alert thresholds that trigger preventive maintenance scheduling. Integrate with existing maintenance management software for automated work order generation. Train maintenance staff on sensor interpretation and response protocols. This engineering control will eliminate sudden equipment failures by enabling early detection and planned replacements during scheduled downtime.

name: Upgrade Coolant Line Containment Infrastructure
description: Install secondary containment trays beneath all high-pressure coolant lines in Injection Molding Line A to capture leaks before they reach the production floor. Add quick-disconnect fittings to allow faster isolation during emergency situations. Line all trays with absorbent mesh material rated for the coolant type used. Implement monthly inspection and material replacement procedures. This administrative and engineering control prevents slip hazards and equipment damage from coolant leaks.

name: Install Mechanical Spindle Brake Inspection and Replacement Schedule
description: Establish a quarterly preventive maintenance schedule for all CNC machine spindle brakes to ensure they operate within manufacturer specifications. Implement brake torque testing with documented records maintained in the maintenance management system. Replace any brake showing degradation before it exceeds acceptable stopping time thresholds. This engineering control eliminates the hazard by ensuring equipment functions as designed and part removal cannot occur while cutters are still rotating.

name: Implement Machine Guarding and Interlocked Access Covers
description: Install interlocked safety guards on all CNC milling machines that prevent part removal access until the spindle has completed a full stop and verified safe shutdown state. Guards will integrate with machine controllers through safety PLCs to enforce lockout conditions. Provide supplemental training to all machine operators and part handlers on new guard procedures and emergency operation protocols. This primary engineering control directly prevents hand contact with rotating components by physically blocking access.

name: Provide Enhanced Personal Protective Equipment and Work Practice Training
description: Issue cut-resistant gloves (Level 5 ANSI rating) to all personnel performing manual part removal operations from machining equipment. Conduct mandatory training on proper PPE usage, machine hazard recognition, and safe part removal techniques. Implement a work observation program where supervisors conduct monthly audits of part removal procedures to ensure compliance. This administrative control and PPE measure provides secondary protection while engineering controls are being implemented and reinforces safe work practices.

name: Implement Mandatory Cut-Resistant Glove Protocol for Mold Handling
description: Establish and enforce a workplace requirement that all employees handling molds or plastic parts with sharp edges must wear ANSI Level 3 or higher cut-resistant gloves. This includes purchasing higher-quality Nitrile-coated gloves approved for plastic handling and sharp edge contact. Conduct immediate retraining for all production operators on Line A regarding proper PPE selection and usage. Create visual signage at all mold-handling stations reminding operators of the requirement. Implement weekly compliance audits by shift supervisors and include glove compliance in the monthly safety committee meetings.

name: Establish Mold Edge Finishing Inspection Checklist
description: Create a detailed inspection checklist for the UNIT-013 Mold Manufacturing and Repair Shop to verify that all edges on molds are properly deburred and smoothed before release back to production. This checklist must include specific inspection points for sharp edges, burrs, and flash-prone areas. Implement a sign-off requirement by the mold maintenance technician and a secondary verification by a Quality Control Inspector before any mold is authorized for return to the production floor. Train all maintenance personnel on the importance of edge finishing and the proper use of deburring tools. Conduct a retroactive audit of all molds currently in use on production lines.

name: Enhance First Aid and Incident Response Training
description: Conduct a comprehensive review of first aid procedures for lacerations and implement enhanced training for all supervisors and designated first aid responders. This training will cover proper wound assessment, control of severe bleeding, infection prevention, and proper documentation. Ensure that all first aid kits on production lines contain adequate supplies for treating deep lacerations including sterile gauze, compression bandages, and antibiotic ointment. Establish a protocol for immediate escalation of serious cuts to emergency medical services and maintain a log of all cut-related incidents to identify patterns and high-risk areas.

name: Install Convex Safety Mirrors and Warning Signage at Warehouse Blind Corners
description: Install 45 cm diameter convex safety mirrors at all three major blind corners in the Warehouse and Shipping facility where forklift traffic intersects with pedestrian pathways. These mirrors will provide visibility around corners to reduce collision risks. In addition, place prominent yellow-and-black striped warning signs at each blind corner indicating 'Blind Corner - Reduce Speed' and 'Watch for Forklifts.' Paint bright yellow boundary lines on the floor leading to these intersections to alert personnel of hazardous zones. This is an engineering control that directly addresses the visibility hazard at low cost.

name: Implement Mandatory Forklift Load Height and Visibility Restrictions
description: Establish a workplace standard that forklift operators must not stack pallets higher than 1.4 meters when operating in warehouse aisles narrower than 4 meters to maintain adequate visibility. This can be enforced through training and daily pre-shift checklists. Alternatively, for taller loads, operators must move at a reduced speed (maximum 5 km/h) and use a spotter when navigating through congested areas. Implement a spotting program requiring a trained spotter to walk ahead of or beside the forklift when load height compromises visibility. Update the Forklift Operation Standard Operating Procedure and conduct retraining with all forklift operators within 14 days.

name: Upgrade Chemical Storage and Dispensing Systems with Secondary Containment
description: Replace the current bulk storage bins for mold release agents with containers equipped with secondary containment trays designed to capture any spillage before it contacts personnel. Install drip pans under all chemical transfer points and implement a pump-based dispensing system that allows controlled pouring of mold release agents without manual hand contact with the liquid. This engineering control eliminates the direct handling hazard. Ensure all containers are properly labeled with hazard symbols and include clear warnings about skin contact risks. Train all operators on the proper use of the new dispensing system and the importance of not overfilling containers.

name: Provide Chemical-Resistant Gloves and Aprons for All Material Handling Personnel
description: Issue chemical-resistant nitrile or butyl gloves to all employees working in the Material Drying and Preparation Room and ensure they are worn whenever handling mold release agents or other chemical products. Provide full-length chemical-resistant aprons to provide additional protection against accidental spills. Include these items in the daily PPE allocation and conduct a one-on-one fitting and training session with each employee to ensure proper selection and usage. Establish a monthly replacement schedule to ensure gloves remain in good condition. While this is a PPE control (lower on the hierarchy), it provides immediate protection while engineering improvements are being implemented.

name: Conduct Comprehensive WHMIS and Chemical Safety Training Refresher
description: Develop and deliver a targeted training session for all personnel in the Material Drying and Preparation Room focusing on the specific hazards of mold release agents, proper handling procedures, emergency response protocols, and the location and proper use of emergency eyewash and shower stations. Include demonstration of proper rinsing techniques (which should continue for at least 15 minutes for chemical exposure, not just 3 minutes). Create laminated reference cards for each workstation listing the emergency response steps and the CNESST emergency number. Update the WHMIS information sheets to be prominently displayed and ensure all employees understand their rights to refuse unsafe work.

name: Enhance LOTO Verification Procedures
description: Implement mandatory dual-verification lockout procedures requiring both equipment operator and maintenance technician confirmation before any maintenance work begins. Install visual LOTO status indicators on all injection molding lines and establish weekly audits of lockout device placement. Technicians must photograph LOTO placement for documentation. This will address the root cause of unexpected equipment activation by ensuring comprehensive energy isolation before maintenance commences.

name: Install Hopper Level Sensors with Auto-Shutoff
description: Deploy ultrasonic level sensors on all resin hoppers connected to automated shutoff systems that halt feed mechanisms when material exceeds safe levels. This engineering control eliminates the hazard of hopper overflow by preventing material discharge before blockages occur. Sensors will communicate with the PLC system to provide real-time monitoring and predictive maintenance alerts, reducing manual intervention requirements.

name: Implement Mandatory Part Inspection Protocol
description: Establish a quality gate system requiring 100% visual and tactile inspection of all components before they reach the packaging station. Each part must pass through a dedicated inspection station where workers use standardized checklists and wear cut-resistant gloves. Parts failing inspection are immediately reworked or scrapped. This administrative control ensures defective parts never reach handlers and creates accountability for quality standards, directly preventing sharp edge contact injuries.

name: Install Hydraulic Line Containment System
description: Design and install secondary containment trays beneath all hydraulic press connections with integrated drain systems to collection vessels. Line all hydraulic work areas with absorbent matting rated for high-temperature fluids. This engineering control eliminates bulk fluid spray by capturing leakage at the source, preventing widespread exposure. The system will include quick-disconnect couplings that automatically shut off flow when disconnected, reducing line rupture incidents by 85%.

name: Implement Quarterly Hydraulic System Pressure Relief Audits
description: Establish mandatory quarterly maintenance cycles for all pressure relief valves with documented testing at specified pressure thresholds. Each valve must be tested to ensure proper relief activation at rated pressure (±5%). Maintenance records will be tracked electronically with automatic alerts for overdue services. Non-compliant equipment will be removed from service immediately. This administrative control ensures preventive maintenance eliminates component failures before they cause incidents.

name: Mandate Thermal Burn First Aid and PPE Protocols
description: Require all maintenance personnel working with pressurized hydraulic systems to wear Kevlar-reinforced protective sleeves, thermal gloves rated to 150°C, and face shields. Conduct quarterly first aid training specifically addressing thermal burn treatment, including proper cold water immersion techniques and when to seek emergency medical care. Maintain easily accessible ice packs and sterile burn dressing kits at all hydraulic work stations.

name: Implement Mandatory LOTO Verification and Machine Interlock Restoration
description: Establish a daily pre-shift LOTO verification checklist requiring all safety interlocks on injection molding machines to be tested and documented. All bypassed interlocks must be immediately restored to operational status. Maintenance technicians will conduct daily audits of all 32 molding machines to verify safety systems are functioning. Any machine with a disabled interlock will be taken out of service until repaired and tested. This addresses the root cause of the interlock bypass and ensures consistent application of lockout procedures across all production lines.

name: Mandatory LOTO Retraining for All Production and Maintenance Staff
description: Conduct comprehensive lockout/tagout retraining for all production technicians and maintenance staff within two weeks. Training will include real-world scenarios specific to injection molding equipment, consequences of bypassing safety interlocks, and the legal/regulatory requirements under CNESST guidelines. Competency assessments will be administered, and only certified personnel will be authorized to perform maintenance troubleshooting. Annual refresher training will be mandated with documented completion records.

name: Install Machine Status Indicator Lights and Communication System
description: Install audible alarm systems and warning lights on all injection molding machines indicating when the machine is in maintenance mode or has been locked out. Implement a radio communication system requiring verbal confirmation between the technician performing maintenance and the operator before any machine restart. This engineering control prevents accidental machine activation during maintenance and provides redundant safety communication between team members.

name: Install Automated Material Handling Equipment in Warehouse
description: Procure and install electric pallet jacks and low-level height adjustable shelving systems to eliminate manual lifting of loads exceeding 25 kg in the warehouse. Implement strict load limits of maximum 20 kg for manual handling. All resin pellet storage will be repositioned to accommodate mechanical lift assistance. This engineering control eliminates the primary hazard and aligns with CNESST ergonomic requirements. Training will be provided on proper use of new equipment.

name: Comprehensive Ergonomics Training and Work Practice Modification
description: Deliver mandatory ergonomics training to all warehouse and material handling staff covering proper lifting techniques, load assessment, and use of mechanical aids. Establish a two-person team requirement for any load exceeding 15 kg. Implement rotation schedules to reduce repetitive strain. Conduct workstation assessments and modify layouts to minimize bending and lifting. Assessment findings will be documented and shared with employees. Training will occur quarterly with competency assessments.

name: Replace and Upgrade Chemical Transfer Equipment
description: Replace all existing gravity-fed chemical transfer hoses and connectors with certified spill-prevention transfer systems that include secondary containment and automatic shut-off valves. Install drip containment trays under all transfer stations with minimum 120% capacity of the largest container being transferred. Implement monthly inspection and certification of all transfer equipment. This engineering control eliminates the equipment failure root cause and prevents environmental release of hazardous materials.

name: Implement Chemical Spill Response Training and Immediate Notification Protocol
description: Establish mandatory chemical spill response training for all employees handling hazardous materials, emphasizing immediate notification procedures even for minor spills. Create laminated emergency response cards posted at each chemical handling station with supervisor contact numbers and spill response steps. Institute a zero-tolerance policy for delayed spill reporting with documented consequences. Conduct quarterly drills simulating spill scenarios. All employees must complete training within 30 days with documented competency verification.

name: Install Spill Detection and Automated Alert System
description: Install floor-level moisture sensors and chemical detection devices in the Chemical Storage and Mixing area that automatically trigger audible alarms and notify supervisors when liquid is detected on the floor. Integrate with the facility's environmental monitoring system to track spill volume and chemical type. This administrative/engineering hybrid control ensures rapid detection and response to spills regardless of employee presence or alertness, preventing environmental release into drainage systems.

name: Implement Warehouse Aisle Clearance Protocol
description: Establish and enforce a daily 15-minute warehouse aisle inspection at the start of each shift to ensure no pallets or equipment obstruct pedestrian walkways or forklift pathways. Create visual floor markings using high-visibility yellow tape to designate forklift routes separate from pedestrian walking paths. Install convex mirror at the blind corner where the incident occurred and conduct safety training for all material handlers on the new protocol within 5 days.

name: Enhanced Forklift Operation Training
description: Mandate that all forklift operators, including Kwesi, complete a 4-hour advanced operator certification course focusing on load stability, turning dynamics, and emergency maneuvers. Include scenario-based training on navigating blind corners and shared workspaces. Certification must be renewed annually with competency assessments. Training to be conducted by an external certified instructor within 14 days.

name: Establish Chemical Storage Compliance Audit Schedule
description: Implement a monthly documented audit of all chemical storage locations, conducted by Natasha Ivanov and witnessed by a member of the JHSC. The audit will verify compliance with MSDS requirements for temperature, proximity to heat sources, and proper labeling. All audit findings will be documented in the Safety Management System and any non-compliance will trigger immediate corrective action. First audit to be scheduled within 7 days of incident declaration.

name: Facility Layout Update and Communication Protocol
description: Create updated facility layout drawings showing revised chemical storage zones, heat source locations, and exclusion zones. Distribute these to all relevant personnel including maintenance, production, and quality staff. Establish a procedure requiring that any equipment relocation or facility modification must trigger an automated notification to HSE and Materials Management teams. Conduct a 1-hour facility orientation session for all personnel working in UNIT-013 to ensure awareness of updated storage requirements. Implementation within 10 days.

name: Install Machine Shaft Guarding Enhancement
description: All rotating shafts on injection molding machines that are accessible during normal cleaning operations shall be fitted with additional fixed perimeter guards (1/4-inch steel mesh or equivalent) to create a minimum 75mm exclusion zone. These guards must be installed on all 32 injection molding machines within 21 days. Guards must be designed to prevent access to rotating components while maintaining visibility for inspection. Engineering will specify guard material and design; Maintenance (UNIT-012) will perform installation. Cost includes material, labor, and testing.

name: Implement Machine Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) for Cleaning Operations
description: Revise the Injection Molding Equipment Cleaning Standard Operating Procedure to require mandatory LOTO procedures before any technician begins cleaning work. All energy sources (electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic) must be isolated and tagged. Only the responsible technician may remove their LOTO tag. Provide 2-hour LOTO refresher training to all technicians within 7 days. Post LOTO requirement signage on all molding machines and establish a checklist system for verification. This eliminates the root cause of residual mechanical motion.

name: Upgrade Personal Protective Equipment for Technicians
description: Provide all molding technicians with cut-resistant gloves (ANSI Level 5 rating) and reinforced work gloves designed specifically for machine operation environments. These gloves must be impact-resistant and offer better mechanical grip to reduce accidental contact with rotating components. Additionally, issue specialized finger cots or protective finger sleeves to technicians working on equipment with documented pinch points. Conduct fitting and training within 5 days. This is a secondary control to the engineering and administrative measures.

name: Implement Workstation Ergonomic Assessment Program
description: Conduct comprehensive ergonomic evaluation of all assembly workstations in UNIT-019 using validated assessment tools (RULA/REBA methodology). Implement adjustable workbenches, anti-fatigue mats, and wrist supports. Establish mandatory 10-minute breaks every 2 hours for repetitive assembly tasks. Provide staff training on proper body mechanics and early warning signs of repetitive strain injuries. Document all workstation modifications and train supervisors on ergonomic best practices.

name: Establish Job Rotation Schedule for Repetitive Tasks
